225.name: Chaos rune
225.content:
{{External|rsc=Chaos-Rune|os}}
{{Redirect3|Chaos|For the title, see [[cHaOs]]. For other uses, see [[Chaos (disambiguation)]]}}
{{Official world|name=RC Running & ZMI Altar|p2p=36}}

[[File:Chaos rune detail.png|100px|left]]
The '''chaos rune''' is a [[Runes|rune]] used for some [[Curse spells]] and requires [[pure essence]] to be crafted. Respawning chaos runes can be found in the north-western {{floornumber|1}} room of the [[Dark Warriors' Fortress]] in the [[Wilderness]], or near the [[moss giant]]s in the level 40 Wilderness.

Chaos runes can also be made by members through the [[Runecrafting]] [[skill]] (at least 35 Runecrafting needed) at the [[Chaos altar]] at level 9 Wilderness. A [[chaos talisman]], [[chaos tiara]] or [[chaos talisman staff]] is required to enter. Alternatively, an [[omni-talisman]], [[omni-tiara]], [[omni-talisman staff]] or [[wicked hood]] may be used. Upon entering, players will find themselves in a complicated maze in which they will have to find their way through in order to craft their runes. Another way of entering is through the statue of [[Saradomin]] north-east of [[Varrock]] and through the [[Tunnel of Chaos]] to the portal, which requires the talisman or tiara. This is only accessible during or after completing the [[What Lies Below]] quest. A player receives 8.5 [[experience]] points per chaos rune crafted. A common way to craft chaos runes via the [[Abyss]] is to go through the rift in the Abyss, walk or run back to [[Edgeville]] (due to the close proximity), then start again.

In [[Dungeoneering]], chaos runes can be crafted, although they can only be used in the dungeon and give 0.17 experience per essence. [[Free-to-play|Free players]] can also craft chaos runes while in [[Daemonheim]].

==Trivia==
* Chaos runes are likely associated with [[Zamorak]], as he is the god of chaos.
* Prior to [[26 December]] [[2009]], chaos runes cost as much as 190 coins, but fell in price after [[TzHaar]] shops stopped buying items.
* Before the [[Evolution of Combat]] update, chaos runes were used in [[bolt spells]] and various [[Ancient Magicks]] spells. After this update, their usage is very limited.

1824.name: Soul rune
1824.content:
{{External|os|rsc=Soul-Rune}}
{{Other uses|the rune}}
{{Official world|name=RC Running & ZMI Altar|p2p=36}}
{{Infobox Item
|name = Soul rune
|image = [[File:Soul rune.png]]
|release = [[23 October]] [[2002]]
|update = Updates galore!
|members = Yes

|exchange = gemw
|examine = Used for powerful curse spells.
|weight = 0
|id = 566
}}
[[File:Soul rune detail.png|left|100px]]
The '''soul rune''' is the highest level [[runes|rune]] in ''[[RuneScape]]''. It is used for the strongest [[curses|curse]] spells, the [[Teleportation#Tele-other spells|teleport-other spells]], and the [[Ancient Magicks#Seren spells|Seren spells]] in the Ancient Magicks book. 

They can be crafted at the [[soul altar]] accessed from [[Menaphos Imperial district]] after completing the quest [['Phite Club]] with a level of 90 [[Runecrafting]]. Alternatively, they have a chance to be crafted when using the [[Ourania Runecrafting Altar]] which has no level requirement.

They can also be bought from the [[Magic Guild]] in [[Yanille]], [[Ali's Discount Wares]] in [[Al Kharid]] (after completing the [[Rogue Trader]] achievement), or [[Baba Yaga]], who lives in the walking house, on [[Lunar Isle]]. 

The runes can be claimed from the [[wicked hood]] provided it has been fed a [[soul talisman]] or [[Soul tiara|tiara]] first.

==Creation==
The mechanics of crafting soul runes vastly differ from the standard runecrafting process. The [[soul altar]] must first be charged by depositing [[pure essence]] into the [[Charger (Soul altar)|charger]]. 4 essences generate 1 charge and give 10 Runecrafting experience. 5 charges can be used to create 12 soul runes. This means it takes 5 essences to make 3 soul runes. The experience gained is 220 per charge or 91.7 per soul rune crafted.

The charger has a capacity of 100 ''essences'', after which they must be converted into ''charges''. The altar can hold up to 100 charges, after which they must be crafted as runes.

To maximise the experience gained, the 250% experience boost from the [[Abyss]] (thus the [[demonic skull]] too) applies to the runecrafting step. Up to 100 charges grant 22,000 XP, which can be further multiplied by 2.5 to 55,000 XP by binding a fully charged altar to at least 240 soul runes.

}}

* Before the release of Menaphos on 5 June 2017, soul runes were the only conventional type of rune that could not be [[Runecrafting|crafted]] using a normal [[Runecrafting altars|Runecrafting altar]]. The only way to craft soul runes was by using the [[Ourania Runecrafting Altar]].
* Upon release of the soul altar, soul runes were mistakenly listed as requiring level 90 [[Invention]] to craft, instead of level 90 Runecrafting.

3129.name: Swordfish
3129.content:
{{External|rsc|os|wp}}
{{RCFood}}
{{Otheruses|def=no|the item used in the quest [[Hunt for Red Raktuber]]|Swordfish (Hunt for Red Raktuber)}}{{Otheruses|def=no|the item named Swordy|Swordy McSwordFace}}

[[File:Swordfish detail.png|left|90px]]
A '''swordfish''' is a type of fish that players can catch, cook, and use as [[food]]. They are the best fish that can be cooked in [[free-to-play]], and considered the best f2p healing food as they can heal up to 1400 life points in one bite.

{{Food calculator|base=56}}

A number of items can heal more in one slot, but all with their limitations:

*[[Bottle of wine]] heals 1500, but is untradeable, has limited supply and temporarily lowers the player's Attack level
*[[Kebab]], which heals depending on random chance
*[[Cheese wheel]] that requires slicing and many bites of [[cheese]]
*[[Biscuits]] are stackable, but takes many bites
*[[Undercooked mystery meat]], which are untradeable and can only be obtained as a drop, and only heals more when life points are boosted above 10,000
*[[RS Anniversary cake]] and [[20th Anniversary cake]] heal 2200, but they can only be eaten at certain times of year and have a cooldown period
*[[Anchovy pizza]] heals 1474 total versus 1450 for swordfish with [[expensive spices]], but takes 2 bites

They are also a possible reward from [[clue scroll (medium)|level 2 clue scrolls]].

At level 55 [[Divination]] members can weave 40 [[gleaming energy]] with one swordfish to create a [[portent of restoration VI]] or an [[attuned portent of restoration VI]] at 57 Divination, which heal 1050 or 1400 life points respectively. Members with level 55 [[Herblore]] can also add a swordfish to a [[harralander potion (unf)]] to create a [[cooking potion]], which boosts a player's [[Cooking]] level by three.

==Fishing==
Players can catch swordfish with a minimum level of 50 in [[Fishing]], granting 100 Fishing [[experience]] per catch. Fishing for swordfish takes a longer amount of time than [[lobster]]s because [[tuna]] is caught along with them.

[[Raw swordfish]] can be fished from the sea with a [[harpoon]] (in your [[tool belt]] or inventory, wielding a [[barb-tailed harpoon]] is another possibility) in various locations, such as [[Catherby]], [[Musa point]], and the [[Fishing Guild]]. When harpoon fishing, it is very likely that more tuna will be caught than swordfish. With a [[19 January]] [[2010]] [[Update:Agility Benefits for Fishing, Hunter and Thieving|update]], a high Agility level may allow two swordfish to be caught at once, although experience is only gained for a single one. However, when doing a task to catch swordfish, catching two counts towards two.

[[Barbarian Fishing]] is another possible option when fishing for swordfish. Hand fishing gives an extra 10 [[Strength]] experience for each swordfish, and requires level 70 Fishing and level 50 Strength. Contrary to popular belief, barehanded fishing is not slower than fishing with a harpoon. The only difference resides in the awarded Strength experience when fishing barehanded.

==Creation==
{{Infobox Recipe
|members = No
|ticks = 4
|facility = Range, Fire
|skill1 = Cooking
|skill1lvl = 45
|skill1boostable = 
|skill1exp = 140
|noburnlevel = 86
|gauntlets = 80
|mat1 = Raw swordfish
|output1 = Swordfish
|output1alt = Burnt swordfish
}}

Swordfish can also be cooked with a minimum level 45 in [[Cooking]], granting 140 Cooking [[experience]], or with the bonfire cooking bonus 154 cooking experience. Players can accidentally burn swordfish while cooking until they reach level 86 in Cooking, or until level 80 when using [[cooking gauntlets]].

At Cooking level 45, cooking swordfish yields an 80% burn rate; therefore, it is not recommended that players cook swordfish until their level is 60 or above. If you do not mind burning a moderate number of swordfish, level 50 Cooking yields a burn rate of approximately 30%. At 67 Cooking using a [[range]], you will burn about 20% (98/500) of the swordfish. At 80 Cooking using a range, you will burn about 5.7% (28/493) of the swordfish (0 to 4 burnt in each inventory). Using cooking gauntlets at Cooking level 80, you will burn approximately 0.2% of the swordfish. At 80 Cooking using logs, you will burn about 8.7% (45/516) of the swordfish (0 to 7 burnt in each inventory).

==Products==
{{Uses material list|Swordfish}}

==Item sources==
{{Drop sources|Swordfish}}

===Shop locations===
{{Shop locations list|Swordfish}}

==Economic impact==
Swordfish has generally been a popular trading item among merchants in the [[Grand Exchange]]. Demand for swordfish has been consistently high as it is the highest-healing [[free-to-play]] fish. With the [[Update:Slayer Challenges|introduction]] of [[Stiles]] on [[21 April]] [[2010]], free-to-play players can fish and bank Swordfish between 3 and 4 times faster than before. This has led to a substantial increase in the supply of swordfish and therefore a dramatic decrease in their price, from 500 coins to around 300 coins. Swordfish is now in high supply, and is much more affordable than it was prior to the update. In addition, the price of swordfish fell to record lows after the [[Update:The Wilderness and Free Trade Return!|Return of Free Trade]], to about 150 gold.

However, following [[Bot-Nuking Day]]/[[ClusterFlutterer]], the supply of swordfish from botting severely decreased which resulted in swordfish prices rising to over 350 gold. After the[[Evolution of Combat]]update, prices have suffered variations, that gradually lowered its market value, set to 170-180 gp at the GE. Since legacy mode was introduced, there has been an increase in the price of swordfish because many players started PKing again and, as it is the highest healing food in f2p, people started buying more of them, set to around 340 gp at the GE. After a brief spike at the end of 2016, the price of swordfish began to slowly decline to its current value.

[[File:Cadava berries detail.png|left|70px]]
'''Cadava berries''' are berries which can harvested from a player-grown [[cadavaberry bush]] or [[Cadava bush (Varrock)|cadava bushes]] found near [[Varrock]].

Farmers will watch over a planted [[cactus]] in exchange for six cadava berries. Additionally, farmers will watch over a planted [[fly trap seed]] in exchange for fifteen cadava berries.

==Farming==
Cadava berries can be harvested from cadavaberry bushes grown within a [[bush patch]]. A fully grown cadavaberry bush can grow up to four cadava berries at a time. Each cadava berry, when picked, gives 7 [[Farming]] experience. Once all four cadava berries have been picked, the bush will slowly produce more cadava berries until four more are available again. However, the cadava berries may be picked individually provided that at least one appears on the bush.

==Trivia==
* Prior to the Varrock graphic update, cadava berries merely laid on the ground and could be picked up by players.
** After [[Varrock]] was graphically updated, cadava berries were changed to instead be growing on bushes. They are interactive scenery, and as such, do not appear on the minimap as the items once did.
* The [[Wise Old Man]] will occasionally request cadava berries for [[Wise Old Man/Tasks|his tasks]]. 
* The name "Cadava" is a play on "cadaver," another word for a corpse, and sounds similar to the word when spoken with a non-rhotic (British English) accent. It was named after its effect, which causes people to appear dead after consumption.
* Cadava berries were once needed during the [[Romeo & Juliet]] quest to make a [[cadava potion]], obtained by giving the berries to the [[apothecary]]. Despite the removal of Romeo & Juliet, the potion can still be created by taking cadava berries to the apothecary, but it no longer has any practical use.
** When [[Romeo & Juliet]] still existed, trying to use a cadava potion on Juliet after the quest would prompt her to say "I'm not drinking that again!"

'''White berries''' are berries harvested from a whiteberry bush. They are grown by planting a [[whiteberry seed]] in a [[bush patch]], requiring level 59 [[Farming]]. Each whiteberry bush yields a maximum of four white berries at a time. 

White berries are required to craft [[Super defence potion]]s. 

==Farming==
White berries can be harvested from [[whiteberry bush]]es grown within a [[bush patch]]. A fully grown whiteberry bush can grow up to four white berries at a time. Each white berry, when picked, gives 29 [[Farming]] experience. Once all four white berries have been picked, the bush will slowly produce more white berries. However, the white berries may be picked individually provided that at least one appears on the bush.

An '''attack potion''' is made by mixing [[clean guam]] into a [[vial of water]] and then adding [[eye of newt]]. This gives 25 [[herblore]] [[experience]], and requires level 1 [[Herblore]] (used to be 3 before the overhaul of [[Druidic Ritual]]). It is therefore the most basic of potions and is often made by players who have just started training Herblore.

Using an attack potion will temporarily raise the player's [[Attack]] by 1-8 (1 + 8% of Attack level), rounded down. If the player adds [[roe]] to a 2-dose potion then it will become a 2-dose [[attack mix]] which heals 300 [[life points]]. Using an attack potion will not allow you to use higher level equipment. For example, if you have an attack of 39, and you use an attack potion, you will not be able to wield adamant weapons. Attack potions became free to play in March 2013.

A better alternative to using attack potions for combat are buying [[combat potion]]s. They give the bonuses of both a [[strength potion]] and attack potion in only one item slot and are cheaper, only costing {{GEP|Combat potion (3)}} coins for 3 doses.

An attack potion can be made into an [[Attack flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[Potion flask]]. An attack potion (4) is also an ingredient in a [[Grand attack potion]], one of the [[combination potions]].

'''Relicym's balm''' is a potion made by mixing a [[rogue's purse potion (unf)]] and a [[clean snake weed]]. It requires level 8 [[Herblore]] and completion of the [[Zogre Flesh Eaters]] quest to the point where [[Sithik Ints]] tells the player how to cure the zogre disease. It is of limited benefit outside of the quest, having no use other than in the [[Tai Bwo Wannai Cleanup]] [[minigame]], where it is the preferred weapon to use against Orange [[broodoo victim]]s, as it can deal over 250 damage to them.

Besides being available on the [[Grand Exchange]], players may also purchase 3 dose potions from [[Uglug Nar]] for 200 [[coins]] once they've learned how to make the potion. To open [[Uglug Nar]]'s store, simply give him a 3 or 4 dose Relicym's balm potion, for which he will pay 650 or 1000 coins respectively. Uglug will buy these potions from players for 120 coins as well if he has none in stock, but it must be a 3 dose potion for him to make an offer.

With [[Barbarian Training]], adding [[roe]] to a 2 dose potion turns it into a [[relicym's mix]] which heals 300 life points in addition to the above effects.

This potion can be made into a [[relicym's balm flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

A '''restore potion''' restores 10 to 39 levels in [[Defence]], [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Magic]], and [[Ranged]] when the level in one of these skills has been temporarily reduced. It restores each [[stats|stat]] by 10 + 30% of the player's level in that stat, unless that would put the user's stat(s) as higher than their level in that skill.

Members can make a restore potion by using [[clean harralander]] on a [[vial of water]] and then adding [[red spiders' eggs]]. This requires level 22 [[Herblore]] and grants 62.5 Herblore experience. Adding [[roe]] or [[caviar]] to a 2-dose potion will turn it into a 2-dose [[restore mix]] which heals 300 [[life points]].

Because this potion is [[members]]-only, there's no way to quickly restore stats in [[free-to-play]] other than [[Rejuvenate]], which can only be activated once every five minutes and requires a [[shield]]. Dying will quickly reset stats and is best done near a player's respawn location unless they are carrying three or fewer items (four with the [[Protect Item]] prayer; see [[Self-injury]]).

A [[super restore]] potion also restores Summoning and Prayer points, neither of which a normal restore potion can do.

'''Defence potions''' are made by mixing [[clean marrentill]] and then [[bear fur]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 45 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires Herblore level 9. They temporarily raise your defence level by 1-8 (1 + 8% of your defence level, rounded down).

They can be bought at the [[Warriors' Guild Potion Shop]] for 880 coins.

Defence potions (1) can sometimes be found inside [[Barrel (interactive scenery)|barrels]].

Defence potions (3) are a rare loot from a [[young impling]] or a [[young impling jar]].

A defence potion (4) is an ingredient in a [[grand defence potion]], one of the [[combination potions]].

This potion can be made into an [[Defence flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

Defence potions became free to play in March 2013.

{{Combat Potion Boost Table|8|1|class=mw-collapsible mw-collapsed}}

An '''Agility potion''' is a [[potions|potion]] made via the [[Herblore]] skill. Level 34 Herblore is required to make it. Drinking a dose will temporarily raise the player's [[Agility]] level by 3. Players can make an agility potion by adding [[clean toadflax]] to a [[vial of water]] and then adding [[toad's legs]], which gives 80 herblore [[experience]].

This potion is useful at the [[Brimhaven Agility Arena]], where there are dart obstacles that temporarily lower a player's Agility level by 2 if failed. Drinking this potion will restore some of the player's Agility level without waiting for it to return to normal.

Alternatively players may wish to use it to utilise a shortcut which they otherwise wouldn't be able to access. This potion is also used in the quest, [[Tai Bwo Wannai Trio]].

This potion or another agility raising item ''cannot'' be used to access some areas such as the [[Ape Atoll Agility Course]] if the player's base level does not meet the requirement. The game will state "Your agility boost won't help you here." It can, however, be used to access the [[Wilderness Agility Course]].

[[God banner]] can be a good substitute for agility potions as it offers a constant +5 Agility boost over 30 minutes per day.

The '''prayer potion''' is a potion made with [[Herblore]] that restores 72 to 317 [[Prayer]] points (70 + 25% of total Prayer points) per dose.

[[Pay-to-play|Members]] can make a prayer potion at level 38 Herblore by adding a [[clean ranarr]] to a [[vial of water]] and then mixing in [[snape grass]]. This makes a potion with three doses and grants 87.5 Herblore experience.

Prayer potions are almost always in high demand due in large part to the common use of prayers in [[combat]]. Having a way of restoring Prayer points in the middle of battle, without the need of an [[altar]], is very convenient. While there are many stronger potions that restore more points, a prayer potion is often among the cheapest options, other than a [[super prayer renewal potion]], and is the only one available to non-members. However, members should opt to use [[super restore]]s, since they are cheaper and provide 10 more prayer points.

For players who have completed [[Rum Deal]] and have a [[holy wrench]] in their pocket slot, 10 to 30 additional prayer points will be restored per dose of prayer potion. Unfortunately, for the wrench to provide more prayer than an additional prayer potion would have, a player must have both nearly a full inventory of prayer potions and a prayer level of at most around 60.

Assuming the player purchases [[ranarr potion (unf)]] and [[snape grass]], 2,200 prayer potions can be made per hour, giving approximately 192,500 experience per hour. 

Adding [[wyvern bonemeal]] will make a [[super prayer]] potion. Alternatively, a 4-dose prayer potion can be combined with a 4-dose [[prayer renewal]] in a [[crystal flask]] to create a [[super prayer renewal potion]].

This potion can be made into a [[prayer flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

'''Super attack''' potions are made by mixing a [[clean irit]] and then an [[eye of newt]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 100 [[Herblore]] experience. Mixing requires level 45 Herblore, but may be made at level 44 Herblore if a player drinks [[Greenman's ale]], or at level 43 when a player drinks [[Greenman's ale (m)]]. This potion is commonly used with [[super strength]] potions for training and boss fights.

Using a super attack potion temporarily raises the player's [[Attack]] level by 2-13 (2 + 12% of level, rounded down). Using this potion does not grant the player the ability to wield weapons above their base attack level.

A super attack potion (3) is an ingredient for making [[extreme attack]] potions, along with a [[clean avantoe]]. A super attack potion (4) is an ingredient in a [[Grand attack potion]], one of the [[combination potions]].

Along with all other combat super potions and a regular [[overload]], it is an ingredient for making [[supreme overload potion]]s.

'''Super defence''' potions are made by adding [[clean cadantine]] then [[white berries]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 150 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 66 [[Herblore]]. Using a super defence potion temporarily raises the player's [[Defence]] level by 2-13 (2 + 12% of Defence level, rounded down).

The super defence potion is also an ingredient for making [[extreme defence]] potions, along with a [[clean lantadyme]], requiring 90 herblore.

A super defence potion (4) combined with a [[defence potion (4)]]  in a [[crystal flask]] will produce a [[grand defence]] potion, one of the [[combination potions]] requiring 79 herblore. 

Along with all other combat super potions and a regular [[overload]], it is an ingredient for making [[supreme overload potion]]s.

This potion does not allow players to equip items they could not otherwise equip.

[[File:Redberries detail.png|left|75px]]
'''Redberries''' are berries harvested from a [[redberry bush (Farming)|redberry bush]] planted in a [[bush patch]], requiring level 10 [[Farming]]. 4 redberries can be harvested from a bush patch at a time. There are also two wild [[redberry bush]]es southeast of Varrock, which only yield 2 redberries each before they need to regrow.

Redberries are required to craft [[uncooked berry pie]]s and [[ranging potion]]s. Players can also take 3 redberries and 5 [[coins]] to [[Aggie]], or 3 redberries and 25 [[coins]] to [[Rana the dyer]], to make [[red dye]].

==Farming==
Redberries can be harvested from [[redberry bush (Farming)|redberry bush]]es grown within a [[bush patch]]. A fully grown redberry bush can grow up to 4 redberries at a time. Each redberry, when picked, gives 4.5 [[Farming]] experience. Once all have been picked, the bush will slowly produce more redberries until 4 more are available again. However, the redberries may be picked individually provided that at least one appears on the bush.

* Redberries are analogous to the real-life redcurrant.{{CitePostbag | issue=46| letter=Letter 4| author=Adam Roy Norgs}}
* Prior to the removal of the quest, redberries were used to make a [[paste]] during [[Prince Ali Rescue]].

'''Clean ranarr''' (pronounced ''Ran-ARR'') is a [[grimy ranarr]] that has been cleaned. It is the fifth lowest level [[herb]] available and can be made into [[Ranarr potion (unf)]] and then into [[Prayer potion]]s.

{{UH|
* {{UL|type=update|update=Latest RuneScape News (27 February 2002)|date=27 February 2002}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* On [[20 August]] [[2009]], a large price-manipulation clan bought out ranarrs, ranarr potions, prayer potions, and super restore potions. This resulted in a large spike in price, and consequently  rants on the forums. This only lasted 4 days, and in those 4 days, the price of ranarr herbs went up 5,000-6,000 [[Coins|gp]].
* Ranarr herbs were originally known as 'Ranarr weed'. The date on which they were changed is unknown. Some NPCs still refer to ranarr as ranarr weed. They were also referred as ranarr weed when cleaning them.
* It was once a highly-traded herb due to the widespread use of [[Prayer potion]]s around the 2006 era. However, [[Super restore]]s became more useful, as they counteracted other potions, restored [[Summoning]] points, and were more effective than Prayer potions at higher levels. As ranarr does not have other uses than prayer potions, these factors have lead to a decline in its price.

'''Clean marrentill''' is a [[grimy marrentill]] that has been cleaned. It is the third lowest level herb available. It is used in the [[Herblore]] skill, for making [[Defence potion]]s and [[Antipoison]]. Clean marrentill is also used while training [[Prayer]], both to light the [[chapel#Lamps|incense burners]] of an [[chapel#Altar|altar]], and to create [[auto-sanctifier]]s.

A '''super restore potion''', or '''super restore''', is a potion that restores a portion of all player [[stats]] that have been lowered. Members with 63 [[Herblore]] can make a super restore potion by mixing a [[clean snapdragon]] in a [[vial of water]] and adding [[red spiders' eggs]], giving 142.5 [[experience]]. A super restore can be made into a [[super restore flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. The super restore potion is also used as an ingredient in a [[Sanfew serum]] and [[replenishment potion]].

Per dose, a super restore potion restores 25% + 8 of the player's basic maximum level in each of the affected skills, rounded down. For example, a player with 84 Thieving and 63 Smithing would have 29 Thieving levels and 23 Smithing levels restored per dose.

For [[Prayer]] points, the potion restores 80 + 25% of the maximum points (10 more points per dose than a [[prayer potion]]). At 99 Prayer, it will restore 327 points. A [[holy wrench]] in the player's inventory will add 10 to 30 additional points to the Prayer restoration, and the effect can be further enhanced by the [[reverence aura]].

Super restore potions do not restore:

* [[life points]], although they can restore [[Constitution]] lowered by the [[Barrelchest Mk II]] in [[A Clockwork Syringe]], [[The Magister]], and [[TzKal-Zuk]]
* Summoning familiars' [[Special moves|special move]] points, although both Summoning level and [[Summoning points]] are restored
* [[energy|run energy]]; an [[energy potion]] would be more appropriate for this purpose.

'''Fishing potions''' are made by mixing [[clean avantoe|avantoe]] and [[snape grass]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 112.5 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 50 Herblore.

Fishing potions temporarily raise a player's [[Fishing]] level by 3; fishing level drops by 1 each minute.

Players may use fishing potions to enter the fishing guild if they don't meet the requirement. They may also use it to catch fish they don't meet the level requirement for.

This potion raises the player's chance of catching a fish when used.

'''Super antipoison''' potions are made by mixing [[clean irit]] and [[unicorn horn dust]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 106.3 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 48 Herblore. Super antipoison potions cure [[poison]] and provide a longer immunity than regular [[antipoison]] potions. They reduce poison damage by 100% for 6 minutes.

The [[Varanusaur (player-owned farm)|varanusaur]] envenomed perk gives a 10% chance to make 4 doses instead of 3 doses when mixing Weapon Poison or Antipoison potions.

This potion is a secondary ingredient in making [[supreme overload salve]]s, [[overload salve]]s, and [[Elder overload salve|elder overload salves]], along with [[antifire]]s, [[super antifire]]s, [[prayer potion]]s, and [[prayer renewal]]s.

A one-dose vial of this potion can be found on the floor of a worn-down house in the small goblin settlement north-east of the [[Observatory]], south of [[Greasycheeks]], [[Smellytoes]], and [[Creakyknees]]. It respawns once every 49 seconds.

Players will get a warning in their chatbox when the potion is about to wear off: {{RSFont|Your resistance to poison is about to expire.}} Then they will get another message when it has worn off, approximately 15 seconds after the initial warning: {{RSFont|Your resistance to poison has expired.}}

This potion can be made into a [[super antipoison flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

'''Super energy''' potions are made by mixing [[clean avantoe]] and then [[Mort myre fungi]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 117.5 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 52 Herblore. Super energy (3) is also an ingredient for [[adrenaline potion]]s and [[Stamina potion]]s.

Making super energy potions can be a fast but sometimes expensive method to train Herblore. Based on the [[RuneScape:Grand Exchange Market Watch|Grand Exchange Market Watch]] prices, the current cost to purchase clean avantoe, mort myre fungus, and vial of water would be {{formatnum:{{#expr: {{GEP|Clean avantoe}} + {{GEP|Mort myre fungus}} + {{GEP|Vial of water}} }}}} coins. The profit made by selling 3-dose super energy potions made using the ingredients bought from the Grand Exchange would be {{formatnum:{{#expr: {{GEP|Super energy (3)}} - {{GEP|Clean avantoe}} - {{GEP|Mort myre fungus}} - {{GEP|Vial of water}} }}}} coins.

Super energy potions recover 40% of a player's [[Energy|run energy]] per dose. [[Mint cake]]s are a viable alternative to super energy potions, since they restore 100% energy in one click.

'''Weapon poison''' requires level 60 [[Herblore]] to make. It is made by mixing [[clean kwuarm]] and [[dragon scale dust]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 137.5 Herblore experience. It is the weakest variant of [[Weapon poison (disambiguation)|weapon poison]]. 

Previous to the addition of [[Evolution of Combat]], Weapon poison was applied directly to specific weapons. It is now a buff on the player that applies a poison effect to enemies no matter what weapon or style of combat is used.

Applying weapon poison will give you a 12.5% chance per hit to [[poison]] your opponent(s) in combat. The poison effect appears as a buff and lasts for 2.5 minutes, dealing between 1326% of your [[ability damage]] per hit. This deals poison damage on the first application and renews the poison duration. Poison will hit every 10 seconds and wear off after 3 minutes.

When paired with [[cinderbane gloves]], weapon poison will have its base poison damage increased from 50 to 100 and the poison will process more often than using either of them separately.{{CiteGeneral|url=https://imgur.com/LseCyNx|title=Message in #ranch-out-of-time channel of official RuneScape Discord server|author=Mod Breezy|date=12 November 2019|accessdate=5 November 2020|publisher=Discord|archiveurl=https://archive.md/EUJlz|archivedate=26 February 2023|quote=yeah they affect base poison damage too so the "scalar" in code is like; tier 1 poison - 50; tier 2 - 100; tier 3 - 150; tier 4 - 200; tier 5 - 250; the current highest is weapon poison++ at tier 3 PLUS cinders = tier 4; with the update, wep pois+++will allow it to go to tier 5 with cinders}}

This potion can be made into an [[weapon poison flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

It is dropped by [[warped tortoise]]s and [[shadow warrior]]s. It also can be a reward from [[Observatory Quest]].

A three dose weapon poison is required to restore a [[Yurkolgokh stink grenade (damaged)]].

==Update history==
{{UH|
* {{UL|type=hidden|update=Requiem For a Dragon Launch - This Week In RuneScape|date=22 April 2024}}
** The older, unconverted variant of the 3-dose potion has been renamed from "Weapon poison" to "Weapon poison (3)".

* {{UL|type=ninja|update=This Week In RuneScape: Scattershot Ninja Strike|date=17 January 2022}}
** Replaced an old version of weapon poison drops on various NPCs with the correct version of weapon poison.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=This Week In RuneScape: Rex Matriarchs & Combat Week!|date=19 April 2021}}
** Fixed an issue on weapon poison potions of all tiers that incorrectly stated the chance to apply poison was 15%. The tooltip has been adjusted to match the correct value of 12.5%.

* {{UL|type=patch|update= Patch Notes (9 December 2019)|date=9 December 2019}}
** Weapon Poison potions will no longer instantly run out when used in conjunction with Lantadyme Incense sticks.
** Weapon poison can be applied in the bank interface.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (3 June 2019)|date=3 June 2019}}
** Clicking the make option on a vial of Coconut milk will now default to make weapon poison rather than more coconut milk. Effectively, you can now put the lime in the coconut.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (16 October 2017)|date=16 October 2017}}
** Antifire, weapon poison, aggression potion and wilder pie effects no longer stay active on free worlds.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (23 November 2015)|date=23 November 2015}}
** Teleporting no longer removes weapon poison.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (8 June 2015)|date=8 June 2015}}
** Applying weapon poison no longer displays the message that you drank it.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (27 May 2014)|date=27 May 2014}}
** A bug where all versions of Weapon poison were lasting for 5 minutes has been fixed. Weapon poison now lasts for 1 minute and Weapon poison++ now lasts 10 minutes. Weapon poison+ remains unchanged.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (13 August 2013)|date=13 August 2013}}
** Applying weapon poison now has the correct sound effect.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (29 July 2013)|date=29 July 2013}} 
** Discontinued weapon poisons are now untradeable, and Warped Tortoises & Terrorbirds no longer drop them.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (28 November 2012)|date=28 November 2012}}
** Daily challenges to make weapon poison and weapon poison+ can now be completed.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Latest RuneScape News (27 February 2002)|date=27 February 2002}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* After the [[Evolution of Combat]] update, existing weapon poison potions were replaced with 3 dose poisons. However, the old weapon poison version was still obtainable from monsters as a drop, such as [[warped tortoise]]s and [[ankou]]s until an [[Update:Patch Notes (29 July 2013)|update]] released on [[29 July]] [[2013]]. This version does not have the ability to let the player to poison others, nor apply the poison to any weapons (the original function). In order to solve this problem, drop the potion and it will automatically change to the new item. These unconverted potions retain the examine text of "For use on daggers and projectiles."
* The default click option is to 'Apply Weapon poison', even if no weapon is wielded or in your inventory. Instead, it applies a temporary buff to any melee weapon wielded, rather than converting the weapon with a permanent chance of applying the poison.

==See also==
* [[Weapon poison+]]
* [[Weapon poison++]]
* [[Weapon poison+++]]

An '''antipoison''' is a [[Herblore#Potions|potion]] made via the [[Herblore]] skill. An antipoison cures [[poison]] and reduces poison damage by 100% for 3 minutes. [[Members]] can make one with three doses by using [[clean marrentill]] on a [[vial of water]] and then adding [[unicorn horn dust]]. This requires level 13 herblore and gives 50 [[Herblore]] experience.

It is recommended that players use [[antipoison++]] instead of this potion, as antipoison++ offers an immunity period four times longer (12 minutes per dose).

If the player adds [[roe]] to a 2-dose potion, it will become a 2 dose [[antipoison mix]] which heals 300 [[life points]].

An unlimited amount of Antipoison (1) can be found in a chest in the goblin dungeon that is accessed during the Observatory quest, though this chest's location may be randomly generated.

This potion can be made into an [[antipoison flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

'''Saradomin brew''' is made by mixing [[clean toadflax]] and then a [[crushed nest]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 180 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 81 Herblore. It is slightly lighter in colour than a [[strength potion]]. It can also be upgraded to a [[super Saradomin brew]] at level 93 by adding a [[wine of Saradomin]].

{{clear|left}}
==Effect==
Each dose of Saradomin brew increases [[life points]] by 1000 and increases [[Defence]] by 1-4 levels (4% + 1). However, it also drains [[Strength]], [[Attack]], [[Magic]], [[Ranged]], and [[Necromancy]] levels by the same amount. Unlike any regular [[food]], Saradomin brews do not drain the user's [[adrenaline]].

This potion is one of few ways to raise life points above the normal maximum. It can heal up to 1000 life points above maximum (both the healing and max life point boost are unaffected by [[Constitution]] and is the same regardless of level). The boosting effect will not stack with [[rocktail]] and other similar food items, but it will stack with the warmth of a [[bonfire]].

{{Combat Potion Boost Table|4|1|is120=yes|class=mw-collapsible mw-collapsed}}

==Use==
It is universally advised to only use this potion in combination with [[restore potion|restore]], [[super restore]], or [[overload]] potions in order to counteract the draining of the player's Attack, Strength, Magic, Ranged and Necromancy stats. Without using restore potions, the Saradomin brew will reduce a player's levels to under level 10 within 10-20 doses, depending on the player's stats. As this effectively defeats the point of using it by quickly rendering players nearly incapable of doing damage, it is generally avoided. The brews are very effective while under the effects of [[overload]]s, as they renew the player's stats every 15 seconds, constantly counteracting the brew's negative effects.

In certain situations where the extra healing from a Saradomin brew is not fully required, the player can opt to use a [[Guthix rest]] potion instead to avoid the stat draining effect of Saradomin brews.

The brew has one of the best amounts of healing per inventory spot. Some of the better methods include stackable items like the [[Unicorn Stallion scroll (Healing Aura)]], [[Elemental Titan scroll (Titan's Constitution)]], and a stack of [[purple sweets]] and [[holy biscuits]]. Brews are commonly used in places where an inventory of conventional, one-click foods does not suffice.

Like all [[potions]], Saradomin brews can be consumed while [[stun]]ned.

The Saradomin brew may not be consumed in [[Clan Wars]] or when [[dueling]] if food has been disabled.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch_Notes_(20_July_2015)|date=20 July 2015}}

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (11 December 2012)|date=11 December 2012}}

* {{UL|type=update|update=Mogres, Lizards, Pet Fish, Potions and Potatoes!|date=24 October 2005}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* When it is ingested, the chatbox message says, "You drink some of the foul liquid", unlike other [[potions]] message - "You drink some of your <small>(potion's name)</small>. You have (1-3) doses left/You have finished your potion."
* If you drink a Saradomin brew and enter the [[Wilderness]], you will see in the chatbox "Your extreme potion bonus has been reduced.", and your defence bonus from the Saradomin brew will be reduced to the bonus of a [[super defence potion]].
* It is the only tradeable potion that cannot be modified with [[caviar]].
* Its price plummeted after the release of [[Evolution of Combat|EoC]], mainly due to the amount of times needed to click to heal a large amount of life points. Prior to EoC, a brew would heal a player with 99 [[Constitution]] about three times as much as a [[shark]] would. After EoC, however, a brew healed only 25% more life points than a shark and would only heal 500 life points per dose, while sharks could heal 1600 life points in one click. Their defence boost was also weakened significantly after the EoC.
* With the release of [[Legacy Mode]], Saradomin brews now heal 1000 LP per dose, twice what they healed post-EoC. This buff, combined with the players' LP system reverting to the 990/9900 system and the removal of Constitution level-based food healing, has once again made Saradomin brews one of the highest healing items in the game per inventory space. A 4-dose vial will heal 4000 LP total, while a flask can heal a maximum of 6000; by comparison, sharks and [[rocktail]]s will heal 2000 and 2300 respectively.

5588.name: Zamorak brew
5588.content:
{{External|rsc=Potion of Zamorak|os}} {{Oupotion|mix=yes}} {{Confuse|Zemouregal brew}} {{Infobox Item |version1 = (1) |version2 = (2) |version3 = (3) |version4 = (4) |defver = 4 |name1 = Zamorak brew (1) |name2 = Zamorak brew (2) |name3 = Zamorak brew (3) |name4 = Zamorak brew (4) |image1 = [[File:Zamorak brew (1).png]] |image2 = [[File:Zamorak brew (2).png]] |image3 = [[File:Zamorak brew (3).png]] |image4 = [[File:Zamorak brew (4).png]] |release = [[12 December]] [[2002]] |update = Agility skill online |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = Yes |equipable = No |stackable = No |disassembly = Yes |noteable = Yes |actions = Drink, Empty |value1 = 125 |value2 = 150 |value3 = 175 |value4 = 200 |destroy = Drop |kept = reclaimable |store = No |exchange = gemw |examine1 = 1 dose of Zamorak brew. |examine2 = 2 doses of Zamorak brew. |examine3 = 3 doses of Zamorak brew. |examine4 = 4 doses of Zamorak brew. |weight1 = 0.02 |weight2 = 0.025 |weight3 = 0.03 |weight4 = 0.035 |id1 = 193 |id2 = 191 |id3 = 189 |id4 = 2450 }} {{synced switch |version1 = [[File:Zamorak brew (1) detail.png|left|100px]] |version2 = [[File:Zamorak brew (2) detail.png|left|100px]] |version3 = [[File:Zamorak brew (3) detail.png|left|100px]] |version4 = [[File:Zamorak brew (4) detail.png|left|100px]] }} '''Zamorak brews''' are made by mixing [[clean torstol]] and then [[jangerberries]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 175 [[Herblore]] [[experience]]. It requires level 78 [[Herblore]] to make. Zamorak brews temporarily raise [[Attack]] and [[Strength]] by 8% + 1, and restores 20-99 [[Prayer]] points. It also temporarily lowers [[Defence]] by 8% + 1 and remaining [[life points]] by 12% (all numbers rounded down). It is nearly useless on its own, as the cheap [[combat potion]] gives the same boosts without the negative effects (while a [[prayer potion]] restores several times as many prayer points). A [[Super Zamorak brew]] can be made by mixing a Zamorak brew (3) along with a [[Wine of Zamorak]] and 93 Herblore. Note that Zamorak brew '''cannot''' be used with the [[Lunar spell]] [[Boost Potion Share]]. People would sometimes use this potion to [[Self-injury|lower their life points]] to either kill themselves and fully restore their stats, to respawn somewhere else, or to hit higher using [[Dharok's set|Dharok's set effect]]. It's no longer possible to kill yourself with a Zamorak brew. With level 79 [[Summoning]], it is possible to use the [[Elemental Titan scroll (Titan's Constitution)]] in order to effectively counter the negative side effects of the Zamorak brew. ==Price per dose== {{Price per dose|Zamorak brew}} ==Creation== {{Infobox Recipe |storeValue = 52 |alchValue = 105 |members = Yes |ticks = 2 |ticks2 = 1 |ticksnote = When mixing a single potion |skill1 = Herblore |skill1lvl = 78 |skill1boostable = |skill1exp = 175 |skill2boostable = |skill3boostable = |mat1 = Torstol potion (unf) |mat2 = Jangerberries |output1 = Zamorak brew (3) }} ==Products== {{Uses material list|Zamorak brew (3)|versions=4|headers=potions}} ==Production costs== {{Potion costs|15|175|torstol|jangerberries}} Previously, buying [[torstol potion (unf)]]s was highly recommended to avoid losing massive amounts of money. But currently, a player will lose {{NoCoins|{{#expr:(({{GEP|Torstol potion (unf)}}+{{GEP|Jangerberries}}-{{GEP|Zamorak brew (3)}}))/175*-1 round 2}}|c}} per xp, so this is not a recommended training method as it would mean spending {{NoCoins|{{#expr:(({{GEP|Torstol potion (unf)}}+{{GEP|Jangerberries}}-{{GEP|Zamorak brew (3)}}))*((11405231/175))*-1 round 0}}|c}} from 78 to 99. The addition of [[overload]] has more or less made the Zamorak brew obsolete, as the former has a far more powerful effect and requires a clean torstol herb (unfinished potion doesn't work). Torstol prices has since fallen to be in line with torstol potions, although Zamorak brews remain more expensive than potions at its level to make.
[[Grimy torstol]] is cleaned to become [[clean torstol]] added to a [[vial of water]] to make [[torstol potion (unf)]]. [[File:Grimy torstol.png]] [[File:Clean torstol.png]] + [[File:Vial of water.png]] = [[File:Torstol potion (unf).png]] [[File:Torstol potion (unf).png]] + [[File:Jangerberries.png]] = [[File:Zamorak brew (3).png]] Then add [[jangerberries]] to make a 3-dose Zamorak brew.
==Drop sources== {{Drop sources|Zamorak brew (2)|versions=4}} ==Disassembly== {{Disassembly |version1=(1)|version2=(2)|version3=(3)|version4=(4) |name1 = Zamorak brew (1) |name2 = Zamorak brew (2) |name3 = Zamorak brew (3) |name4 = Zamorak brew (4) |level = 78 |category = Potions |category1=1 dose|category2=2 dose|category3=3 dose|category4=4 dose }} ==Update history== {{UH| * {{UL|type=update|update=Agility skill online|date=12 December 2002}} ** Added to game. }} {{God wine}} {{Potions}} [[Category:Self-harm]]

'''Super ranging potions''' are made by mixing [[clean dwarf weed]] and then [[Wine of Zamorak]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 162.5 [[Herblore]] [[experience]]. It requires level 72 Herblore to make.

Using a super ranging potion temporarily raises the player's [[Ranged]] level by 2-13 (2 + 12% of the player's level, rounded down).

The super ranging potion is also an ingredient for making an [[extreme ranging potion]], along with 5 [[grenwall spikes]]. A super ranging potion (4) is an ingredient in a [[grand ranging potion]], one of the [[combination potions]].

Along with all other combat super potions and a regular [[overload]], it is an ingredient for making [[supreme overload potion]]s.

One-dose potions can be pickpocketed from [[Cadarn worker]]s.

'''Super magic potions''' are made by mixing [[clean lantadyme]] and then [[potato cactus]] in a [[vial]] of water, giving 172.5 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 76 Herblore.

Using a super magic potion temporarily raises the player's [[Magic]] level by an amount between 2 and 13, based on the player's current level; calculated by the expression: (2 + 12% of the player's magic level, rounded down).

This potion may be dropped by the [[Possessed Priest]] boss during the quest [[Icthlarin's Little Helper]].

With 91 Herblore, A super magic potion (3) is an ingredient for making [[extreme magic]] potions, along with a [[ground mud rune]].

A super magic potion (4) combined with a [[magic potion (4)]]  in a [[crystal flask]] will produce a [[grand magic]] potion, one of the [[combination potions]] requiring 78 herblore.

Along with all other combat super potions and a regular [[overload]], it is an ingredient for making [[supreme overload potion]]s.

5621.name: Weapon poison++
5621.content:
{{external|os=Weapon poison(++)}} {{oupotion}} {{HasCalculator|Calculator:Combat/Poison}} {{Infobox Item |version1 = (1) |version2 = (2) |version3 = (3) |version4 = (4) |defver = 4 |name1 = Weapon poison++ (1) |name2 = Weapon poison++ (2) |name3 = Weapon poison++ (3) |name4 = Weapon poison++ (4) |image1 = [[File:Weapon poison++ (1).png]] |image2 = [[File:Weapon poison++ (2).png]] |image3 = [[File:Weapon poison++ (3).png]] |image4 = [[File:Weapon poison++ (4).png]] |release = [[11 July]] [[2005]] |update = Farming |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = Yes |equipable = No |stackable = No |disassembly = Yes |noteable = Yes |options = Apply, Empty |options_bank = Apply |value1 = 144 |value2 = 288 |value3 = 432 |value4 = 576 |destroy = Drop |kept = reclaimable |exchange = gemw |examine = A vial of super-strong weapon poison. |weight = 0.035 |id1 = 25507 |id2 = 25505 |id3 = 25503 |id4 = 25501 }} {{synced switch |version1 = [[File:Weapon poison++ (1) detail.png|left|100px]] |version2 = [[File:Weapon poison++ (2) detail.png|left|100px]] |version3 = [[File:Weapon poison++ (3) detail.png|left|100px]] |version4 = [[File:Weapon poison++ (4) detail.png|left|100px]] }} '''Weapon poison++''' is the second strongest variant of [[Weapon poison (disambiguation)|weapon poison]] behind [[weapon poison+++]]. It is made by mixing [[cave nightshade]] and [[poison ivy berries]] in a [[coconut milk|vial of coconut milk]], giving 190 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 82 Herblore to make. Previous to the addition of [[Evolution of Combat]], Weapon poison++ was applied directly to specific weapons. It is now a buff on the player that applies a poison effect to enemies no matter what weapon or style of combat is used. Applying weapon poison++ will give you a 12.5% chance per hit to [[poison]] your opponent in combat. The poison effect appears as a buff and lasts for 10 minutes, dealing between 19.539% of your [[ability damage]] per poison hit. This deals poison damage on the first application and renews the poison duration. Poison will hit every 10 seconds and wear off after 3 minutes. When paired with [[cinderbane gloves]], weapon poison++ will have its base poison damage increased from 150 to 200 and the poison will process more often than using either of them separately.{{CiteGeneral|url=https://imgur.com/LseCyNx|title=Message in #ranch-out-of-time channel of official RuneScape Discord server|author=Mod Breezy|date=12 November 2019|accessdate=5 November 2020|publisher=Discord|archiveurl=https://archive.md/EUJlz|archivedate=26 February 2023|quote=yeah they affect base poison damage too so the "scalar" in code is like; tier 1 poison - 50; tier 2 - 100; tier 3 - 150; tier 4 - 200; tier 5 - 250; the current highest is weapon poison++ at tier 3 PLUS cinders = tier 4; with the update, wep pois+++will allow it to go to tier 5 with cinders}} This potion can be made into an [[weapon poison++ flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks. ==Price per Dose== {{Price per dose|Weapon poison++}} ==Creation== {{Infobox Recipe |storeValue = 129 |alchValue = 259 |members = Yes |ticks = 2 |ticks2 = 1 |ticksnote = When mixing a single potion |skill1 = Herblore |skill1lvl = 82 |skill1boostable = |skill1exp = 190 |mat1 = Weapon poison++ (unf) |mat1cost = calcvalue |mat2 = Poison ivy berries |output1 = Weapon poison++ (3) }} ===Production costs=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Herb ! Secondaries ! Vial ! Material cost{{Refn|group=n|[[Cave nightshade]] cannot be traded on the Grand Exchange, it can only be [[Farming|farmed]] or gathered in the [[Skavid caves]]. Therefore, the cost of a [[cave nightshade seed]] is used.}} ! Profit ! Profit/XP |- | {{NA}} | {{plink|Cave nightshade}}
{{plink|Poison ivy berries}} | {{plink|Coconut milk}} | {{Coins|({{GEP|Coconut milk}} + {{GEP|Cave nightshade seed}} + {{GEP|Poison ivy berries}})}} | {{Coins|{{GEP|Weapon poison++ (3)}} - ({{GEP|Coconut milk}} + {{GEP|Cave nightshade seed}} + {{GEP|Poison ivy berries}})}} | {{Coins|({{GEP|Weapon poison++ (3)}} - ({{GEP|Coconut milk}} + {{GEP|Cave nightshade seed}} + {{GEP|Poison ivy berries}})) / 191 round 2}} |} {{Reflist|group=n}} ==Products== {{Uses material list|Weapon poison++ (4)|versions=4|headers=potions}} ==Item sources== {{Drop sources|Weapon poison++ (1)|versions=4}} ===Spawns=== * {{Item spawns|item=Weapon poison++|itemid=25507|4997,9012|mapID=-1|text=In the Dragonkin Laboratory}} ==Money making guide== {{Mmgsection|Making weapon poison++}} ==Comparison== {{Weapon poison compare}} ==Disassembly== {{Disassembly |version1=(1)|version2=(2)|version3=(3)|version4=(4) |name1 = Weapon poison++ (1) |name2 = Weapon poison++ (2) |name3 = Weapon poison++ (3) |name4 = Weapon poison++ (4) |level = 82 |category = Potions |category1=1 dose|category2=2 dose|category3=3 dose|category4=4 dose }} ==Update history== {{UH| * {{UL|type=patch|update=This Week In RuneScape: Rex Matriarchs & Combat Week!|date=19 April 2021}} ** Fixed an issue on weapon poison potions of all tiers that incorrectly stated the chance to apply poison was 15%. The tooltip has been adjusted to match the correct value of 12.5%. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (16 October 2017)|date=16 October 2017}} ** Antifire, weapon poison, aggression potion and wilder pie effects no longer stay active on free worlds. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (23 November 2015)|date=23 November 2015}} ** Teleporting no longer removes weapon poison. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (8 June 2015)|date=8 June 2015}} ** Applying weapon poison no longer displays the message that you drank it. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (27 May 2014)|date=27 May 2014}} ** A bug where all versions of Weapon poison were lasting for 5 minutes has been fixed. Weapon poison now lasts for 1 minute and Weapon poison++ now lasts 10 minutes. Weapon poison+ remains unchanged. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (13 August 2013)|date=13 August 2013}} ** Applying weapon poison now has the correct sound effect. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Hallowe'en Event and Quest|date=28 October 2008}} ** Dragon dagger p++ should now be easier to find on the Grand Exchange. ** Some super poisoned adamant items such as arrows, daggers, and spears now use "addy" at the start. * {{UL|type=update|update=Farming|date=11 July 2005}} ** Added to game. }} ==See also== * [[Weapon poison]] * [[Weapon poison+]] * [[Weapon poison+++]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Potions}}

The '''antipoison+''' is made by mixing a [[clean toadflax]] and a [[yew root]] in a [[vial]] of [[coconut milk]], giving 155 [[Herblore]] experience. The potion requires level 68 [[Herblore]]. Four doses are created instead of the usual three.

The Antipoison+ cures [[poison]], and provides a longer immunity than [[super antipoison]]s. This potion reduces poison damage by 100% for 9 minutes.

This is the lowest level potion that requires [[coconut milk]] in place of water.

This potion can be made into an [[antipoison+ flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

'''Antipoison++''' are made by mixing [[clean irit]] and [[magic roots]] in a [[vial]] of [[coconut milk]], requiring 79 [[Herblore]] and giving 177.5 Herblore experience.

Antipoison++ cures [[poison]] and provides 12 minutes of immunity to poison, the longest duration possible (aside from [[Ogre flask (thermal)]], which can last up to 14 minutes). This makes them far more useful than other types of [[antipoison]] potions, eliminating the need to drink constantly.

If your antipoison is about to run out, you'll get the message: "Your immunity to poison is about to expire."

This potion can be made into an [[antipoison++ flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

'''Clean toadflax''' is a [[grimy toadflax]] that has been cleaned. It is the sixth lowest level herb available but is one of the more valuable herbs, due to the relative difficulty to obtain them, and high demand as an ingredient in [[Saradomin brew]]s. It is used in the [[Herblore]] skill.

Clean toadflax can be purchased from the [[Brimhaven Agility Arena]] for 1 [[Agility arena ticket]].

{{Synced switch
|version1 = [[File:Antifire (1) detail.png|left|100px]]
|version2 = [[File:Antifire (2) detail.png|left|100px]]
|version3 = [[File:Antifire (3) detail.png|left|100px]]
|version4 = [[File:Antifire (4) detail.png|left|100px]]
}}
An '''antifire''' potion provides partial immunity to a [[Dragonfire|dragon's breath]]. When used in conjunction with an [[anti-dragon shield]] or [[dragonfire shield]], it will provide complete immunity against [[dragonfire]]. Antifire potions are especially useful against [[metal dragons]] and the [[King Black Dragon]], though only when combined with an [[anti-dragon shield]] or [[dragonfire shield]]. It doesn't work when used with [[Protect from Magic]] alone. The potion lasts for exactly 6 minutes per dose (24 minutes per 4-dose potion)

It can be made by a player with 69 [[Herblore]] by mixing [[clean lantadyme]] and then [[dragon scale dust]] in a [[vial of water]], which grants 157.5 [[Herblore]] experience. Players with at least 85 Herblore can mix a [[phoenix feather]] into a 3-dose antifire, turning it into a [[super antifire]] potion, which fully protects against dragonfire on its own.  At level 90, players can mix a [[clean arbuck]] into a 3-dose super antifire to create an [[Extended super antifire]], with each dose lasting 12 minutes per dose, twice as long as a dose from a [[super antifire]].

Players will get a warning in their chatbox when the potion is about to wear off: "Your resistance to dragonfire is about to run out". Then they will get another message when it has worn off, approximately 15 seconds after the initial warning: "Your resistance to dragonfire has run out". This allows you to keep track of how long you have until you have to drink again.

Players should remember that an antifire potion alone will '''not''' fully protect them from dragonfire (players will get a message in their text box stating that they have been horribly burnt by the fire). The potion's protection is so slight that, when used alone, even a single dragon can cause extensive damage to the player from its breath. Only when the potion is combined with the anti-dragon shield or dragonfire shield will players be completely immune to dragonfire.

Drinking an antifire can protect players against the effect of [[Dragon bolts (e)|enchanted dragonstone bolts']] special effect. Again, players will get a message in their text box stating that they have been burnt/horribly burnt by the fire, although the damage dealt will range only from 100-120 life points.

An [[antifire flask (1)]] spawns in the second room of the [[Dragonkin Laboratory]], near the red dragons, in both normal mode and story mode. This can be especially useful for players who cannot buy or make antifire themselves.

A '''limpwurt root''' is a root harvested from a limpwurt plant planted in a [[flower patch]], requiring level 26 [[Farming]]. Three limpwurt root can be harvested from a flower patch at a time.

Limpwurt roots are required for making [[strength potions]] and [[Super strength|super strength potions]].

==Farming==
Limpwurt roots can be harvested from [[limpwurt seed]]s grown within a [[flower patch]]. A fully grown limpwurt plant can grow three limpwurt roots at a time. All three limpwurt roots are harvested when picked, yielding 120 [[Farming]] experience.

'''Red spiders' eggs''' are a secondary [[Herblore]] ingredient used to create a variety of potions. They are usually found in areas inhabited by [[deadly red spider]]s.

Additionally, red spiders' eggs can be used as payment, alongside a [[limpwurt root]] and 5 coins, for a 4-dose [[strength potion]] from the [[Apothecary]] in [[Varrock]].

Red spiders' eggs are also used alongside [[raw sardine]]s in the [[Creature Creation]] activity to create a [[spidine]], which drops a number of red spiders' eggs when defeated. These may be noted while wearing an [[Ardougne cloak]].

'''Combat potions''' are made by mixing [[clean harralander]] and then [[Goat horn dust]] in a [[Vial of water]], giving 84 [[Herblore]] experience. This requires level 36 Herblore.

Combat potions temporarily raise [[Attack]] and [[Strength]] by 8% plus 1. Players may prefer this potion to a super set (without a [[Super defence potion]]) because it has the combined properties of an [[Attack potion]] and a [[Strength potion]], has a low cost, and takes up only one inventory space. Even though a Combat potion raises both Attack and Strength, it is cheaper than a Strength potion; this is likely due to the fact that Strength potions, unlike Combat potions, are available to Free-to-play players.

Combat potions can be useful for player killing and PvM activities because they are inexpensive and give decent stat boosts.

[[File:Wine of Zamorak detail.png|left|100px]]
The '''wine of Zamorak''' is a type of wine brewed with [[grapes of Zamorak]], which can be grown using the [[Farming]] skill. Grapes of Zamorak are added to a [[jug of water]] to create [[unfermented wine of Zamorak]]; this requires 92 [[Cooking]] and immediately gives 1 experience. After 18 seconds have elapsed since the first unfermented wine was brewed, all unfermented wine of zamorak will ferment into Wine of Zamorak, giving 200 Cooking experience. 

It can also be found in the [[Captured Temple]] (just south of [[Goblin Village]], east of [[Taverley]], and north of [[Falador]]). 

==Uses==
Wine of Zamorak cannot be consumed. It is used as a secondary ingredient in the [[Herblore]] skill to create [[super ranging potion]]s at level 72 and [[super Zamorak brew]]s at level 93.

==Obtaining from the Captured Temple==
There are two ways to take the Wine of Zamorak in the [[Captured Temple]]:
* Players can take the wine with their bare hands if all the [[Monk of Zamorak|Monks of Zamorak]] are dead or out of the temple (the door of the temple cannot be closed) '''and''' facing away from the inner temple so they cannot see the theft occur. Using bare hands while grabbing the wine will result the player taking unblockable damage (5%-10% of current health, increasing percentage-wise as health depletes), and in a 5%-6% reduction in [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Defence]], [[Ranged]], and [[Magic]]; using Telekinetic Grab avoids this. The [[Protect from Magic]] prayer is useless in shielding from the effect. The Monks of Zamorak nearby will also attack the player and reduce some of the player's combat stats occasionally. Reduced stats return at approximately one per minute. If no monk is present, the wine can be taken but you will still take damage and your stats will still be drained.
* Using [[Telekinetic Grab]] (level 33+ Magic). 1 air rune and 1 law rune are needed to cast this spell. Telegrabbing the wine will cause the nearby monks to attack. This can be prevented by quickly logging out, or world switching (instant world hop). If a player casts Telekinetic Grab but another player is faster, then the slower player will not only lose the wine but also the [[runes]] it took to cast the spell, although they still gain the normal amount of Magic [[experience]] given. Bringing a [[staff of air]] instead of air runes makes gathering wine of Zamorak more cost-effective, but [[law rune]]s are required. Lower level players may want to bring an [[emergency teleport]] in case of low life points.

==Trivia==
[[File:Zamorakswine.jpg|right]]
* Before [[gravestone]]s and the warning message, wine of Zamorak was a popular item used by advanced players to kill new players. They would usually tell the new player to grab the wine, then they would trap the player by closing the door, eventually letting the monks kill them. When the player was dead, the advanced player would take the items of the dead player. However, this is obsolete since the door of this temple cannot be closed any more.
* Previously, if players put a wine of Zamorak back in the place they took it from and try to pick it up, they would be hurt as if it had just respawned. This only worked on the exact spot where the wine respawns, the other side of the table did not cause you to be hurt, due to the game engine not being able to distinguish a respawned wine of Zamorak from one placed there by a player. After an update on 9 July 2013, it is no longer possible to put any item over any table.
* In Brazil, wine of Zamorak is called "Suco de uva de Zamorak," translated as Grape juice of Zamorak. This is due to Brazilian laws prohibiting the names of alcoholic beverages.
* Previously, when stealing wine, a message would appear saying "STOP STEALING MY WINE! GAH!". This was a reference to the now-removed [[God letters]].
* No [[jug]] is left behind upon using wine of Zamorak in potions.
* Despite being a free-to-play item, only members can create or use them (although free players can still collect them from the spawn and sell them).

[[File:Clean tarromin detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Clean tarromin''' is a [[grimy tarromin]] that has been cleaned. It is the second lowest level [[herb]] available. It is used in the [[Herblore]] skill for making [[magic potion]]s, [[strength potion]]s, and [[serum 207]] from a [[Tarromin potion (unf)]]. However, it is best used to make [[tarromin tar]], which is profitable and yield the most xp per herb.

Tarromin is also used in the [[Grim Tales]] quest to make the [[shrink-me-quick]] potion. It is created by adding a clean tarromin to a [[vial of water]] then adding a [[shrunk ogleroot]]. The potion can then be drunk by the player in order to go through a mouse hole in the witch's house south of [[Taverley]].

As one of the cheapest herbs, tarromin is a good option for burning on the [[Chapel Burner]] for training [[Prayer]] in [[Fort Forinthry]].

[[File:Snape grass detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Snape grass''' is a grass that can be collected from various areas around [[RuneScape]]. Snape grass can also be grown from snape grass plants grown from three [[snape grass seed]]s in an [[allotment patch]], requiring level 80 [[Farming]]. A minimum of three snape grass is harvested at a time when farmed in an allotment. 

Snape grass is required for crafting [[fishing potion]]s, [[prayer potion]]s, and [[sweet honeycomb]]s. Snape grass can also be used to create [[hangover cure]]s, which are used in the [[Plague City]] quest and the [[Mogres]] mini quest.

==Farming==
Snape grass can be harvested from snape grass plants grown within an [[allotment patch]] from three [[snape grass seed]]s. A fully grown snape grass plant will yield a minimum of three snape grass at harvest. Each snape grass, when picked, gives 80 Farming experience.

Harvest yields for snape grass plants are determined by a "harvest lives" system. Each snape grass plant begins with three lives. Additional lives are added with the use of compost (+1 life), supercompost (+2 lives), and ultracompost (+3 lives). Every harvest action will roll a chance out of 255 on the specific patch's "Chance to Save", taking one of the harvest lives from the patch if it does not hit; the patch will be cleared when it runs out of lives. The "Chance to Save" is dependent on the player's Farming level.

[[File:Clean snapdragon detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Clean snapdragon''' is a somewhat rare medium-high level [[herb]], used to create [[Snapdragon potion (unf)]] for making [[Super restore potion]]s or [[Invention potions]] via the [[Herblore]] skill. Players can grow [[grimy snapdragon]] at 62 farming and will gain 98.5 [[experience]] for every herb the seed yields, although the seeds are nearly as rare as the herb. It is possible to grow 3-18 snapdragons from one seed or 5-24 if players use Supercompost and [[magic secateurs]]. Players can also use it as an ingredient in a [[Compost Bin]] to make [[Supercompost]], but considering its price and use, it is not recommended. There are many other cheaper options for making supercompost, such as [[Pineapple]]s or [[Coconut shell]]s.

Players can obtain a clean snapdragon by cleaning a [[grimy snapdragon]], if they have level 59 Herblore, to gain 11.8 [[experience]] points. A grimy snapdragon can also be taken to [[Zahur]] in [[Nardah]] to be cleaned for a fee of 200 coins if players do not have the herblore level to clean it themselves. Players can buy a clean snapdragon from [[Pirate Jackie the Fruit]] for 10 [[agility arena ticket]]s. Also, up to three snapdragons can be received as a possible reward from various random events. Completing hard orders for the [[Gnome Restaurant]] activity as well as burning Vyrewatch corpses in the Columbarium under [[Paterdomus]] may also give snapdragons as a reward. Snapdragons are sometimes received as a drop from some high levelled monsters like [[General Graardor]].Red tokens from [[Temple Trekking]] can reward 2-7 snapdragons.

An '''eye of newt''' is a secondary [[Herblore]] ingredient used to make [[attack potion]]s and [[super attack]] potions. Eyes of newt can also be used as food for a [[sneakerpeeper spawn]].

Eyes of newt are also used alongside [[feather]]s in the [[Creature Creation]] activity to create a [[newtroost]], which drops a number of eyes of newt when defeated. These may be noted while wearing an [[Ardougne cloak]].

Fifty eyes of newt can be unpacked from an [[eye of newt pack]], which can be purchased from various [[shop]]s.

==Trivia==
* This item is likely a reference to the play ''{{WP|Macbeth}}'' by {{WP|William Shakespeare}}, specifically Act 4, Scene 1, when the witches add eye of newt to their brew.{{CiteGeneral|url=http://clicknotes.com/macbeth/T41.html|title=Macbeth|pages=Act 4, Scene 1|publisher=ClickNotes.com|archivedate=27 October 2000|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/sa4qc}}
*[[Newton]] mentions his eye has been stolen by a witch, a reference to this item.
*The eye of newt has a white sclera and blue iris, shaped like in a human eye, while both Newton and real-life newts have yellow eyes.

[[File:Chocolate dust detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Chocolate dust''' is a ground-up [[chocolate bar]], made by right-clicking a bar and selecting the "powder" option.

Chocolate dust cannot be consumed, so it is not properly a [[food]] item. However, it is usually classified as such, since it is used as an ingredient in [[cooking]] and in some [[gnome cooking]]. It can be added to a [[cake]] to make a [[chocolate cake]], or to a [[bucket of milk]] to make [[chocolatey milk]]. It is also used to make [[chef's delight]] and [[Hangover cure]] for certain quests.

Chocolate dust is also used in [[herblore]] (with [[clean harralander|harralander]] to make [[energy potion]]s) and [[cooking]] (in [[brewing]] [[Chef's delight]] or [[Chef's delight (m)]]).

After the [[2005 Halloween event]], all [[sweets]] turned to chocolate dust, which was then still a members-only item. Also, after the [[2008 Easter event]], all [[Chocolate egg (2008 Easter event)|chocolate egg]]s given from the [[Easter Bunny]] turned to chocolate dust.

A '''vial of water''' can be made by using a [[vial]] on a [[water source]], or buying it from a store, a player or the [[Grand Exchange]]. Certain combinations of ingredients can be mixed in a vial of water to create [[potions]] using the [[Herblore]] skill. Adding a clean [[herb]] to a vial of water creates an [[unfinished potion]].

==Obtaining a vial of water==
Players can obtain a vial of water in several ways:
* Members can use [[Humidify]] to make all the vials in their backpack to be filled with water.
* By using an empty [[vial]] on a [[water source]] other than a well.
* Take vials action on a [[portable well]].
* Claim 150-200 noted vials of water per day from a [[modified botanist's mask]].

Players with the ability to access all the shops that supply vial of water packs can obtain 6,600 vials of water through visiting every shop, for a modest cost of 66k. This method requires very little effort. The individual vials sell for {{formatnum:{{#expr:{{GEP|Vial of water}}}}}} coins each on the Grand Exchange, resulting in a profit of {{formatnum:{{#expr:{{GEP|Vial of water}}*6600-66000}}}} coins per run.

Free players can buy limited amounts from [[Jatix's Herblore Shop]] in the eastern part of [[Taverley]].

===Tactics for refilling===
The [[Update:Graphical and Audio Updates|Grand Exchange update]] on [[9 August]] [[2011]] provided an exceptionally short run from one of the bankers to the fountain in the middle.

For non-members, an old style hand pump just north of the west bank in [[Falador]] provides only a short running distance. Members may find that both the geyser in [[Neitiznot]] and the sink in the cellar of [[Lumbridge Castle]] are great places to refill vials with water due to close proximity to a bank and one-click banking chests. 

The best low-level member spot are the fountains at the bank entrance in [[Merchant District]] of [[Menaphos]]. Higher level members may also use the water pool located in the [[Meilyr]] section of [[Prifddinas]] if one does not wish to purchase directly from [[Lady Meilyr]].

==Price history==
The price of this item has varied due to countless shop updates over the years. Vials of water hovered between 150 and 200 coins prior to the introduction of the Grand Exchange. When shops were updated to have unlimited stock, the price of vials of water plunged and then steadied at about 70 coins each. Then, due to the [[Update:Personalised Shops|personalised shops update]], the price of this item increased past 240 coins because of the limited number of items in each shop. Vials of water received a price cap of 103 coins on 13 October shortly after the update, along with [[Eye of newt|eyes of newt]], lowering it by over half the price. Vials of water were virtually out of stock on the Grand Exchange due to the sudden price change. In order to compensate for the shortage, the vials of water stock increased in [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]] from 200 to 1000 on 20 October. On 9 November 2009, vials and vials of water started to be sold in [[item pack]]s in many stores, allowing players to buy large amounts at once. The ease of obtaining vials of water caused the price to crash again to around 11 coins. For several months, vials of water steadied between 30-50 coins each.

'''Garlic''' is an item used for the [[Fishing Contest]], [[Desert Treasure]], [[While Guthix Sleeps]], and [[Vampyre Slayer]] quests. It is also needed to make Guthix balance for the Morytania Medium Task. Despite being a food item, it cannot be eaten on its own. It is used, though, in making [[Spicy sauce]] and [[Guthix balance potion]]s.

Garlic may also be used along with a [[stake]] and a [[hammer]] to kill [[Count Draynor]], a level 28[[Vampyre]], at the end of the [[Vampyre Slayer]] quest.

Members may grind garlic into [[garlic powder]] with a [[pestle and mortar]].

'''Hunter potions''' are potions that boost your [[Hunter]] level by 3. This boost cannot be stacked with the [[Spa|mud bath]] boost, which will give a better boost than the potion. A [[Herblore]] level of 53 is required to make the potion - the ingredients are [[clean avantoe]] and [[kebbit teeth dust]]. It grants 120 experience once made. Kebbit teeth dust can be made by using a [[pestle and mortar]] on [[kebbit teeth]], which are obtained by dead-falling [[sabre-toothed kebbit]]s. It can also be upgraded to a [[Super hunter]] at level 64 by adding [[rabbit teeth]].

'''Coconut milk''' is a vial of liquid that is used as a base for several high-level [[Herblore]] potions. Coconut milk is created by decanting an [[Coconut (open)|open coconut]] into an empty [[vial]], leaving an empty [[coconut shell]].

Coconut milk is required to mix [[Antipoison+]], [[Weapon poison+]], [[Antipoison++]], and [[Weapon poison++]].

'''Guthix balance''' potions are modified [[restore potion]]s, made using the [[Herblore]] skill. To make Guthix balance, players must have started [[In Aid of the Myreque]] and have at least level 22 Herblore. Guthix balance can be used against [[vampyres]] and [[vyrewatch]] in [[Morytania]] or [[Meiyerditch]].

First, a restore potion is made (by adding [[Clean harralander|harralander]] and [[red spider's eggs]] to a [[vial]] of water). Then, [[garlic]] and [[silver dust]] are added to the restore potion to make the Guthix balance potion. Silver dust can be made by using a [[silver bar]] at the Grinder on the {{floornumber|2}} of the [[Ectofuntus]], or bought at the [[Grand Exchange]]. Adding garlic gives the player 25 Herblore experience, and adding silver dust gives another 25 Herblore experience.

Garlic and silver dust can only be added to a 3-dose restore potion. The experience for the secondary ingredients is the same, independent of the dosage.

Guthix balance potions are used against [[Vampyre juvenile]]s, [[Vampyre juvinate]]s or [[Vyrewatch]]. The usage of the potion has three outcomes: the vampyre will be destroyed, the vampyre will become [[Angry vampyre|angry]] (vulnerable to all attacks), or they will be returned to [[Former vampyre|human form]]. Using it on a Vyrewatch will simply deal a small amount of damage. [[Vyrelords]] and [[Vyreladies]] are immune to the potion.

A potion of Guthix Balance has to be mixed in Morytania to complete the [[Morytania achievements#Medium achievements|medium Morytania achievement]] [[Finding Your Balance]].

Using a [[pestle and mortar]] with a [[unicorn horn]] will grind it into unicorn horn dust and will award the player with 1 Herblore experience. Unicorn horns are a 100% drop of adult [[unicorn]]s, which can be found in almost every grassy area, as well as adult [[black unicorn]]s. Unicorn horns can also be acquired by creating and killing [[Unicow]]s by means of [[Creature Creation]].

They can also be used to make a [[divine herb patch III]], requiring 82 [[Divination]], 5 clean cadantine, and 10 [[brilliant energy]]. [[Chaos druids]] are mainly killed to get cadantine drops. [[Aberrant spectre]]s also drop cadantines fairly often.
