[[File:Potato cactus detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''potato cactus''' is a cactus fruit harvested from a [[Potato cactus (Farming)|potato cactus plant]] planted in a [[cactus patch]], requiring level 86 [[Farming]]. Three potato cacti can be harvested from a cactus patch at a time. Farmers will watch over a planted potato cactus for 10 [[watermelons]] (8 with master farmer set bonus).

Potato cacti are required for making [[super magic potions]] and [[spirit kalphite pouch]]es. Farmers will watch over a planted [[dragonfruit seed]] in exchange for eight potato cacti. A potato cactus is one of the items needed to hand in to [[Thorgel]] to obtain a [[death talisman]].

==Farming==
Potato cacti can be harvested from [[potato cacti]] grown within a [[cactus patch]]. A fully grown potato cactus can grow up to three potato cacti at a time. Each potato cactus, when picked, gives 92 [[Farming]] experience. Once all three potato cacti have been picked, the cactus will slowly produce more potato cacti. However, the potato cacti may be picked individually provided that at least one appears on the bush.

The yield of potato cacti increases from 3 to 6 with the completion of the [[Desert achievements#Hard achievements|hard Desert achievements]]

[[File:Onyx bolt tips detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Onyx bolt tips''' are attached to the tips of [[rune bolts]] and [[bakriminel bolts]]. Once onyx bolt tips have been attached, the rune bolts become [[onyx bolts]], while the bakriminel bolts become [[onyx bakriminel bolts]]. These onyx and bakriminel bolts may be enchanted with level 87 [[Magic]] to become [[onyx bolts (e)]] and [[onyx bakriminel bolts (e)]] respectively.

Onyx bolt tips can be created at level 73 [[Fletching]] to cut an [[onyx]] into 24 onyx bolt tips. However, this is not recommended, as 24 onyx bolt tips cost {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Onyx bolt tips|24}}|c}}, while a cut onyx costs {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Onyx}}|c}}. They can then be attached to a rune bolt, granting 9.4 Fletching experience per tip attached.

Six onyx bolt tips can be combined with a [[luck potion]] at 77 [[Herblore]] to create an [[enhanced luck potion]], granting 178 Herblore experience.

Onyx bolt tips are also a possible [[clue scroll]] reward from elite clues, and a possible loot from a [[ninja impling]] and a [[kingly impling]].

[[File:Jangerberries detail.png|left|100px]] 
'''Jangerberries''' are berries harvested from a jangerberry bush grown from a [[jangerberry seed]] planted in a [[bush patch]], requiring level 48 [[Farming]]. Four jangerberries can be harvested from a bush patch at a time. 

Jangerberries are required to craft [[Zamorak brew]]s. Farmers will watch over a planted [[prickly pear seed]] in exchange for fifteen jangerberries. 

Jangerberries can be eaten raw and heal up to 200 [[Life points]] each. Eating jangerberries also temporarily raises your [[Attack]] level by two, [[Strength]] level by one, and restores one [[Prayer]] point for the price of one [[Defence]] level.

==Farming==
Jangerberries can be harvested from [[jangerberry bush]]es grown within a [[bush patch]]. A fully grown jangerberry bush can grow up to four jangerberries at a time. Each jangerberry, when picked, gives 19 [[Farming]] experience. Once all four jangerberries have been picked, the bush will slowly produce more jangerberries until four more are available again. However, the jangerberries may be picked individually provided that at least one appears on the bush.

Jangerberries are used in the [[Watchtower]] quest to craft a [[potion]], which is then enchanted into a [[magic ogre potion]] and used to kill the [[ogre shaman]].

Jangerberries can be randomly selected as an item needed in the quest [[A Fairy Tale I - Growing Pains]]. If you do get this item for the Fairytale quest, it would be advisable to bring 4 or more (or simply bring [[Druid pouch]]es), because the [[ghast]]s in [[Mort Myre Swamp]] may turn some of them into [[rotten food]].

[[File:Cave nightshade detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Cave nightshade''' is an ingredient used to make [[weapon poison++]] potions at level 82 [[Herblore]]. Players may harvest nightshade from a [[cave nightshade seed]] planted in a [[nightshade patch]], requiring level 63 [[Farming]]. Additionally, there are 14 cave nightshade plants in the [[Skavid caves]], which can also be harvested. Both methods require armoured [[gauntlets]] in order to harvest the nightshade. Cave nightshade is edible but damages players for 100 [[life points]] when eaten with no other effects. Eating the cave nightshade will never kill the player, only ever bring them down to 1 health.

==Skavid caves==
[[File:Cave nightshade locations.png|right]]
Cave nightshade can be picked from nightshade plants in the northernmost and southernmost rooms of the [[Skavid caves]], which are accessed from the cave nearest to Yanille lodestone (just south of ogre island with jangerberries), or from the furthest south entrance, accessed by entering the eastern gate of Gu'Tanoth and crossing the bridge over lava. A [[skavid map]] is required to enter the caves. Although you receive a warning as you enter, a [[light source]] is not actually needed.

Protective gloves of some kind (e.g. rune gauntlets) must be worn to harvest the plant, or a small amount of poison damage is dealt. Each harvest grants 6 [[Farming]] experience. It takes approximately 30 seconds for each of the plants to respawn (with a small amount of randomness), and both caves contain 7 plants. Plants respawn more quickly on a more populated world. You can gather more quickly by hopping world rather than waiting for respawns.

[[Beasts of burden]] familiars cannot carry cave nightshade; however, cave nightshade can be banked by using the [[Pack Yak scroll (Winter Storage)]], [[Imp-in-a-box]] or [[Sign of the porter]]. If any of these are used, signs of the porter (especially with a [[grace of the elves]]) are recommended. 

Without an automatic banking method, the best option is to harvest an inventory full, then use a teleport to near a bank (such as [[War's Retreat Teleport]], [[Max guild teleport]], or a [[Ring of kinship]]), then teleport to Yanille lodestone and return to the nearby cave. Additionally, any [[locator]] can teleport to cave nightshade (under 'herblore secondaries 1'). Note that cave nightshade can be noted using [[magic notepaper]], but you must use the cave nightshade on the magic notepaper and not vice versa.

Although the nightshade is not tradeable, its value can be determined by: [[weapon poison++]] ({{NoCoins|{{GEPrice|Weapon poison++ (3)}}|c}}) - [[poison ivy berries]] ({{NoCoins|{{GEPrice|Poison ivy berries}}|c}}) - [[coconut milk]] ({{NoCoins|{{GEPrice|Coconut milk}}|c}}) = {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Weapon poison++ (3)}} - {{GEP|Coconut milk}} - {{GEP|Poison ivy berries}}|c}}.

==Farming==
Cave nightshade can be harvested from [[cave nightshade seed]]s grown within a [[nightshade patch]]. Cave nightshade, when picked, gives 512 [[Farming]] experience.

The player must wear gloves or gauntlets to successfully harvest cave nightshade. Bare-handed players will fail to harvest and will also suffer a one-time poison damage for 20 life points.

** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* During the [[Dream Mentor]] quest, if a cave nightshade is used on [[Cyrisus]], the following message will appear: "How evil! Are you trying to kill him?"
* Despite it saying "The nightshade was highly poisonous" upon eating, no poison is incurred; instead, the player is damaged for 100 life points.
* Cave nightshade is untradeable as it was once used in a popular scam to get players to kill themselves. Players needing food would be given nightshade in the hopes that they would eat it and be at such low health that it would kill them.
* Cave nightshade appears to be based partially on the terrestrial plant ''Atropa belladonna'', commonly called 'deadly nightshade' or 'belladonna'. Deadly nightshade is poisonous and traditionally was used to poison drinks and as a weapon poison for arrows.

'''Clean torstol''' is a high-level herb which may be combined with five different [[Extreme|extreme potions]] to create an [[overload]] potion. Adding [[jangerberries]] to a [[torstol potion (unf)]] will also create a [[zamorak brew]], however this is a less common practice than producing overload potions. It takes level 75 [[herblore]] to clean a [[grimy torstol]]; cleaning torstol gives 15 [[Herblore]] [[experience]]. Clean torstol can also be used to make [[torstol incense sticks]].

==Obtaining==
Torstol may be obtained through the [[Farming]] skill, by planting a [[torstol seed]] in a [[herb patch]] with 85 Farming. Torstol seeds are very rare drops, but nevertheless farming is the most common source of Torstol.

Torstol may also be obtained from the [[closed chest]] in [[Yanille]]'s [[Agility Dungeon]]. To unlock the chest a player needs a [[sinister key]], which is a drop from [[Salarin the Twisted]] and a possible item of loot from [[magpie impling]]s and [[nature impling]]s. Before the release of the Farming skill, the sinister chest was the only way to obtain torstol.

Torstol may also be obtained as a possible alcove reward from burning [[vyre corpse]]s on pyres in the [[Paterdomus]] temple's Columbarium.

Noted torstol herbs are also dropped by [[ancient mage]]s.

After the ring of wealth update the torstol herbs can be dropped (noted) from several monsters that give access to the [[rare drop table]].

Torstol is one of the five herbs that cannot be obtained from the [[Sorceress's Garden]] [[minigames|minigame]] in [[Al Kharid]], along with [[Grimy toadflax|toadflax]], [[Grimy spirit weed|spirit weed]], [[Grimy snapdragon|snapdragon]], and [[Grimy wergali|wergali]].

'''Guthix rest''' is a restorative [[Herblore#potions|potion]] created during [[One Small Favour]]. Once [[Sanfew]] teaches the player how to mix the potion, it can be created by using a [[clean harralander]] with a [[vial of water]] to create a [[harralander potion (unf)]], followed by a [[clean marrentill]] to create a three-dose Guthix rest, granting a total of 59.5 [[Herblore]] experience. The combined cost of all the required herbs and vial of water would be {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Vial of water}} + {{GEP|Clean harralander}} + {{GEP|Clean marrentill}}|c}} on the Grand Exchange.

It cures poison and provides around 30 seconds of poison immunity, heals 500 life points per dose, restores 5% [[Energy|run energy]] and boosts the maximum [[life points]] by 500 at full health. A full four dose potion restores a total of 2000 life points, same as a [[shark]], but takes four clicks. However, Guthix rest does not drain [[adrenaline]], and is not affected by [[Constitution]] (full healing is received regardless of level).

Guthix rests are often preferred over [[Saradomin brew]]s in scenarios where you need less healing, as Guthix rests do not drain your stats unlike Saradomin brews.

Attempting to make this potion before speaking with Sanfew will result in: ''"You have no idea what effect this would have."''

Mixing a [[Wine of Guthix]] with Guthix rest at level 93 Herblore creates a [[Super Guthix rest]].

Some players chose to repeatedly use this glitch to gain an unfair advantage in PvP situations and were subsequently banned from the game for violating the [[Rules of RuneScape|rules]].

[[File:Watermelon detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''watermelon''' is a fruit harvested from a [[watermelon plant]] grown from a [[watermelon seed]] in an [[allotment patch]], requiring level 47 [[Farming]]. A minimum of three watermelons is harvested at a time when farmed in an allotment. If a [[harvest potion]] is active, [[golden watermelon]]s will be harvested instead of regular watermelons.

Watermelons can be sliced into [[watermelon slice]]s, and are also an ingredient in [[summer pie]]s and [[harvest potion]]s. Watermelons are also used to craft [[scarecrow]]s.

Farmers will watch over a planted [[jangerberry seed]] in exchange for 6 watermelons, a planted [[pineapple seed]] in exchange for 10 watermelons, or a planted [[potato cactus seed]] in exchange for 10 watermelons.

==Farming==
Watermelons can be harvested from watermelon plants grown within an [[allotment patch]]. A fully grown watermelon plant will yield a minimum of three watermelons at harvest. Each watermelon, when picked, gives 29 Farming experience.

Harvest yields for watermelon plants are determined by a "harvest lives" system. Each watermelon plant begins with three lives. Additional lives are added with the use of compost (+1 life), supercompost (+2 lives), and ultracompost (+3 lives). Every harvest action will roll a chance out of 255 on the specific patch's "Chance to Save", taking one of the harvest lives from the patch if it does not hit; the patch will be cleared when it runs out of lives. The "Chance to Save" is dependent on the player's Farming level.

'''Poison ivy berries''' are berries harvested from a [[poison ivy bush]] grown from a [[poison ivy seed]] planted in a [[bush patch]], requiring level 70 [[Farming]]. Four poison ivy berries can be harvested from a bush patch at a time. 

Poison ivy berries are required to craft [[Weapon poison++]] potions. After completing the [[Jungle Potion]] [[quest]], farmers will watch over a planted [[calquat seed]] in exchange for 8 poison ivy berries (6 with [[Master farmer outfit]]). 

==Farming==
Poison ivy berries can be harvested from [[poison ivy bush]]es grown within a [[bush patch]]. A fully grown poison ivy bush can grow up to four poison ivy berries at a time. Each poison ivy berry, when picked, gives 45 [[Farming]] experience. Once all four poison ivy berries have been picked, the bush will produce one poison ivy berry per 20 minute [[Farming#:~:text=A%20player%20reaches%20a%20growth,fall%20into%20each%20growth%20window.|growth tick]]. However, the poison ivy berries may be picked individually provided that at least one appears on the bush.

[[File:Papaya fruit detail.png|100px|left]]
A '''papaya fruit''' is a fruit harvested from a [[papaya tree]] grown from a [[papaya seed]] in a [[fruit tree patch]], requiring level 57 [[Farming]]. Up to six papaya fruit can be harvested from an papaya tree at a time.

Papayas are required for crafting [[adrenaline potion]]s at level 84 [[Herblore]] and must be used as bait to catch [[pawya]]s at level 66 [[Hunter]]. Papaya fruit can be eaten raw and heals up to 500  [[life points]] and 10 [[run energy]] each.

Farmers will watch over a planted [[palm tree seed]] in exchange for fifteen papaya fruit.

==Farming==
Papayas can be harvested from [[papaya trees]] grown within a [[fruit tree patch]]. A fully grown papaya tree can grow up to six papayas at a time. Each papaya, when picked, gives [[Farming]] experience. Once all six papayas have been picked, the tree will slowly produce more papayas until six more are available again. However, the papayas may be picked individually provided that at least one appears on the tree.

[[File:Cactus spine detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''cactus spine''' is a cactus product harvested from a cactus planted in a [[cactus patch]], requiring level 55 [[Farming]]. Three can be harvested from a cactus patch at a time.

Cactus spines are required for making [[weapon poison+ (unf)]] potions at level 73 [[Herblore]].

Farmers will watch over a planted [[yew seed]] in exchange for ten cactus spines.

==Farming==
Cactus spines can be harvested from a [[cactus]] grown within a [[cactus patch]]. A fully grown cactus can grow up to three cactus spines at a time. Each cactus spine, when picked, gives 25 [[Farming]] experience. Once all three cactus spines have been picked, the cactus will slowly produce more cactus spines. However, the cactus spine may be picked individually provided that at least one appears on the cactus.

The yield of cactus spines increases from 3 to 6 with the completion of the [[Desert achievements#Hard achievements|hard Desert achievements]].

[[File:Magic roots detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Magic roots''' are the roots of the [[magic tree]]. Players with level 75 [[Farming]] can plant a [[magic seed]] in a [[tree patch]] and chop the tree down to a stump after it has grown. The player may then use a spade on the stump to dig up the tree roots, clearing the patch for another tree and putting the magic roots into the player's [[inventory]]. If the roots are not immediately dug up, the tree will respawn, and it may be cut down again.

As with all tree roots, magic roots may be used in a [[compost bin]] to make [[supercompost]], but is not recommended due to their high value. They may be spun into [[magic string]] (instead of crossbow string like other roots) by using the magic roots on a [[spinning wheel]] with level 19 [[Crafting]]. Magic roots are also a component in the [[Herblore]] skill to make [[antipoison++]].

It is the fifth and final herb [[Trufitus]] asks you to bring him during the [[Jungle Potion]] quest. After [[Trufitus]] asks you to fetch the herb during [[Jungle Potion]], the [[Grimy rogue's purse|grimy]] version can be obtained from the walls of the [[Pothole Dungeon]]. Grimy rogue's purse can also be obtained from killing [[wandering warrior]]s and [[jogre]]s. Clean rogue's purse can be obtained during the [[Shades of Mort'ton]] quest when searching the [[smashed table]] in the house where the quest starts, but it has no use in any quests in the area. ==Creation== {{Infobox Recipe |members = Yes |ticks = 1 |skill1 = Herblore |skill1lvl = 3 |skill1boostable = |skill1exp = 2.5 |mat1 = Grimy rogue's purse |mat1cost = No |output1 = Clean rogue's purse |output1cost = no }} ==Uses== Clean Rogue's Purse has 2 uses. {| class="wikitable" width="50%" ! scope="col" |Clean rogue's purse quantity ! scope="col" |Potion/item ! scope="col" |Level ! scope="col" |Second

[[File:Clean snake weed detail.png|left|150px]]
'''Clean snake weed''' is a [[herb]] obtained by cleaning a [[grimy snake weed]]. The herb can only be identified after starting the [[Jungle Potion]] [[quest]]. It is also used during the [[Legends' Quest]] to make a [[Bravery potion]], either by adding it to a [[Vial of water]] to make a [[Snakeweed mixture]] and then adding a [[Clean ardrigal]], or by adding it to an [[Ardrigal mixture]]. It is a secondary ingredient in [[Herblore]] used with [[Clean rogue's purse|rogue's purse]] to make [[relicym's balm]] [[potion]]. It is also used as secondary ingredient to make [[Sanfew serum]]. Since it is a non-tradeable item, you are unable to store it within a [[beast of burden]]. It is also impossible to withdraw it in [[note]] form from a bank.

Twenty marshy jungle vines are found south-west of [[Tai Bwo Wannai]] in west [[Karamja]], just northwest of {{fairycode|ckr}}. Grimy snake weed can be found by searching one of the vines, though it may take several seconds. Grimy snake weed is also a common drop from [[jogre]]s, which is very convenient for players with higher combat levels who are trying to make relicym's balm, as many reside in the cave where the other needed herb, rogue's purse, is found.

A '''rabbit foot''' is received through the hunter skill by [[Rabbit snaring|snaring a rabbit]], or as produce when a [[Rabbit (player-owned farm)|rabbit]] grows on the [[player-owned farm]]. It can be made into a [[Strung rabbit foot|strung rabbit's foot]] with 37 [[Crafting]] by using a [[ball of wool]] on it. The strung rabbit's foot can be worn to increase the chances of obtaining a [[bird's nest]] whilst chopping trees/[[ivy]] and getting the [[crystal geode]] drop while cutting [[Crystal tree]]s. 

Players may also use a rabbit foot with a [[spirit weed potion (unf)]] at level 43 [[Herblore]] to create a [[divination potion]], granting 97.5 Herblore experience.

{{External|os}}

|store = No
|exchange = gemw
|examine = The roots of the Yew tree.
|weight = 0.001
|id = 6049
}}
[[File:Yew roots detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Yew roots''' are the remains of a [[yew tree]] planted in a tree farming patch. Players need level 60 [[Farming]] to grow this tree and cannot obtain roots from chopping down a wild yew tree.

Players must plant a [[yew seed]] in a [[plant pot]] filled with soil, water it with a [[watering can]], and then wait for the [[yew sapling]] to [[Wikipedia:Germination|germinate]]. Players must then plant the seedling in one of six [[tree patches]] and wait for it to grow to maturity. Paying a gardener the required fee of ten [[cactus spine]]s may not be recommended, since the payment costs around 60% of the price of a yew seed, and if the gardener is not paid, generally only around 10% of seeds will die (when using [[supercompost]]). Players also have the option to then plant a [[cactus]], which yields three every 25 minutes. Finally, players must chop down the tree using a [[Hatchets|hatchet]] (yielding [[yew logs]]) and then dig up the roots using a [[spade]].

Yew roots (like all tree roots) can be used to make [[supercompost]] for use in Farming, or crossbow strings for [[Fletching]]. Yew roots are also used in [[Herblore]] as the secondary ingredient to make [[antipoison+|antipoison+ (4)]], requiring level 68 Herblore and giving 155 Herblore experience.

43898.content:
{{External|os}}
{{otheruses|the Ranged weapon|the hunter creature|Black salamander (Hunter)|the livestock creature|Black salamander (player-owned farm)}}
{{Variant|augmented}}
{{Infobox Item

[[File:Black salamander detail.png|left|Black salamander|100px]]
The '''black salamander''' is the strongest [[salamander]] and can be caught using the [[Hunter]] skill at level 67, using a [[small fishing net]] and a [[rope]] to set a trap on a tree. It requires level 70 [[Ranged]], and it is 2-handed. [[Harralander tar]] is used as ammunition for the salamander; it is not retrievable like regular bolts and arrows, even with the use of one of [[Ava's device]]s. However, little ammunition is consumed when using abilities.

The black salamander is a popular weapon and is a cheaper alternative to [[Karil's crossbow]], with identical damage and accuracy. The black salamander also does not degrade, though its attack range is shorter. Nevertheless, it is a cheap yet effective weapon when slaying monsters weak to bolts.

Black salamanders are a secondary ingredient in [[camouflage potion]]s.

The price of black salamanders rose dramatically in anticipation for [[Invention]]; it is a popular item to [[Augmentation|augment]] and [[disassemble]] for a large amount of Invention experience, due to its ease to obtain compared to any weapon of similar strength, subsequently falling on release of [[Wilderness Flash Events]].

==Update history==
{{UH|
* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (13 May 2013)|date=13 May 2013}}
** Salamanders now only require the appropriate Ranged level to equip them.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (4 December 2012)|date=4 December 2012}}
** Salamanders can now be sheathed.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (17 January 2011)|date=17 January 2011}}
** This weapon has had its wield and attack animations updated.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (10 January 2011)|date=10 January 2011}}
** Attacking with this weapon's magic attack no longer claims every hit is a max hit.

* {{UL|type=update|update=HUNTER SKILL!|date=21 November 2006}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
*Prior to the [[Evolution of Combat]] update, the black salamander dealt damage up to 2.5 times the level of the fighting style you were using. Black salamanders could use all three fighting styles: Scorch (strength), Blaze (magic) attack styles, and Flare (ranged) attack style. The attack speed of the Black Salamander when using Scorch or Blaze was 5 ticks, whereas Flare (ranged) attacked at a speed of 4 ticks, which is similar in concept to the Rapid style of most ranged weapons.
*Prior to the EoC update, salamander gave combat experience equivalent to 2/5 of your damage as exp.
*Prior to the EoC Update, it is possible to hit 638 life points of damage using the Black Salamander when combat stats are boosted to level 255 during the [[While Guthix Sleeps]] quest. (255*2.5= 637.5)
*Like Chinchompas and Flags/Standards, the character's animations when wielding a salamander used to use the obsolete and choppy animation, even after the RuneScape "High Detail" update.
*In Clan Wars and the Duel Arena, if magic is turned off (or set to a certain spellbook/binding spells in the case of Clan Wars), the Salamander's magic option still works and counts as magic damage.
*Before [[13 May]] [[2013]], this weapon also required 70 [[Attack]] and 70 [[Magic]]. This was because it was a multi-style weapon before the [[Evolution of Combat]], although the Attack and Magic requirements were not removed immediately after it became a ranged weapon with the update.
*Black salamanders used to escape and disappear if a player died with them in their inventory.

[[File:Gold charm detail.png|left|70px]]
A '''gold charm''' is the first- and lowest-tier charm of the four main types of [[charms]] used in the [[Summoning]] [[skills|skill]], and the only available in [[free-to-play]], with no requirements to use. The amount of experience gained from creating [[Summoning pouches]] that use gold charms varies from 4.8 to 93.2 experience each, depending on the pouch being created.

Common ways to obtain gold charms are as a drop from various monsters, hunting [[charm sprite]]s, and thieving [[Dorgesh-Kaan Rich Chest]]s. [[Gelatinous abomination]]s is one effective source for low-level players as they have a high drop rate and are easy to kill. It is possible to receive multiple charms in one drop from higher-level opponents. 

Gold charms may also be purchased using [[Zeal]] obtained from the [[Soul Wars]] minigame or by visiting [[Pikkupstix's Summoning Shop]] in [[Taverley]] for one free sample gold charm. Players will receive 275 gold charms upon completion of [[Wolf Whistle]], which may be used to start [[Summoning training|training the skill]]. 

Additionally, [[Spirit gems]] may be used to save these charms when creating pouches.

The [[Charming Imp]] may be used to automatically collect these charms.

====Monster drops in free-to-play worlds====
Most of the monsters do not drop gold charms in [[free-to-play]] worlds. [[Troll chucker]]s, [[troll brute]]s, [[troll shaman]]s, and [[cow]]s in [[Astram Farm]] are the only monsters that drop gold charms in free-to-play worlds.

==Trivia==
* Gold charms appear in Magestix and Pikkupstix's shop inventories, but they cannot be sold to them, and there is no stock of the item. There is a single free sample that can be taken, but it is an inefficient way to obtain them as it takes a long time to restock.
* Gold charms were allowed for free players as of[[4 March]] [[2013]], along with the release of [[The World Wakes]]. All other charms remain members only.
* There was also a 'glitch' in the Dagannoth Lighthouse where there is a gold charm that is dropped but unobtainable; however, some speculate this is a counter measure to bots as they will click on the unobtainable charm for hours, although this is probably just a mistake.

49493.name: Green charm
49493.content:
{{Dgvariant}} {{Infobox Item |name = Green charm |image = [[File:Green charm.png]] |release = [[15 January]] [[2008]] |update = Summoning! |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = No |equipable = No |stackable = Yes |disassembly = Yes |value = 2 |destroy = Drop |kept = reclaimable |store = No |examine = A charm used to summon familiars. |weight = 0 |id = 12159 }} [[File:Green charm detail.png|left|70px]] A '''green charm''' is the second-tier charm of the four major primary [[charms|charm types]] used in the [[Summoning]] skill. The use of green charms in the creation of [[Summoning pouches]] requires Summoning level 18. The amount of experience gained from creating pouches that use green charms varies from 31.2 to 283.4 each, depending on the [[summoning pouches|pouch]] being created. One of the more popular methods of obtaining these charms is by killing [[cave bug]]s (level 12), as they have a 37% [[drop rate]] and very low [[life points]]. Green charms may also be purchased using [[Zeal]] obtained from the [[Soul Wars]] minigame. The green charm is regarded as one of the less-useful charms for training as the cost in coins-per-[[experience|experience point]] is high compared to that of the other charms. This means that the player ends up requiring large amounts of Spirit shards for comparatively less experience in return. This may be a trade-off for the utility and money-making ability of green charm [[familiar]]s (most familiars summoned with green charms are used for training [[skills]], not [[combat]]). Additionally, [[spirit gems]] may be used to save these charms when creating [[summoning pouches]]. The [[charming imp]] may be used to automatically collect these charms. ==Creation== {{Switch infobox |text1 = Charm slices |item1 = {{Infobox Recipe |method = charm slices |members = Yes |ticks = |skill = No |mat1 = Green charm slice |mat1qty = 5 |mat1cost = no |output1 = Green charm |output1cost = no }} |text2 = Transmutation |item2 = {{Infobox Recipe |method = transmutation |members = Yes |ticks = 3 |skill1 = Divination |skill1lvl = 64 |skill1exp = 134 |mat1 = Vibrant energy |mat1qty = 250 |mat2 = Gold charm |mat2qty = 20 |mat2cost = no |output1 = Green charm |output1qty = 10 |output1cost = no }} }} ==Products== ===General=== {{Uses material list|Green charm|exclude=pouch creation|xp=true}} ===Familiars=== Green charms are used to create [[pouch (Summoning)|pouches]] for the following familiars: {| class="wikitable sortable" !Level !Familiar !Tertiary

49564.name: Crimson charm
49564.content:
{{Dgvariant}} {{Infobox Item |name = Crimson charm |image = [[File:Crimson charm.png]] |release = [[15 January]] [[2008]] |update = Summoning! |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = No |equipable = No |stackable = Yes |disassembly = Yes |value = 3 |destroy = Drop |kept = reclaimable |store = No |examine = A charm used to summon familiars. |weight = 0 |id = 12160 }} [[File:Crimson charm detail.png|left|70px]] A '''crimson charm''' is the third-tier charm of the four major primary [[charms|charm types]] used in the Summoning [[skills|skill]] to create [[Summoning pouches|pouches]]. The use of crimson charms in the creation of Summoning pouches requires [[Summoning]] level 19. The amount of [[experience]] gained from creating pouches that use crimson charms varies from 83.2 to 1015.2 each, depending on the pouch being created. [[Spirit gems]] may be used to save these charms when creating pouches. Some of the more popular methods of obtaining these charms include killing [[black demon]]s, [[rock lobster]]s using [[Magic]], [[dagannoth]]s, [[waterfiend]]s for mid- to high-level players, and [[abyssal demon]]s as high-level players. The [[charming imp]] may be used to automatically collect these charms. Crimson charms may also be purchased using [[Zeal]] obtained from the [[Soul Wars]] minigame. Crimson charms are used in the creation of [[talon beast pouch]]es, which yield 1,015.2 experience. This is the highest experience-yield of the creation of any pouch, including those made using [[blue charm]]s, the highest-tier summoning charm. [[Talon beast charm]]s are required as the [[Tertiary ingredient (Summoning)|tertiary ingredient]] for talon beast pouches, and these can only be obtained by slaying [[nail beast]]s during the [[Temple Trekking]] minigame. ==Creation== {{Switch infobox |text1 = Charm slices |item1 = {{Infobox Recipe |method = charm slices |members = Yes |ticks = |skill = No |mat1 = Crimson charm slice |mat1qty = 5 |mat1cost = no |output1 = Crimson charm |output1cost = no }} |text2 = Transmutation |item2 = {{Infobox Recipe |method = transmutation |members = Yes |ticks = 3 |skill1 = Divination |skill1lvl = 74 |skill1exp = 154 |mat1 = Lustrous energy |mat1qty = 750 |mat2 = Green charm |mat2qty = 30 |mat2cost = no |output1 = Crimson charm |output1qty = 10 |output1cost = no }} }} ==Products== ===General=== {{Uses material list|Crimson charm|exclude=pouch creation|xp=true}} ===Familiars=== The following familiars require a crimson charm to make their pouch: {| class="wikitable sortable sticky-header align-center-1 align-right-5 align-right-6 align-right-7 align-right-8" !Level !Familiar !Tertiary !Shards !XP !GE price !Profit !GP/XP |- |19 |{{plink|Spirit scorpion pouch|txt=Spirit scorpion}} |[[Bronze claws]]

A '''Summoning potion''' restores a player's [[Summoning points]], much like a [[prayer potion]] restores one's [[Prayer points]]. It can be made at level 40 [[Herblore]] by using a [[clean spirit weed]] on a [[vial of water]] and then adding a [[cockatrice egg]]. This gives 92 Herblore experience. As with prayer potions, this potion only restores points; it will not add points above the user's level. It restores 72 to 317 Summoning points (70 + 25% of total Summoning points) and 15 [[Special moves|Summoning special move points]] per dose.

==Products==
{{Uses material list|Summoning potion (4)|versions=4|headers=potions}}

==Uses==
Summoning potions are generally used when training slayer to allow players to remain at a task's location for a longer period of time. This is particularly useful for the [[bunyip]], [[unicorn stallion]], and other healing familiars, as well as [[beasts of burden]]. Summoning potions are also helpful when using a steel titan familiar.

In places where a player constantly uses [[Winter storage]], each additional 3-dose summoning potion would cost {{Coins|{{GEP|Summoning potion (3)|4/15}} + {{GEP|Pack Yak scroll (Winter Storage)}}}} coins.

{{UH|
* {{UL|type=patch|update=Pures Mini Strike & Retro Abyssal Whip - This Week In RuneScape|date=27 March 2023}}
** The Summoning potion tooltip has been updated to show that it restores 15 special move points.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (19 November 2013)|date=19 November 2013}}
** Players no longer receive a "Nothing interesting happens" message when trying to create a summoning potion by using a spirit weed potion on a cockatrice egg.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (4 June 2013)|date=4 June 2013}}
** Drinking Summoning potions now plays the correct animation.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (11 December 2012)|date=11 December 2012}}
** All variants of Cockatrice eggs are now recognised when making a summoning potion.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (1 March 2011)|date=1 March 2011}}
** Summoning potions now use the core potions script, so they will no longer delay damage.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (25 May 2010)|date=25 May 2010}}
** The speed at which Summoning potions could be made was a bit too fast.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Summoning!|date=15 January 2008}}
** Added to game.
}}

[[File:Cockatrice egg detail.png|left|60px]]
The '''cockatrice egg''' is a tertiary drop from the [[cockatrice]], and can also be looted from a [[spirit impling]] or the [[Spirit impling jar|jarred version]]. Alternately, it can be created from an ordinary chicken [[egg]] by casting [[Oph. incubation scroll|Ophidian incubation]], the special attack of the [[spirit cobra]]. The [[spirit cockatrice]] can occasionally create an egg as well.

It can be mixed with an [[Spirit weed potion (unf)|unfinished spirit weed potion]] at level 40 [[Herblore]] to create a [[Summoning potion]], or used as the tertiary ingredient of the [[spirit cockatrice pouch]], along with 88 [[spirit shard]]s and a [[green charm]], at level 43 [[Summoning]].

This egg cannot be incubated at an [[Incubator]].

}}

{{Drop sources|Cockatrice egg}}

==2008 Easter Event==
In the [[2008 Easter event]], the [[Easter Bunny]] had people dip a [[cockatrice egg (Easter)|Easter cockatrice egg]] in chocolate. This made it a [[chocatrice egg]]. It could then be incubated to hatch a [[chocatrice]].

A '''zamatrice egg''' is a special egg used in [[Summoning]]. To obtain a zamatrice egg you must either loot a [[spirit impling jar]], or get a [[Bird's egg (red)|red bird's egg]] from a [[bird's nest]], and use the [[spirit cobra]]'s special ability, [[Oph. incubation scroll|Ophidian Incubation]], on the egg. Summoning a spirit cobra requires 63 [[Summoning]]. A zamatrice egg is an ingredient for a [[Spirit zamatrice]].

[[File:Grenwall spikes 5 detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Grenwall spikes''' are spikes which can be obtained by hunting [[grenwall]]s, a creature native to [[Isafdar]], at level 77 [[Hunter]]. They require a [[box trap]] and [[pawya meat]] as bait to catch, though the bait requirement can be negated with the [[Tirannwn quiver 2]] or better.

Five spikes are the secondary ingredient to [[extreme ranging]] potions. They can also be used to make [[headless arrow]]s, though this is inadvisable due to their high cost.

Grenwall hunting has the potential to be profitable, making up to {{formatnum:{{#expr:{{GEPrice|Grenwall spikes|n}} * 162000 round -5}}}} coins from 77-99 Hunter if catching both [[pawya]] and grenwall. This all depends on the current Grand Exchange prices, average spikes per grenwall, and if herbs are collected or not. Refer to the [[grenwall]] page for more information about hunting them.

}}
==Trivia==
* If a spike is used on [[Leon]], he'll say that the spike can be used in something he has yet to invent.
* Grenwall spikes have the same icon as [[chaotic spike]]s.
* Grenwall spikes were reducing gradually in price due to [[bots]] flooding the hunting locations; going from an extremely profitable way to skill to much less profitable. When [[ClusterFlutterer]] was released the price started to rise again.
** Later, completing the medium [[Tirannwn Tasks]] makes it possible to hunt grenwall without requiring to bait the traps, the hourly hunter experience became even more. As a result grenwall spikes became a lot more common, causing the prices to crash.
** Furthermore, after the release of [[Ornate tortle]]s the spikes started rising again due to the lower number of high levelled players using them as a training method, instead opting for the higher xp/h tortles and as a result less spikes entering the game.

A '''guthatrice egg''' is a special egg used in [[Summoning]]. To obtain a Guthatrice egg, players must obtain a [[Bird's egg (green)|green bird's egg]] from a [[bird's nest]] (which can fall from a tree when [[Woodcutting]] or be collected from the [[Managing Miscellania]] activity) or from looting a spirit impling and use the [[spirit cobra]]'s special ability, [[Oph. incubation scroll|Ophidian Incubation]], on the egg.

Summoning a spirit cobra requires 63 [[Summoning]]. At 43 Summoning, a guthatrice egg can be used as an ingredient in a [[spirit guthatrice]] pouch. To make a spirit guthatrice pouch, players must take the egg, a [[pouch]], a [[green charm]], and 88 [[spirit shard]]s to an [[obelisk]].

[[File:Pengatrice egg detail.png|left|80px]]
A '''pengatrice egg''' is an ingredient for a [[Spirit pengatrice]], a level 43 [[Summoning]] [[familiar]].

In order to obtain a Pengatrice egg you must use the [[Spirit cobra]]'s special ability on a [[Penguin egg]] (requires level 63 [[Summoning]]). The pengatrice egg is one of the easiest eggs to create. You may talk to the Penguin Keeper at the Ardougne Zoo to get a free penguin egg from him, although he will not give the player a penguin egg if the player already has a penguin egg in inventory, in the bank, or in an incubator, or has a baby or adult penguin following the player, in inventory, or in the bank. However, if the player has an adult penguin, placing it in the Pet house of a Player-owned house will allow the player to get another penguin egg from the keeper.

Use the [[spirit cobra]]'s [[special move]] scroll, [[Ophidian Incubation]] on it creates a Pengatrice egg, yielding a profit of {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Pengatrice egg}} - {{GEP|Spirit Cobra scroll (Ophidian Incubation)}}}} coins for each egg created.

Pengatrice eggs may also be found when catching a [[Spirit Impling]].

Blue bird's eggs are only obtainable from [[bird's nest]]s. Saratrice eggs are a possible loot from a [[Spirit impling]]. A Saratrice egg is an ingredient for a [[Spirit saratrice]] pouch.

A '''vulatrice egg''' is an ingredient for a [[spirit vulatrice]], a level 43 [[Summoning]] [[familiar]]. You need a Green charm, the Vulatrice egg, and 88 Spirit shards to create the creature.

In order to obtain a vulatrice egg, you must use the [[spirit cobra]]'s special ability on a [[vulture egg]] (requires level 63 Summoning). There is also the chance to receive it from catching the [[Magpie impling]] or [[Spirit impling]] with a [[Butterfly net]] or [[Magic butterfly net]] and [[Impling jar]] as rare drop.

It is currently the most valuable of the [[cockatrice egg]] variants. It could potentially be used to make money, as even transforming one egg will pay for the cost of the cobra and scroll.

A '''coraxatrice egg''' is a component of the [[Spirit coraxatrice pouch]] used to [[summon]] a level 43 [[Spirit coraxatrice]], one of the [[Summoning familiars]]. It is obtained by using a [[Raven egg]] with a [[Spirit cobra]]'s special ability, Ophidian Incubation, requiring a [[Summoning]] level of 63. At one point, Coraxatrice eggs were the rarest and most expensive of the [[cockatrice egg]] variants due to the rarity of [[Raven egg]]s. Coraxatrice eggs may also be obtained from [[Spirit impling]]s.

[[File:Wimpy feather detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Wimpy feathers''' are dropped by [[wimpy bird]]s, which are found in [[Oo'glog]] during and after the [[As a First Resort]] [[quest]]. Catching wimpy birds requires level 39 [[Hunter]] and provides 167 experience. The player must use a [[bird snare]] and must be holding [[smouldering tansymum]] to lure them.

Wimpy feathers can be used to [[Fletching|fletch]] arrows. Unlike other coloured feathers, these cannot be used to make [[feather headdress]]es.

They are also used with a [[clean wergali]] herb and a [[vial of water]] to make [[Fletching potion]]s at level 58 [[Herblore]], providing 132 experience.

30 and 118 wimpy feathers are a possible reward from [[Herblore crate (small)|small]] and [[Herblore crate (large)|large Herblore crates]] respectively, which were originally available from the [[Squeal of Fortune]] and [[Treasure Hunter]].

55613.content:
{{Infobox Item
|name = Rubium

|release = [[11 March]] [[2008]]
|update = Kennith's Concerns

|restriction = surface

|disassembly = Yes
|kept = reclaimable
|store = No
|examine = Be careful with this near water!
|weight = 1
|id = 12630
}}
[[File:Rubium detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Rubium''' is an [[ore]] that players can only [[Mining|mine]] deep within the [[Witchaven Dungeon]] at the [[Witchaven mine]] during and after the [[Kennith's Concerns]] quest.

Rubium has high reactivity with water. Thus, during the quest, it is used on the steamers to raise the room temperature significantly in order to disrupt the workers. However, the rubium will burn up if players get kicked out, so they still need to be careful not to get caught. After the quest, players may sell rubium to [[Ezekial Lovecraft]] in his [[Lovecraft's Tackle|fishing shop]], based in Witchaven for 10 [[coins]] per ore. Doing this is required for the [[Ardougne Tasks#Medium tasks|medium Ardougne task]] 'Volatile Valuables'. During [[Salt in the Wound]], Ezekial utilises homemade rubium grenades as his primary weapon.

Players may also mix it into a [[guam potion (unf)]] at 31 [[Herblore]] to make a [[Super fishing explosive]]. Super fishing explosives give 55 [[experience]] to make and will damage [[mogre]]s for 150 [[life points]] whilst luring.

In total, there are only twelve [[rubium vein]]s located in the mine, requiring 46 [[Mining]] to be mined. It cannot be mined with the [[Dwarven Army Axe]].

100 rubium is needed in order to fill the [[super explosive flask]] to make the [[super explosive shaker]].

Rubium will respawn when a player leaves and reenters the mine room.

Players can access the mine by entering the ruins and taking the entrance directly east and follow the cavern through (use of shortcut with the required agility level) and use the entrance option located just before the open doors.

** Gilded pickaxes now function correctly when mining rubium.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Kennith's Concerns|date=11 March 2008}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
*Rubium may be based on the real-life metallic element {{WP|rubidium}}, which is also highly reactive with water and chemically unstable. Although rubidium is a silvery-white Group I alkali metal, it burns with a reddish-violet colour in a flame. In contrast, rubium is directly coloured as red. However, its reactivity is a closer match to {{WP|Sodium}}.
*Despite its high reactivity with water, using it on any water source (sink, well, etc.) or any container of water (bowl of water, bucket of water, etc.) only yields this message: "Nothing interesting happens."

[[File:Mining rubium.png|left|thumb|300px|Players can mine rubium from the walls in designated parts of the [[Dungeons|dungeon]] under [[Witchaven]].]]

[[File:Clean spirit weed detail.png|100px|left]]
'''Clean spirit weed''' is a [[grimy spirit weed]] that has been cleaned. It requires level 35 [[Herblore]] to clean and grants 7.8 experience per herb. It is the seventh lowest level herb available, and can be added to a [[vial of water]] to make a [[spirit weed potion (unf)]], which is used in the [[Herblore]] skill to make [[summoning potion]]s, [[summoning renewal]], [[divination potion]]s, and [[super necromancy]].

Spirit weed may be grown in a [[herb patch]] by players with 36 [[Farming]]. Growing these can be very profitable, as they are in high demand due to their usage in [[spirit weed incense sticks]]. They are one of five herbs that cannot be obtained from the [[Sorceress's Garden]].

Both the spirit weed seeds and the spirit weed herbs are a blue-green colour, making them distinctly different in appearance from other herb seeds and herbs.

[[File:Ground mud runes detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Ground mud runes''' are an item used during the quest [[The Eyes of Glouphrie]] by using a [[pestle and mortar]] on a [[Mud rune]], awarding the player with 1 [[Herblore]] experience. Adding them to a [[bucket of sap]] turns it into [[magic glue]] which can be used as a glue to repair a broken machine in [[Brimstail]]'s cave near the [[Gnome Stronghold]].

Ground mud runes are also used to make [[Extreme magic]] potions, by using ground mud runes on a 3-dose[[Super magic potion|Super Magic potion]] at level 91 [[Herblore]], granting 250 Herblore experience.

* {{UL|type=update|update=The Eyes of Glouphrie|date=15 August 2006}}

}}

==Trivia==
* [[Mud rune]]s are one of the only two runes that can be ground with pestle and mortar, the other being [[Astral rune]]s, which are ground for the [[Dream Mentor]] quest.
* Ground mud runes weigh more than normal mud runes, which like all stackable items weigh nothing. After [[10 March]] [[2014]], they are now stackable themselves.

[[File:Harralander potion (unf) detail.png|left|50px]]
A '''harralander potion (unf)''' is an unfinished potion made via the [[Herblore]] skill. Players make it by using a [[clean harralander]] on a [[vial of water]].

It is used to make the [[restore potion]] at level 22 by adding a [[red spiders' eggs]], earning 62.5 [[experience]]. It can be used to make [[blamish oil]] at level 25 by adding [[blamish snail slime]], earning 80 experience. It is also used to make the [[energy potion]] at level 26 by adding a [[chocolate dust]], earning 67.5 experience. During and after the quest [[One Small Favour]], a [[clean marrentill]] can be added to make a [[Guthix Rest]] potion, earning 59.5 experience. It can be used to make a [[combat potion]] at level 36 by adding [[goat horn dust]], earning 84 experience. Finally, it can be used to make a [[cooking potion]] at level 55 by adding [[swordfish|cooked swordfish]], earning 125 experience.

[[File:Clean wergali detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Clean wergali''' is a [[grimy wergali]] that has been cleaned. It is used in the [[Herblore]] skill. The [[Wergali seed|seeds]] to grow it can be obtained through [[Vinesweeper]] for 3,800 points, monster drops, or if a player has unlocked the [[Scroll of life]] effect from [[Dungeoneering/Rewards|Dungeoneering]]. The clean herb can be obtained from the [[Brimhaven Agility Arena]] for 5 tickets.

Using a clean Wergali on a [[vial of water]] will result in obtaining a [[Wergali potion (unf)]].

==Trivia==
*Wergali is one of the few herbs that do not possess a greenish colour.
*Wergali and [[Bloodweed]] may be inspired by the {{wp|Ricinus communis}}, a reddish-brown angiosperm that contains a lethal dose of ricin.

120322.name: Crafting potion
120322.content:
{{oupotion}} {{Infobox Item |version1 = (1) |version2 = (2) |version3 = (3) |version4 = (4) |defver = 4 |name1 = Crafting potion (1) |name2 = Crafting potion (2) |name3 = Crafting potion (3) |name4 = Crafting potion (4) |image1 = [[File:Crafting potion (1).png]] |image2 = [[File:Crafting potion (2).png]] |image3 = [[File:Crafting potion (3).png]] |image4 = [[File:Crafting potion (4).png]] |release = [[9 June]] [[2009]] |update = Run energy upgrade |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = Yes |equipable = No |edible = Yes |stackable = No |disassembly = Yes |noteable = Yes |actions = Drink, Empty |value1 = 52 |value2 = 105 |value3 = 160 |value4 = 215 |destroy = Drop |kept = reclaimable |store = No |exchange = gemw |examine1 = 1 dose of crafting potion. |examine2 = 2 doses of crafting potion. |examine3 = 3 doses of crafting potion. |examine4 = 4 doses of crafting potion. |weight1 = 0.02 |weight2 = 0.025 |weight3 = 0.03 |weight4 = 0.035 |id1 = 14844 |id2 = 14842 |id3 = 14840 |id4 = 14838 }} {{Synced switch |version1 = [[File:Crafting potion (1) detail.png|left|100px]] |version2 = [[File:Crafting potion (2) detail.png|left|100px]] |version3 = [[File:Crafting potion (3) detail.png|left|100px]] |version4 = [[File:Crafting potion (4) detail.png|left|100px]] }} '''Crafting potions''' are made by mixing [[Clean wergali]] and [[Frog spawn]] in a [[vial]] of water, giving 95 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 42 Herblore. When consumed, crafting potions temporarily raise the player's [[Crafting]] level by 3. This boost may be used to boost crafting levels for quests such as [[Lost City]] and [[Creature of Fenkenstrain]]. '''Fletching potion''' is made by mixing [[clean wergali]] and a [[wimpy feather]] in a [[vial of water]], giving 132 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 58 Herblore. Fletching potions temporarily raise the [[Fletching]] level by 3.

This potion is the only Fletching level booster (apart from [[Evil Dave]]'s [[spicy stew]]s, [[Dungeoneering potions]] and [[God banner]]s). Theoretically, this would be the second best potion to make for power levelling Herblore after [[extreme ranging]], because wimpy feathers stack, allowing 27 potions to be made in one inventory instead of 14. However, due to the fact that all aspects of this potion (buying the wergali, buying the wimpy feathers, and selling the potion) are difficult, it is not often made.

[[File:Wergali potion (unf) detail.png|left|50px]]
A '''wergali potion (unf)''' is an unfinished potion made via the [[Herblore]] skill. Players make it by using a [[clean wergali]] on a [[vial of water]].

It is used to make the [[Crafting potion]] at level 42 by adding a [[frog spawn]], earning 95 [[experience]], along with making the [[Runecrafting potion]] at level 54 by adding a season sheep wool ([[Summerdown wool]], [[Springsheared wool]], [[Winterwold wool]] or [[Fallfaced wool]]) earning 122.5 experience. Furthermore, you can also make the [[Fletching potion]] at level 58 by adding a [[wimpy feather]], earning 132 experience.

[[File:rocktail detail.png|100px|left]]
'''Rocktail''' is a type of [[fish]] that can be found in the [[Living Rock Caverns]] and the [[Deep Sea Fishing]] Hub. The Living Rock Caverns are located underneath the [[Dwarven Mine]], which is located under [[Falador]] and extends to [[Ice Mountain]]. Players need level 90 [[Fishing]] to catch rocktail and level 93 [[Cooking]] to cook them. Rocktail are an ingredient in [[rocktail soup]], portents, [[powerburst of vitality]], and [[calorie bomb (rocktail)]].

==Cooking==
[[Raw rocktail]] can be cooked starting at level 93. They give 225Cooking experience per fish, yielding roughly 315,000 experience per hour; with [[decorated cooking urn]]s, this increases to 378,000 experience per hour. 

Raw rocktails stop burning only if wearing [[cooking gauntlets]] at level 94 or using the [[Cooking cape]] perk. 

A series of tests were conducted with cooking gauntlets equipped, at the minimum level to cook them (93), yielding a burn rate of:

* 27 rocktails out of 3,969 (0.68%) 
* 18 rocktails out of 2,176 (0.83%)

Without cooking gauntlets, rocktail burn at high rates, even with a Cooking level boosted to 103 using a [[Chef's delight]].

==Healing==
{{Food calculator|base=92}}

Rocktail heal up to 2,300 [[life points]], depending on the player's [[Constitution]] level; the optimum healing for rocktail starts at level 92. They can also boost a player's life points by 10% above the maximum.

|level = 90

}}

==Price history==
Following the release of [[Deep Sea Fishing]] in May 2018, rocktails were surpassed by [[sailfish]] as the single-click highest healing fish, and the price crashed as a result. Following the release of the [[Anachronia Dinosaur Farm]], the price has recovered due to the their use as an ingredient in the [[powerburst of vitality]].

==Update history==
{{UH|
* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (24 June 2013)|date=24 June 2013}}
** Rocktails and rocktail soup now work as intended with expensive spices.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (6 October 2010)|date=6 October 2010}}
** Improved the rocktail inventory icon.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Living Rock Caverns|date=17 September 2009}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* Rocktails look similar to the real-life {{Wp|anglerfish}}, which have a luminescent organ in the middle of their heads to lure prey towards them. [[osrsw:Anglerfish|Anglerfish]] exist in ''[[Old School RuneScape]]''.
* Rocktails, along with [[cavefish]] and [[sailfish]], are some of the few fish which provide more experience when fished than when cooked.

[[File:Overload usage.gif|frame|right|A player drinking a dose of overload]]
'''Overloads''' are [[potions]] which combine the boosting properties of all 6 combat extreme potions. They are created by combining 3-dose [[Extreme attack#(3)|extreme attack]], [[Extreme strength#(3)|extreme strength]], [[Extreme defence#(3)|extreme defence]], [[Extreme ranging#(3)|extreme ranging]], [[Extreme magic#(3)|extreme magic]], and [[Extreme necromancy#(3)|extreme necromancy]] potions with a [[clean torstol]]. The process grants 1,000 [[Herblore]] experience and requires level 96 Herblore, which can be [[Temporary skill boost|boosted]] but not [[Assist System|assisted]]. Five empty [[vial]]s are left over.

Overloads can be upgraded to the more powerful [[supreme overload]], and subsequently to the even more powerful [[elder overload]].

This potion can be made into an [[overload flask]] by using at least 6 doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

All the ingredients for an overload can be packed into a tradeable [[Overload ingredient set]].

{{Combat Potion Boost Table|15|3|is120=yes|class=mw-collapsible mw-collapsed}}

{{clear|left}}
==Mechanics==
Overloads boost [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Defence]], [[Ranged]], [[Magic]], and [[Necromancy]] by 15% of the stat level + 3 (a maximum of +17 at level 99, or +21 for Necromancy at level 120) for 6 minutes. Overloads reapply the boosts every 15 seconds, resulting in minimal [[Temporary skill boost|boost decay]] - however, once the overload wears off, the boosts are completely removed. However, the effect of overload will not wear off upon [[death (mechanic)|death]] before the 6 minutes is up.

It is a popular misconception that overloads will fully restore a player's stats every 15 seconds. This is untrue, as overloads simply '''reapply the boosts''' every 15 seconds. This property is useful to players who are using [[Saradomin brew]]s to restore life points, as the overload's frequent boosts help to counter the Saradomin brews' stat drain.

==Value==
A 3-dose overload costs {{NoCoins|{{ovlcost|1}}|c}} to make from super potions ({{NoCoins|{{ovlcost|1/3}}|c}} per dose). The [[scroll of cleansing]] can save any of the ingredients of an overload when used except for the [[extreme attack]], and [[portable well]]s can duplicate overloads completed using them.

When making overloads on a large scale, players can expect to make the following doses, on average, per potion:
* 3.585 doses with [[portable well]], a [[modified botanist's mask]], 3 pieces of the [[factory outfit]], [[botanist's amulet]], and [[brooch of the gods]].
* 3.465 doses with [[portable well]], a [[modified botanist's mask]], 3 pieces of the [[factory outfit]] and a [[botanist's amulet]].
* 3.355 doses with [[portable well]], a [[modified botanist's mask]] and a [[botanist's amulet]].
* 3.203 doses with [[portable well]] and a [[botanist's amulet]].
* 3.15 doses with [[portable well]].
* 3.05 doses with a [[botanist's amulet]].

Once creation of combination potions has been unlocked, it is generally cheaper to use one of the overload combinations instead of normal overloads, as each combination potion is 6 doses of overload made from 4 doses. For example, a holy overload costs {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Prayer renewal (4)}}+{{GEP|Crystal flask}}|c}} in addition to the overload ({{NoCoins|{{GEP|Prayer renewal (4)}}+{{GEP|Crystal flask}}+{{ovlcost|4/3}} round 0|c}} total), whereas 6 doses of normal overload costs {{NoCoins|{{ovlcost|2}}|c}}  so holy overload is effectively a savings of {{NoCoins|{{ovlcost|2/3}}- ({{GEP|Prayer renewal (4)}}+{{GEP|Crystal flask}}) round 0|c}}. For more details, see {{sl|Calculator:Herblore/Combination potions|Overload variants}}.

When making combination potions with the [[scroll of cleansing]], overloads can be saved.

==Creation==
It is possible to make overloads at level 90 Herblore with the aid of a spicy stew (with brown spice) getting a +6 level boost; it is also possible to create them at level 89 Herblore, using the artisan skills boost from an [[advanced pulse core]]. However, the most reliable and longest-lasting boost is a [[God banner]], which provides a +2 bonus for 30 minutes. Using a preset inventory with appropriate quantities of each of the 7 ingredients greatly reduces the time spent banking.

With 120 Herblore, overloads can be made in a batch, creating five potions with the ingredients of four potions. This is only available when the [[Herblore master cape]] perk is active (worn, present in [[max cape]], or on the [[skillcape rack]]). Making a batch of overloads can trigger the perks of the [[scroll of cleansing]] and [[modified botanist's mask]], however it does not trigger the effects of a [[botanist's amulet]].

The ingredients of an overload can be combined into a [[overload (3) (unf)|stackable unfinished potion]] by [[Granny Rowan]] once the tier 3 [[Botanist's Workbench]] has been constructed in [[Fort Forinthry]]. Unfinished overloads can then be finished at the workbench for the usual experience. The usual potion duplication bonuses apply, but ingredient-saving bonuses do not; the master cape also unlocks a batch recipe for unfinished potions.

==Update history==
{{UH|
* {{UL|type=patch|update=Continued Necromancy Improvements - This Week In RuneScape|date=21 August 2023}}
** Super Necromancy potion now uses 5 Congealed blood with a Spirit Weed Vial.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=New Skill: Necromancy - This Week In RuneScape|date=7 August 2023}}
** Overloads now require an [[extreme necromancy]] potion to create and boost [[Necromancy]] alongside the other combat stats.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=TWIR - Violet is Blue Too, Yak Track And More!|date=14 December 2020}}
** [[Herblore master cape]] recipes now advance [[Herblore]] tasks in [[Yak Track]]s by 5 instead of 1 - because you're making 5 potions!

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (7 May 2019)|date=7 May 2019}}
** Fixed an issue where cure potions in Dungeoneering were extending overload timers.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (9 January 2017)|date=9 January 2017}}
** Unsetting overload states while not actually being under the effects of an overload has been fixed.

* {{UL|type=ninja|update=Patch Notes (15 February 2016)|date=15 February 2016}}
** The animation which plays after drinking this potion will no longer close interfaces.

* {{UL|type=ninja|update=Patch Notes (3 August 2015)#Ninja|date=3 August 2015}}
** Making overload potions will no longer produce an extra vial.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (12 January 2015)|date=12 January 2015}}
** It is no longer possible to obtain a permanent overload bonus from Araxxor.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Evolution of Combat: Now Live!|date=20 November 2012}}
** Overloads' stat boosts have been changed. Instead of Attack, Strength, and Defence being boosted by 5+22% of the skill's level, Ranged being boosted by 4-23 levels, and Magic being boosted by 7 levels, all five skills are now boosted by 3+15% of the skill's level.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (22 November 2011)|date=22 November 2011}}
** This potion's timers are no longer delayed when an interface is opened.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (25 October 2011)|date=25 October 2011}}
** This potion now checks a player's lifepoints before delaying a player.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (17 October 2011)|date=17 October 2011}}
** You cant log out immediately after drinking an overload potion to skip the damage.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (4 October 2011)|date=4 October 2011}}
** Teleporting after drinking an overload potion no longer cancels some of the damage.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (17 January 2011)|date=17 January 2011}}
** Drinking this potion no longer interferes with the turkey emote.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (5 July 2010)|date=5 July 2010}}
** The overload potion is now consistent upon death and will not persist.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (3 March 2010)|date=3 March 2010}}
** Fixed a problem with the overload potion between logouts.

* {{UL|type=update|update=High-level Herblore Potions|date=7 October 2009}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* When first released, overloads could be used in [[Player killing|PvP]] areas, but within 48 hours, this was changed so they cannot be used in any PvP situation, dangerous or safe. After the Evolution of Combat update, overloads can be used in the Wilderness.
* Before the release of [[Evolution of Combat]], Overloads boosted stats differently and damaged life points by 500 (equivalent to 5,000 in the current system) when consumed. Attempting to drink a dose of overload with less than 500 life points prompted the message {{RSFont|You need more than 500 life points to survive the power of overload!}} Once it wore off, the player would be healed for 500 life points.
** According to Jagex, the damage the player received from drinking an overload is because the potion "racks the body with spasms and burns the digestive tract".{{CiteGeneral|url=http://www.runescape.com/kbase/guid/herblore_the_potions#Overload|title=Herblore - The Potions|accessdate=8 June 2023|publisher=Jagex|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/jMvD4|archivedate=27 October 2009|quote=Overload is so strong that it racks the body with spasms and burns the digestive tract, so be prepared for 50 damage in chunks of 10 when you drink it!}}
* Attempting to drink another dose of any overload variant immediately after having already drunk a dose brings up a chatbox message saying "You are still suffering the effects of a fresh dose of overload.", and the second dose is not consumed. This is a holdover from when overloads used to damage the player when drunk.

An '''extreme ranging''' potion is a combat potion which can be made at level 92 [[Herblore]]. When a player drinks the potion, they will get a [[Ranged]] boost of 3 + 15% of their level, rounded down, for a maximum boost of 17 at level 94 Ranged. It is made from a [[Super ranging potion#(3)|3-dose super ranging potion]] and 5 [[grenwall spikes]].

This is by far the fastest experience for any extreme potion, due to the stackable grenwall spikes, which allows banking out 27 ranging potions at one time. [[Extreme magic]] potions also use a stackable secondary ingredient ([[ground mud runes]]), but they must be ground by the player, and only give 250 Herblore experience.

This potion, along with an [[extreme attack]], [[extreme defence]], [[extreme strength]], [[extreme magic]], and [[extreme necromancy]], can be used with [[clean torstol]] at 96 Herblore to make an [[overload]] potion.

This potion can be made into an [[extreme ranging flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

Creating an extreme ranging potion from scratch, including making the super ranging potion, then drinking a dose is required to complete the [[Seers' Village achievements#Elite achievements|elite Seers' Village achievement]] [[Plenty - potion - entiary]].

'''Super antifire''' potions can be made by players with level 85 [[Herblore]] by mixing a 3 dose [[antifire]] potion with a [[phoenix feather]]. Making this potion grants the player 210 Herblore [[experience]]. Each dose of super antifire lasts for 6 minutes.

The potion renders the player completely immune to [[dragonfire]], with the following exceptions: 

* The [[King Black Dragon]]'s shock, ice, and poison breath deal around 400 damage through super antifire, although his standard breath is completely nullified
* The [[Queen Black Dragon]]'s dragonfire and extreme dragonfire deal around 750 and up to 1950 damage, respectively
* [[Rune dragon]]s' enhanced dragonbreath during their second phase, which deals 450 damage through super antifire
* [[Wyvern]]s' and [[Skeletal Wyvern]]s' ice breath

The regular [[antifire]] potion requires a wielded [[dragonfire shield]] or an [[anti-dragon shield]] to provide complete immunity.

This potion is tradable however players cannot use the [[Assist System]] to make it; therefore, players must have level 85 Herblore in order to make it, unless using [[Herblore#Temporary boosts|boosts]] or buying it. [[Herblore boost|Temporary boosts]] from [[advanced pulse core]]s can raise Herblore by 7, making it possible to create super antifires from as low as level 78 Herblore. [[Spicy stew]] may also raise the required level by 6.

Phoenix feathers are untradeable and must be gathered by the player themselves by stealing from the [[Desert Phoenix]]. Bringing an inventory full of [[Sign of the porter|Signs of the porter]] will also eliminate the need to bank, otherwise [[Dominion Tower]] bank is nearby. Players with level 99 [[Thieving]] may also use the [[Thieving cape]] perk to gather noted feathers.

The best way to maximise super antifire production is to make them in [[Shantay Pass]] on a populated world at [[portable well]]s while wearing the [[desert amulet 4]], which gives the player a 20% chance for each super antifire made that it will be 4 doses instead of 3. 

At level 90 Herblore, a super antifire can be combined with a [[clean arbuck]] to create an [[extended super antifire]], which has the same effects as a normal super antifire, except the effect has double the duration at 12 minutes.

An '''extreme strength''' potion is a combat potion which can be made at level 89 [[Herblore]]. When a player drinks the potion, they will get a [[Strength]] boost of 3 + 15% of their level, rounded down, for a maximum boost of 17 at level 94 Strength. It is made from a [[Super strength#(3)|3-dose super strength potion]] and a [[clean dwarf weed]].

This potion, along with an [[extreme attack]], [[extreme defence]], [[extreme ranging]], [[extreme magic]], and [[extreme necromancy]] can be used with a [[clean torstol]] at level 96 Herblore in order to make an [[overload]] potion.

The '''super prayer''' potion is a restorative potion which can be made at level 94 [[Herblore]]. When the player drinks the potion, their [[Prayer]] points will be restored at 70 + 35% of their maximum Prayer points or between 73 and 416 points, depending on their Prayer level. It is made from a [[Prayer potion|3-dose prayer potion]] and a [[Wyvern bonemeal|pot of wyvern bonemeal]] or [[ground wyvern bones]]. They can be made with the help of boosts, such as [[Advanced pulse core|pulse cores]], and the [[Assist System]] can be used to create the potion at a lower level.

This potion can be combined with a [[primal extract]] and a [[spark chitin]] at level 117 Herblore to make an [[Extreme prayer|extreme prayer potion]].

This potion can be made into a [[super prayer flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

[[File:Wyvern bonemeal detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Wyvern bonemeal''' is an item that can be used to train [[Prayer]] at the [[Ectofuntus]]. To create the bonemeal, players must grind [[wyvern bones]] on the top floor by dropping them in the hopper and turning the valve (giving 1 experience in the process). The player can then empty the bin to receive the bonemeal. The bonemeal will automatically be put in a pot, it is not required to bring your own.

Combined with a [[bucket of slime]], it can be used to worship the [[Ectofuntus]], giving 4 times the normal Prayer experience, as well as 5 [[ecto-tokens]]. No pots or buckets are returned when doing so.

After completing the medium [[Morytania achievements]], 13 wyvern bonemeal (as well as 13 [[buckets of slime]]) can be obtained daily by giving unnoted wyvern bones to [[Robin]] in [[Port Phasmatys]]. This increases to 26 after completing the hard achievements, and 39 after completing the elite achievements.

Wyvern bonemeal is also used as an ingredient in creating [[super prayer]] potions, however it is not advised as creating [[ground wyvern bones]] is faster. Super prayer potions grant 270 [[Herblore]] experience and 94 Herblore is required.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Champions, Wyverns and Granite|date=12 December 2005}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* Wyvern bonemeal weighs 0.5{{kg}}, unlike every other type of bonemeal which weighs 1.5{{kg}}.
