198601.name: Coins
198601.content: {{External|os|rsc=Coins}} {{Redirect|Coin}} {{Hatnote|"B", "K", and "M" redirect here. For the Guthixian runes, see [[B (Twilight of the Gods)]], [[K (Twilight of the Gods)]], and [[M (Twilight of the Gods)]]}} {{Infobox Item |name = Coins |image = [[File:Coins 1.png]] [[File:Coins 2.png]] [[File:Coins 3.png]] [[File:Coins 4.png]] [[File:Coins 5.png]] [[File:Coins 25.png]] [[File:Coins 100.png]] [[File:Coins 250.png]] [[File:Coins 1000.png]] [[File:Coins 10000.png]] |AKA = gold pieces, gp |release = [[4 January]] [[2001]] |update = Runescape beta is now online! |members = No |quest = No |tradeable = Yes |equipable = No |stackable = Yes |disassembly = No |options = Add to pouch, Add X to pouch |value = 1 |alchable = No |destroy = Drop |kept = always |store = No |exchange = No |examine = Lovely money! |weight = 0 |id = 995 }} [[File:Coins 1000 detail.png|left|100px]] '''Coins''', also known as '''gold pieces''', are the most common form of currency in ''[[RuneScape]]''. Coins are used to perform transactions in the [[Grand Exchange]] and most [[shop]]s, and are the currency required by hundreds of other NPC services and game features. In the game, coins appear as small gold coins, of varying shapes, and are [[Stackable items|stackable]]. In [[Grim Tales]], it is revealed that coins have more intricate designs imprinted on their faces, although it is impossible for players to see this. When the number of coins in a single stack exceeds 99,999, the [[examine]] text reads "____ x Coins", where the blank is the exact number of coins in the stack. If there is less than that, the examine text reads "''Lovely money!''" when examined in the inventory. When a stack of coins on the ground is examined, the examine will always show the exact amount. According to [[Aris]], in the [[Fourth Age]], coins were made of [[silver]]. ==Terminology== Beside ''coins'', players commonly refer to them as ''gold'', ''gold pieces'', ''gp'', ''cash'' or ''money''. Alternate terms for coins are occasionally used by [[Non-player character|NPCs]] in ''RuneScape'', and can sometimes be found in interfaces. ==Stacking== [[File:Postie Pete stamp.gif|frame|right|A postage stamp showing [[Postie Pete]] refers to coins as "gp".]]One thousand coins (1,000) is usually referred to as 1k. Similar to the metric system, the "k" stands for "kilo", which is Greek for "thousand". Likewise, one million coins is often called 1mil or 1M, and one billion coins is referred to as 1bil or 1B. On [[RuneScape Germany|German-language]] servers, the symbol for "k" is changed to "T", since "Tausend" is German for "thousand". On [[RuneScape Latin American Spanish|Spanish]] and [[RuneScape Brazilian|Portuguese]] language worlds, the symbol for "k" is changed to "m", since "mil" is Spanish and Portuguese for "thousand". A stack of gold has a small coloured text on the upper-left hand corner of the stack. With larger stacks of coin - as with all [[stackable items]] - both the colour of the text and the stack's [[examine]] text change, depending on the amount of gold in the stack. A stack of coins that uses a 'K' or 'M' identifier always rounds down to the integer multiple. For example, 15.9M is shown as 15M. This protects players receiving the coins in trade from being cheated by rounded values, e.g. A player receiving 15M can be guaranteed that the stack is not just 14.5M rounded up. {| class="wikitable text-align-right align-left-3 align-left-4 align-center-7" ! colspan="2" | Range ! rowspan="2" | Text colour ! rowspan="2" | Suffix ! rowspan="2" | Multiplier ! colspan="2" | Example |- ! From ! To ! Amount ! Image |- | 1 | 99,999 | Yellow | {{NA}} | 1 | 99,999 | class="inventory-image" style="background-color:#1e3146;" | [[File:99999g.png]] |- | 100,000 | 9,999,999 | White | K | 1,000 | 9,999,999 | class="inventory-image" style="background-color:#1e3146;" | [[File:9999k.png]] |- | 10,000,000 | 9,999,999,999 | Green | M | 1,000,000 | 999,999,999 | class="inventory-image" style="background-color:#1e3146;" | [[File:999m.png]] |- | 10,000,000,000 | 9,999,999,999,999 | Blue | B | 1,000,000,000 | 999,999,999,999 | class="inventory-image" style="background-color:#1e3146;" | [[File:999b.png]] |- | 10,000,000,000,000 | 9,999,999,999,999,999 | Purple | T | 1,000,000,000,000 | 999,999,999,999,999 | class="inventory-image" style="background-color:#1e3146;" |[[File:999tril gp.png]] |- | 10,000,000,000,000,000 | 2,147,483,649,147,483,647 | Orange | Q | 1,000,000,000,000,000 | 999,999,999,999,999,999 | class="inventory-image" style="background-color:#1e3146;" |[[File:999Q.png]] |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" ! colspan="10" |Coin icons |- | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 | 25 | 100 | 250 | 1,000 | 10,000+ |- | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 1.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 2.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 3.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 4.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 5.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 25.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 100.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 250.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 1000.png]] | class="inventory-image" | [[File:Coins 10000.png]] |} {{clear}} ==Maximum limits== [[File:Maxgold.png|right]] The maximum number of coins that players may hold in the [[inventory]] and in the [[bank]] is 2,147,483,647 (2.1 billion) due to the usage of the signed 32-bit integer data type (maximum value of 231- 1). The limit of coins stored in the [[money pouch]] is substantially higher at 2,147,483,649,147,483,647 (2.1 quintillion), which is approximately equivalent to 2.1 billion times 1 billion plus 2.1 billion (the exact formula is (2^{31}-1) \times {10^{9}} + (2^{31}-1)). Before the [[Update:Max Cash Update & Community Hit List: First Strike|update to money pouch]], players with wealth exceeding 2.1 billion usually chose to either invest their money in discontinued items or [[spirit shards]], or another item of high market liquidity. Spirit shards are worth a static amount of 25 coins and can be sold to any [[Summoning store]] for this amount. They were therefore the typically chosen currency when coins were no longer an option. A maximum stack in this common alternative format can hold for the player an additional 53,687,091,175 (53.6 billion) coins. Players exceeding even that may choose to purchase untradeable [[spirit shard pack]]s, which when opened grant 5,000 spirit shards each. These can be used to store up to a maximum of 268,435,455,875,000 coins (268 trillion). The update on [[12 June]] [[2023]] increased the maximum number of coins that can be stored in the [[money pouch]] and placed in a [[Grand Exchange]] offer or in a [[Trading|trade window]] to 2,147,483,649,147,483,647 (2.1 quintillion).{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Jack|url=https://twitter.com/jagexjack/status/1547994115064754176?s=21&t=qXED7R-MY7u1BqQ5imtV7A|quote=I believe I was incorrect in the video in saying that the new GE and coin pouch limit will be 2.1B x 2.1B. I believe it's actually 1B x 2.1B. Shouldn't make a different{{sic}} in practice of course.|date=15 July 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/qL9bx|archivedate=18 July 2022|notes=|name=maxcashlimit}} This did not increase the amount that can be carried in the inventory or stored in the bank but it allowed players to trade items for amounts higher than 2.1 billion coins. It is possible to store separate stacks of coins in the bank, inventory, money pouch, Grand Exchange offers, [[mahogany prize chest]], [[treasure chest (Carnillean Rising)|treasure chest]], and [[Managing Miscellania|Miscellania coffer]]. Maximum limits of storage areas varies; it is typically 2.1 billion, except for money pouch and Grand Exchange offers (2.1 quintillion), and Miscellania coffer (7.5 million). ==Money pouch== {{listen |title = 1 billion coins |align = right |desc = The sound that plays when adding or withdrawing over 1 billion coins from the money pouch |format = ogg |filename = Adding or withdrawing 1000000000 coins from money pouch.ogg }} {{main|Money pouch}} The money pouch was added in an [[Update:Loyalty Programme - Batch 3|update]] on [[6 December]] [[2011]]. Up to 2,147,483,649,147,483,647 (2.1 quintillion) coins can be stored inside the money pouch. If the player dies anywhere, even in the [[Wilderness]], the money will be protected. The coins can be added and withdrawn at any time, as long as the player is outside of the Wilderness. The money pouch is protected by the bank [[PIN]], if it has been set. It cannot be accessed while [[Dungeoneering]] or while playing some [[minigames]], such as [[Stealing Creation]] and [[Soul Wars]]. ==Coins in Daemonheim== {{main|Rusty coins}} Coins in [[Daemonheim]] used to be similar to regular coins, but with the money pouch update, they were renamed to [[rusty coins]] and were recoloured to grey. They were then again recoloured to orange to prevent them being missed on the floor. They have a different examine to regular coins and are destroyed upon leaving. Coins have a few uses such as buying items from the [[Smuggler]] or marking traps. The examine text, "''They make the world go round''," is a reference to the common idiom used in the real world, "''Money makes the world go round''". You can ask the Smuggler about them who will reply: "''Oh, they're nothing. You can give them all to me, if you want.''" ==Making money through skills== {{main|Money making guide}} As money in ''RuneScape'' is a necessity for all players, certain skills in the ''RuneScape'' community have gained popularity because of their potential to create profit for the player. ==Products== Besides being used to purchase items, several objects (particularly in [[Construction]]) are "built" directly from coins, such as a [[Pit ogre]]. Other items, such as [[Splitbark armour]] or tanned [[leather]], cannot be crafted directly by players and instead require the aid of an NPC who will charge coins. In addition to particular items, coins may be needed to access certain services, such as [[decanting]]. Below are items that require coins for their creation. {{Uses material list|limit=50}} ==Item sources== {{Drop sources|Coin|limit=50|order=descending|sort=}} ===Shop locations=== {{Shop locations list|Coins}} ===Spawns=== * {{Item spawns|mapID=144|item=Coins|itemid=995 |2260,4698,qty:1 |2261,4689,qty:1 |2262,4704,qty:1 |2265,4684,qty:1 |2267,4699,qty:1 |2268,4696,qty:1 |2269,4701,qty:2 |2270,4702,qty:1 |2272,4695,qty:1 |2273,4698,qty:3 |2273,4699,qty:1 |2273,4701,qty:7 |2274,4687,qty:1 |2274,4696,qty:1 |2274,4706,qty:1 |2280,4692,qty:1 |2280,4705,qty:1 |2283,4698,qty:1 |2284,4687,qty:1 |text=In King Black Dragon's Lair}} in piles of 17 coins. * {{Item spawns|item=Coins|itemid=995|2765,3198|2767,3197|2767,3199|2768,3198|2772,3197|text=Inside the Black Arm Gang hideout in Brimhaven (five spawns)}} in piles of 25 coins. * {{Item spawns|item=Coins|itemid=995|2979,3675|2985,3675|2990,3675|text=In the western Ruins in Wilderness (three spawns)}} in piles of 4 spawns|item=Coins|itemid=995|3076,3845|3108,3859|text=In the Lava Maze in Wilderness (two spawns)}} in piles of 1-21 coins. * {{Item spawns|item=Coins|itemid=995|3228,3504|3232,3500|text=In the bear cage north of Varrock Palace (two spawns)}} in piles of 3-4 coins. * {{Item spawns|item=Coins|itemid=995|3234,3556|text=South of the Chaos altar in Wilderness}} in a pile of 2 coins. * {{Item spawns|item=Coins|itemid=995|3220,3826|3220,3818|text=In the Red Dragon Isle in Wilderness (two spawns)}} in piles of 1 coin. ==Gallery== Coins 1 detail.png|1 coin detailed Coins 2 detail.png|2 coins detailed Coins 3 detail.png|3 coins detailed Coins 4 detail.png|4 coins detailed Coins 5 detail.png|5-24 coins detailed Coins 25 detail.png|25-99 coins detailed Coins 100 detail.png|100-249 coins Coins (Shilo Village) detail.png|Coins during [[Shilo Village]] 25gp detail.png|Coins retrieved during [[Beneath Cursed Tides]] Coins realistic.png|Coins on the former post-login screen ==Update history== {{UH| * {{UL|type=patch|update=Woodcutters' Grove & Parcels from the Dead - This Week In RuneScape|date=19 June 2023}} ** Fixed an issue that caused incorrect information to be displayed when withdrawing coins from your Pouch. ** Fixed an issue that would cause coins to disappear when attempting to empty your Pouch into a full Bank. * {{UL|type=patch|update=300 Million Party & DXP! - This Week In RuneScape|date=8 August 2022}} ** Picking up coins outside of the Wilderness - no matter your PvP state - will now see them go directly into the money pouch, rather than your backpack. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (9 September 2019)|date=9 September 2019}} ** Coin stack model has been made less shiny to stop in some cases, the coins appearing white. * {{UL|type=ninja|update=Patch Notes (2 February 2015)|date=2 February 2015}} ** Examining a stack of coins on the ground will now display how many there are in the stack. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (4 February 2014)|date=4 February 2014}} ** The coins value in the Hero interface is now visible on one line when passing the 1 billion mark. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (13 May 2013)|date=13 May 2013}} ** Players can now telegrab coins with a full inventory. * {{UL|update=More runescape bugs fixed|date=23 June 2001}} ** Fixed a bug which could cause stack of 0 coins to be created. * {{UL|type=update|update=Runescape beta is now online!|date=4 January 2001}} ** Added to game. }} ==Trivia== * In ''[[RuneScape Classic]]'', the same image was used for coins, regardless of the number of coins dropped. Often, the only way to know how many coins were on the ground was to pick them up. * [[Alchemy]] spells cannot be cast on coins. If a player attempts it, a message will inform the player that "Coins are already made of gold...". It is possible, however, turn other gold items (such as [[gold ore]] and [[gold bar]]s) into coins using alchemy spells. It is impossible to convert gold bars or other gold items into coins besides using alchemy. * When two or more monsters drop coins in the same spot, the coins will stack. * With a [[Squeal of Fortune]] update, it was once possible to win 600 million coins, the largest single source of spontaneous coins in the game excluding [[CoinShare]]. A prize of 1 billion coins was first available during the [[Vault of Riches]] promotion in [[Treasure Hunter]] in 2024. * Even if there is only 1 coin on the ground, it will still say "coins". * Trying to deposit coins via the [[Grand Exchange]] 'To Bank' option, while having a max cash pile in your bank will yield: "You have ran out of Bank Space. Please make more room." regardless of the amount of bank space left. * In the [[Transcript:Guthix Maintains|13th issue]] of the [[God letters]], [[Guthix]] maintains that all coins are of a similar size, weight, and are made of "purest gold", which is why they are accepted everywhere regardless of the patterning each [[Kingdom|fief]] applies to the currency that they mint.{{CiteGodLetter|issue=13|letter=15}}{{CiteGodLetter|issue=14|letter=11}} ==See also== * [[Economy guide]] for information on how the economy in ''[[RuneScape]]'' works * [[Money Making Guide]] for advice on how to accumulate profit ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Currency}} [[Category:Currency]] [[Category:Items on reward scrolls]] [[pt:Moedas]]

The '''juju vial of water''' is used in the [[Herblore Habitat]] to make juju potions. They can be bought from [[Papa Mambo]] in the Herblore Habitat area, in the east part of the [[Kharazi Jungle]]. Fifty (50) of these can be obtained by opening a [[Juju vial pack]].

The five [[Juju potion|unfinished Juju potions]] that can be made from Juju vials of water are:
*[[Erzille potion (unf)|Erzille]]
*[[Argway potion (unf)|Argway]]
*[[Ugune potion (unf)|Ugune]]
*[[Shengo potion (unf)|Shengo]]
*[[Samaden potion (unf)|Samaden]]

A '''juju fishing potion''' is an item created in [[Herblore Habitat]]. It requires 70 [[Herblore]] to make and gives a one in three chance of catching a [[Raw baron shark]] when shark fishing while the potion is in effect. One dose of the potion lasts for six minutes.  With one minute remaining, the message "Your juju fishing potion is about to wear off." will appear in the chat window. A final message appears when the potion wears off. A complete guide to making these can be found [[Juju fishing potion/Obtaining|here]].

Making this potion grants 158 Herblore experience and requires a [[Clean shengo]] and an [[Aquatic vine]]. 

[[Perfect juju fishing potion]]s, which increase the chance of catching fish by 5% for a period of 1 hour per dose, can also be made by the addition of 10 [[harmony dust]] to 3-dose vials of juju fishing potions. 
{{clear|left}}

==Obtaining==
To make the Juju fishing potions without full understanding of all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide.

* ''Requires 76 [[Farming]], 78 [[Hunter]], 70 [[Herblore]], and either 65 [[Construction]] or 65,000 [[coins]].''

The goal is to obtain [[Shengo seed]]s and [[Aquatic vine]]s for the potion.
* Bring a hatchet, [[apple sapling]], and around 1,000 coins (plus 65,000 if you do not have 65 construction and cannot find someone to assist you) to Herblore Habitat.
* From [[Papa Mambo]] located in the northern section of the area, purchase [[Juju vial]]s, a [[Red vine blossom]] flower seed and 3-4 [[Marasamaw plant]] traps. If your [[tool leprechaun]] does not have a [[seed dibber]] and a [[spade]], purchase these as well.
* Plant the Red vine blossom in the flower patch located in the centre section of the area. This will cause [[common jadinko]]s to spawn in the northern area.
* Trap common jadinkos with the Marasamaw plant traps until you have obtained Shengo seeds and [[Kalferberry seed]]s. As these drops are random you may have to trap more than 500 of them, be prepared. Alternatively you can visit the Jadinko Lair and start fires to quickly earn favour, which can be swapped for random seeds. This method requires less attention and generally provides many more seeds.
* Once obtained, plant the Shengo seed in the herb patch (a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water), plant the apple sapling in the tree patch, the Kalferberry seed in the bush patch, and construct a [[Pond (Herblore Habitat)|pond]] in the construction spot. The Red vine blossom must then be treated with a [[juju hunter potion]]. This will cause [[Aquatic jadinko]]s to spawn in the southern area of the activity. Trap these with your Marasamaw plant traps. Each one captured will give the player an Aquatic vine.
The Shengo herbs will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes).
The camps are accessed by climbing over a large vine that joins one to the other.

** An issue with the juju hunter, fishing and scentless potions - which cancelled their effects - has been fixed.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Herblore Habitat|date=24 November 2010}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* Like all other juju potions, this potion was made tradeable in an [[Update:Prifddinas - Lost City of the Elves - Part 2|update]] on [[10 November]] [[2014]].

'''Guthix's gift''' is a potion made from ingredients obtained from the [[Herblore Habitat]]. It requires 75 [[Herblore]] to make and gives a 10% bonus to Herblore experience when making [[juju potion]]s. The potions can be mixed at any bank and this bonus will take effect, but the bonus only applies to Juju potions. A guide to obtain the ingredients and make this potion is [[Guthix's gift/Obtaining|here]].

The potion boosts experience for both cleaning grimy vine herbs and making juju potions. The potion does not boost experience from making unfinished juju potions, even if the player is wearing a [[Factory outfit]]. The player will receive regular cleaning experience with the outfit, though.

Making this potion grants 179 Herblore experience and requires a [[clean samaden]] and a [[Guthix vine]].

[[Perfect juju herblore potion]]s can be made via the addition of [[harmony moss]] to a 3-dose vial of Guthix's gift. Its effect lasts for 1 hour, and grants the user a 5% experience boost when making [[combination potions]], and a 10% increase to the chance of finding an [[unreadable page]] (combination potion recipe) in Daemonheim.

This [[juju potion]] can be stored by the [[tool leprechaun]] found in the herblore habitat, however only [[Juju farming potion]]s, [[Juju hunter potion]]s, [[Scentless potion]]s, Guthix's gift, [[Saradomin's blessing]], and [[Zamorak's favour]] can be stored with the leprechaun. In order to do so the potion must consist of 3 doses, otherwise it cannot be stored. The maximum amount of potions of one type that can be stored is 30. However, unlike the other Juju potions stored with the Juju leprechaun, this one is more effective when stored in the player's bank, so that a maximum number of Juju potions can be mixed in the limited time while the potion is effective.

Each dose of potion lasts for 6 minutes. You will get a notice in your chat box when your potion's effect is about to wear off (about 30 seconds before) and also when it has worn off.

==Obtaining==
To make Guthix's gift potions without fully understanding all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide.

*''Requires up to 80 [[Farming]], 81 [[Hunter]], 75 [[Herblore]], and up to 80 [[Construction]].''

The goal is to obtain [[Clean samaden|Samaden]] herb seeds and [[Guthix vine]]s for the potion. '''''If you already have Samaden seeds, juju bush seeds, and the other equipment for attracting jadinkos and farming in the Habitat, skip to step 6.'''''
#Bring a hatchet, an apple, orange, and banana saplings, and around 1000 GP to Herblore habitat.
#From Papa Mambo located in the northern section of the area, purchase three of each colour (red, green, blue) flower seed and 3-4 [[Marasamaw plant]] traps. If your tool leprechaun does not have a dibber and a spade purchase these as well.
#Plant any flower seed in the flower patch located in the centre section of the area. This will cause common [[jadinko]]s to spawn in the northern area.
#Trap common jadinko with the Marasamaw plant traps until you have obtained at least two each of [[Lergberry]] and [[Kalferberry]] bush seeds, and some Samaden herb seeds. As these drops are very random you may have to trap more than 500 of them, be prepared.
#Once obtained, plant the Samaden seed in the herb patch (a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water, this is also the area that the Saradomin jadinkos will spawn).
#*The Samaden herbs will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes).
#As the requirements for attracting the god jadinkos change each week, the player must cycle through the combinations to find what works. After each change, wait 3 seconds before proceeding to the next change.
#Plant any coloured flower blossom seed in the flower patch and treat it with [[Juju hunter potion]].
#Build each of the construction habitats with a pause after each one. If the flower colour is correct you will receive a message that you have two of the correct items when the habitat is correct.
#If no message appears, proceed to another colour flower. Repeat the previous step.
#When the flower and habitat are correct, proceed to the tree patch. The trees are done before the bush patch because the seeds are cheaply obtainable from the GE, whereas the bush seeds are not tradeable and may be hard to come by. Plant any of the three saplings and wait a few seconds for a message that three requirements are met. If you do not receive this message, clear the sapling and proceed to the next sapling, and again for the last one if needed.
#*Bear in mind at all times that ''no'' tree or ''no'' bush may be a requirement.
#Proceed to the bush patch and plant either seed, Lergberry or Kalferberry. If no message appears after a few seconds, remove and try the other one. This should be the last step and you should now be attracting Guthix jadinkos.
#Keep the flower treated with the hunter potion, a message will appear when it is about to wear off. When the Guthix jadinkos appear, cross the water by way of the vine and trap them with the Marasamaw plant traps. Each one captured will give the player a Guthix vine.

A '''juju hunter potion''' is a [[juju potion]] made from a [[clean erzille]] and a [[corrupt vine]] (obtained from hunting [[diseased jadinko]]s), and requires 54 [[herblore]] granting 123 experience.

Unlike other potions this potion cannot be consumed by drinking it, instead it is used on a vine blossom plant, to attract [[Cannibal Jadinko|cannibal]], [[Aquatic Jadinko|aquatic]], [[Camouflaged jadinko|camouflaged]], [[Draconic jadinko|draconic]] and god [[jadinko]]s ([[Guthix jadinko|Guthix]], [[Saradomin jadinko|Saradomin]] and [[Zamorak jadinko|Zamorak]]). Each dose lasts 10 minutes, and a warning message will appear one minute before the timer runs out. Up to three doses can be applied to the vine blossom at once, stacking to a maximum of 30 minutes. Neither picking the flower nor logging out will end the effects of the potion. The [[arctic trapper outfit]], [[jungle trapper outfit]], [[desert trapper outfit]] and [[volcanic trapper outfit]] will automatically apply the potion while worn. When used on [[Anachronia]] the potion is not location dependent. Using it on any of the blossoms on Anachronia will grant the ability to catch any of the [[Jadinko]]s on the island, regardless of type or location.

When adding the juju hunter potion to a vine blossom, make sure it's a dry vine blossom. Adding it to a recently watered vine blossom (it has a wet appearance) dilutes out the effect of the juju hunter potion. In this case, the juju hunter potion will be ineffective at attracting jadinkos until the vine blossom dries, and you will lose the juju hunter potion's time while it was ineffective. Likewise, a similar problem arises when watering a vine blossom with juju hunter potion already applied to it.

The potion can be stored by the [[tool leprechaun]] in the Herblore Habitat farming area. However, only a maximum of 30 potions can be stored, and they must all be 3-dose potions.

This potion can be made into a[[juju hunter flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. It can be also made into a [[perfect juju smithing potion]] <!--Yes, Smithing is correct; do not change to Hunter/Hunting--> by adding [[harmony moss]] to a 3-dose juju hunter potion.

==Obtaining==
To make the Juju hunter potions without full understanding of all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide. This requires 58 [[Farming]], 78 [[Hunter]], 54 [[Herblore]], and either 56 [[Construction]] or 56,000 [[coins]].

The goal is to obtain [[erzille seed]]s and [[corrupt vine]]s (from [[diseased jadinko]]s) for the potion:

* Bring a hatchet, a [[Banana sapling]], and around 11,000 coins to [[Herblore Habitat]], plus an additional 56,000 if you do not have 56 Construction. This can be assisted and the payment avoided.
* From [[Papa Mambo]] located in the northern section of the area, purchase any colour ([[Red vine blossom|red]], [[Green vine blossom|green]], [[Blue vine blossom|blue]]) vine blossom seed and an erzille seed each day.
* Plant the erzille seed in the herb patch (a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water), then plant the banana sapling in the tree patch, and construct a [[Boneyard (Herblore Habitat)|Boneyard]] in the construction spot. This will cause [[diseased jadinko]]s to be drawn to the southern area of the activity. These are caught with a [[noose wand]] after tracking them. Each one captured will give the player a [[Corrupt vine]].

The erzille herbs will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes). The camps are accessed by climbing over a large vine that separates them from each other.

* Like all other juju potions, this potion was made tradeable in an [[Update:Prifddinas - Lost City of the Elves - Part 2|update]] on [[10 November]] [[2014]].

A '''juju woodcutting potion''' is a reward from the [[Herblore Habitat]]. It requires 71 [[Herblore]] to make. Making this potion grants 160 Herblore experience and requires a [[clean samaden]] and an [[oily vine]].

When consumed, it gives a 10% chance per log cut of finding a wood spirit when [[woodcutting]]. Once found, the spirit will send the logs you cut directly to your bank for the next 30 seconds, including trees planted yourself in a [[tree farming patch]], giving the message "A wood spirit appears and offers to carry your next few logs to the bank." whenever logs are banked. Each dose of potion lasts for 6 minutes. A message will warn you 15 seconds before the timer runs out. Note that a wood spirit may be found more than once with each dose.

Occasionally, the wood spirit will bring a gift of higher level logs, such as yew and magic. When this happens, a message will appear in the chat window. The message will not be seen through the game filter.

The effect of the potion will be lost whenever logging out or disconnecting. If the 6 minute timer runs out while you still have a wood spirit active, the wood spirit will still remain for the full 30 seconds.

[[Perfect juju woodcutting potion]]s, which give a 5% chance of obtaining double logs and experience per cut, can also be made by the addition of [[harmony moss]] to 3-dose vials of juju woodcutting potions. It lasts for 1 hour per dose.

Read [[Juju woodcutting potion/Obtaining|here]] for a step by step guide to obtaining the ingredients.

==Obtaining==
To make the Juju woodcutting potions without fully understanding all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide.

*''Requires 80 [[Farming]], 77 [[Hunter]], 71 [[Herblore]], and either 65 [[Construction]] or 65,000 [[coins]].''

The goal is to obtain [[Samaden seed]]s and [[Oily vine]]s from [[Amphibious jadinko]]s for the potion.
*Bring around 1,000 coins to Herblore habitat, plus 65,000 coins if you do not have 65 construction or know someone with 65. This can be assisted and the payment avoided.
*From [[Papa Mambo]] located in the northern section of the area, purchase a [[Blue vine blossom]] flower seed and 3-4 [[Marasamaw plant]] traps.
*Plant the Blue vine blossom in the flower patch located in the centre section of the area. This will cause [[common jadinko]]s to spawn in the northern area.
*Trap common jadinkos with the Marasamaw plant traps until you have obtained Samaden seeds and [[Lergberry seed]]s.
**As these drops are random you may have to trap more than 500 of them, be prepared.
**Alternatively, if you wish to earn points or have some saved up in the [[Jadinko Lair]] downstairs, you can exchange them for seeds at the [[Offering stone]] and get your seeds that way.
*Once obtained...
**Plant the Samaden seed in the herb patch. There is a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water.
**Plant the Lergberry seed in the bush patch. You will find it useful to ensure your bush does not die, so use super compost and keep an eye on its health while you are there.
**Construct a [[Pond (Herblore Habitat)|Pond]] in the construction spot.
*This will cause Amphibious jadinkos to spawn in the northern area. Trap these with your Marasamaw plant traps. Each one captured gives the player 1 Oily vine.
The Samaden herbs will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes).

===Alternative method of obtaining===
To make the Juju woodcutting potions and by skipping the use of all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide.

* ''Requires 80 [[Farming]], 87 [[Hunter]] and 71 [[Herblore]].''

The goal is to obtain [[Samaden seed]]s and [[Oily vine]]s from [[Amphibious jadinko]]s for the potion.

* Head to Herblore Habitat and buy a Samaden seed from [[Papa Mambo]] and also grab 5 Marasamaw plant traps, and plant the Samaden seed in the herb patch.
* Head to [[Anachronia]], south from the base camp, and follow the path up to the far north-east.
* Here you will find the amphibious jadinkos which you can proceed to trap with your marasamaw plant traps.

The Samaden herbs will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes).

Once grown, you can make juju woodcutting potions. This method is faster than the previous one, but also has a higher Hunter requirement.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Herblore Habitat|date=24 November 2010}}

}}

A '''juju farming potion''' is a potion made from ingredients obtained from the [[Herblore Habitat]]. It requires level 64 [[Herblore]] to make, and levels 70 [[Farming]] and 74 [[Hunter]] to gather the necessary ingredients. It gives a one in three chance of picking twice the amount of herbs from a herb patch for six minutes (no experience is given for the extra herbs). If there is no inventory space available for the second herb, it will be dropped on the ground. This potion also works on the [[Herblore Habitat]] herb patches.

Making this potion requires a [[clean ugune]] and a [[marble vine]] (obtained from [[Igneous jadinko]]s) and grants 146 Herblore experience.

[[Perfect juju farming potion]]s, which give a 5% chance of obtaining [[harmony moss]] when harvesting herbs from herb patches, and a 25% chance of obtaining double the amount of harmony moss from a [[harmony pillar]], can be made via the addition of harmony moss to a 3-dose vial of juju farming potion.

This [[juju potion]] can be stored by the [[tool leprechaun]] found in the Herblore Habitat. In order to do so, the potion must consist of 3 doses, otherwise it cannot be stored. The maximum amount of potions of one type that can be stored is 30.

When there is 15 seconds left for the potion, a message will warn the player unless game messages have been turned off. Logging out will not end the effects of the potion.

By starting at the Morytania patch, a single dose can be in effect for all eight herb patch locations depending on travel methods. It is also possible to include the two Herblore Habitat vine herb patches by starting a herb run at the Trollheim farming patch. It is recommended to harvest one's original herb plants and only replant the patches that require teleport runes, such as the Trollheim patch. This will save crucial time when farming the last vine herbs (especially [[Ugune]]) on the island east of [[Herblore Habitat]]. Though, depending on the amount of herb seeds used, and the speed at which the player navigates between herb patches, one dose can last long enough to harvest and replant the herb. 

The following provides an example of how the player can navigate between herb patches:
# Start at Morytania patch (with the [[Ectophial]], [[Modified farmer's hat]], or [[Master farmers hat]]). 
# Ardougne patch (with [[Ardougne Cape]] 2-4's [[Manor farm Teleport]], Ardougne [[Ardougne lodestone|lodestone]], or [[Master farmers hat]])
# Falador patch (with an [[Explorer's Ring]] 3 or 4 or [[South Falador Teleport|lunar teleport]])
# [[Trollheim herb patch|Trollheim patch]] using a [[Trollheim farm teleport]] or [[Trollheim teleport]] (and run up the stronghold)
# Catherby patch (via Catherby [[Catherby lodestone|lodestone]] or [[Catherby teleport|lunar teleport]])
# [[Garden of Kharid]] patch (via [[mystical sand seed]] or [[ring of duelling]])
# [[Prifddinas]] herb patch in the [[Crwys]] district (via [[crystal teleport seed]], Clan Vexillum, or Prifddinas [[Prifddinas lodestone|lodestone]])
# Optional: [[Herblore Habitat]] herb patches (via [[Juju teleport bag]], [[Witchdoctor mask]], or [[Master farmers hat]]
# [[Wilderness herb patch]] (via any [[Wilderness sword]])

Players who have a plentiful supply of Ugune seeds will find it more convenient to simply budget two doses of potion per farming run for a much more relaxing experience needing only one visit to each herb patch; and players with access to the Trollheim herb patch teleport can reliably farm all 8 herb patches on a single dose anyway.

''For instructions on how to obtain the ingredients and make this potion without fully understanding the complexities of Herblore Habitat, a guide is provided [[#Obtaining|here]]''.

==Price per dose==
{{Price per dose|Juju farming potion|vial=juju}}

==Creation==
{{Infobox Recipe
|storeValue = no
|alchValue = no
|members = Yes
|ticks = 2
|ticks2 = 1
|ticksnote = When mixing a single potion
|skill1 = Herblore
|skill1lvl = 64
|skill1boostable = 
|skill1exp = 146
|mat1 = Ugune potion (unf)
|mat2 = Marble vine
|mat2cost = no
|output1 = Juju farming potion (3)
|output1img = Juju farming potion (3).png
}}

==Effect==
The Juju farming potion increases the harvest by an average of 33% as there is a 1 in 3 chance of harvesting an additional herb each time a herb is harvested.

For example, if a harvest would have otherwise produced 9 herbs, with the effect of the Juju potion, on average an additional 3 herbs are obtained, increasing the harvest to 12. If the average harvest is 7 without the farming potion, then with the average will increase to 9.31. The extra herbs received from the use of the potion are pure profit. As a precaution consider verifying the herbs before drinking the potion to ensure all are fully grown and healthy. 

==Obtaining==
The potion can either be bought on the [[Grand Exchange]] or created with materials found in [[Herblore Habitat]]. To make the Juju farming potions without full of understanding all of the complexities of Herblore Habitat, follow this guide:

* ''Requires 74 [[Hunter]], 70 [[Farming]],  64 [[Herblore]], and either 59 [[Construction]] or 59,000 [[coins]].''
* ''Alternatively, with 84 [[Hunter]] you can instead hunt [[Igneous jadinko]]s on [[Anachronia]], bypassing the lengthy setup detailed below''

The goal is to obtain [[Grimy ugune]] and [[Marble vine]]s for the potion.
* Bring a hatchet, [[Orange sapling]], and around 11,000 coins to [[Herblore Habitat]], plus 59,000 coins if you do not have 59 Construction. This can be assisted and the payment avoided.
* From [[Papa Mambo]] located in the northern section of the area, purchase a [[blue blossom seed]], some [[Ugune seed]] and 3-4 [[Marasamaw plant]] traps.
* Plant the blue blossom seed in the vine flower patch located in the centre section of the area. This will cause [[common jadinko]]s to spawn in the northern area.
* Trap common jadinkos with the Marasamaw plant traps until you have obtained [[Lergberry seed]]s. As these drops are random you may have to trap quite a few of them, be prepared. Alternatively you can gain Favour points in the [[Jadinko Lair]] through cutting and burning jade vines or killing mutated jadinkos, and exchange them for seeds at the [[Offering stone|Offering Stone]].
* Plant your Ugune seeds in the vine herb patch (a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water), plant the orange sapling in the tree patch, the Lergberry seed in the bush patch, and construct a [[Thermal vent]] in the construction spot. This will cause [[Igneous jadinko]]s to spawn in the southern part of the activity area. Trap these with your Marasamaw plant traps. Each one captured will give the player a Marble vine.
The [[Grimy ugune|Ugune herbs]] will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~80 minutes).
The camps are accessed by climbing over a large vine that separates them from each other.

==Products==
{{Uses material list|Juju farming potion (3)}}

{{UH|

* {{UL|type=update|update=Herblore Habitat|date=24 November 2010}}

}}

==Trivia==
* Like all other juju potions, this potion was made tradeable in an [[Update:Prifddinas - Lost City of the Elves - Part 2|update]] on [[10 November]] [[2014]].

A '''juju cooking potion''' is a reward from the [[Herblore Habitat]]. It requires 67 [[Herblore]] to make and can be used on a [[baked potato]] to make a [[strange potato]]. [[Tuna]] and [[sweetcorn]] can then be added to make [[juju gumbo]]. It is also the only one of the ten juju potions that cannot be made into a [[perfect juju potion]].

Making this potion grants 152 Herblore experience and requires a [[clean shengo]] and [[plant teeth]]. A complete guide to obtain these items is [[Juju cooking potion/Obtaining|here]]. One dose is used per potato.

{{clear|left}}

{{Price per dose|Juju cooking potion|vial=juju}}

|output1img = Juju cooking potion (3).png
}}

==Obtaining==
To make the Juju cooking potions without full understanding of all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide.

*''Requires 77 [[Farming]], 78 [[Hunter]], 58 [[Herblore]], and either 62 [[Construction]] or 62,000 [[coins]].''
*''Juju hunter potions (10 minutes per dose)''

The goal is to obtain [[Clean shengo|Shengos]] and [[plant teeth]] (from [[Cannibal jadinko]]s) for the potion.
*Bring a hatchet and around 1000 coins to [[Herblore Habitat]].
*From [[Papa Mambo]] located in the northern section of the area, purchase a [[green blossom seed]] and 3-4 [[Marasamaw plant]] traps. If your [[tool leprechaun]] does not have a [[seed dibber]] and a [[spade]], purchase these as well.
*Plant the green blossom seed in the flower patch located in the centre section of the area. This will cause [[common jadinko]]s to spawn in the northern area.
*Trap common jadinkos with the Marasamaw plant traps until you have obtained [[Kalferberry seed]]s and Shengo seeds. As these drops are random you may have to trap more than 500 of them, be prepared.
*Once obtained, plant the shengo seed in the herb patch (a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water), the kalferberry seed in the bush patch (77 Farming needed), and construct a [[Tall grass]] in the construction spot, once planted a Juju hunter potion needs to be poured on the bud or grown bush (lasts 10 minutes per dose). This will cause [[Cannibal jadinko]]s to spawn in the southern area. Trap these with your Marasamaw plant traps. Each one captured will give the player [[plant teeth]].
The [[Grimy shengo|Shengo]] herbs will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes).
The camps are accessed by climbing over a large vine that separates them from each other.

The '''scentless potion''' is made using a [[juju vial of water]], a [[clean argway]] herb and a [[shadow vine]] (obtained from the [[shadow jadinko]], which require 71 [[Hunter]] to catch). These are all found in the [[Herblore Habitat]]. Making a Scentless potion requires level 59 [[Herblore]] and gives 135 experience. A guide to make this potion from scratch can be found [[Scentless potion/Obtaining|here]].

While under the influence of the potion, every trap the player sets is rendered as if it had been smoked with a torch.

Each dose of potion lasts for 6 minutes. Players get a notice in the chat box when the potion's effect is about to wear off (about 35 seconds before) and also when it wears off.

[[Perfect juju agility potion]]s can be made by the addition of [[harmony moss]] to a 3-dose vial of scentless potion. It induces a 1 hour long effect that has a chance of inducing the spawning of shortcuts or [[light creature]]s when completing a lap of the [[Hefin Agility Course]].

==Products==
{{Uses material list|Scentless potion (3)}}

==Obtaining==
To make the Juju Scentless potion without fully understanding all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide.

*''Requires 65 [[Farming]], 71 [[Hunter]], 59 [[Herblore]], and either 57 [[Construction]] or 57,000 [[coins]].''

The goal is to obtain some [[Clean argway|Argway]] herbs and [[shadow vine]]s for the potion.
*Bring around 1,000 coins to Herblore Habitat, plus 57,000 coins if you do not have 57 construction or know someone with 57. This can be assisted and the payment avoided.
*From [[Papa Mambo]] located in the northern section of the area, purchase a [[red blossom seed]] and 3-4 [[marasamaw plant]] traps. If your [[tool leprechaun]] does not have a [[seed dibber]] and a [[spade]], purchase these as well.
*Plant the Red blossom seed in the flower patch of the centre camp. This will cause [[common jadinko]]s to spawn in the northern area.
*Trap common jadinkos with the marasamaw plant traps until you have obtained Argway seeds. As these drops are random you may have to trap more than 500 of them, be prepared. Alternatively the seeds may be purchased from [[Papa Mambo]] for 10,000 coins each. He has a stock of 2.
*Once obtained, plant the Argway seed in the herb patch (a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water) and construct an [[Abandoned house]] in the construction spot. If you harvested your red blossom, you will need to plant another.  This will attract shadow jadinkos to the southern area of the activity. These are caught by tracking them with and using a [[noose wand]]. Each one captured will give the player a [[shadow vine]].
The [[Grimy argway|argway herbs]] will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes).
The camps are accessed by climbing over a large vine that separates them from each other.

'''Saradomin's blessing''' is a potion made from ingredients obtained from the [[Herblore Habitat]]. It requires 75 [[Herblore]] to make and gives a 10% bonus to [[Farming]] experience when farming in [[Herblore Habitat]]. A step by step guide to making this potion is [[Saradomin's blessing/Obtaining|here]].

Making this potion grants 179 Herblore experience and requires a [[clean samaden]] and a [[Saradomin vine]]. Upon consumption, Saradomin's blessing gives a 10% Farming experience bonus buff that lasts for 6 minutes.

[[Perfect juju prayer potion]]s can be made upon addition of [[harmony moss]] to a 3-dose vial of Saradomin's blessing. It gives an effect lasting 1 hour, under which the player receives a 5% [[Prayer]] experience boost when using [[cleansing crystal]]s on the [[Corrupted Seren Stone]] in the Hefin Cathedral in [[Prifddinas]], and when using bones on a [[gilded altar]] in a [[player-owned house]].

This [[juju potion]] can be stored by the [[tool leprechaun]] found in the herblore habitat, however only [[Juju farming potion]]s, [[Juju hunter potion]]s, [[Scentless potion]]s, [[Guthix's gift]], Saradomin's blessing, and [[Zamorak's favour]] can be stored with the leprechaun. In order to do so the potion must consist of 3 doses, otherwise it cannot be stored. The maximum amount of potions of one type that can be stored is 30.

Each dose of potion lasts for 6 minutes. You will get a notice in your chat box when your potion's effect is about to wear off (about 30 seconds before) and also when it has worn off.

}}

==Obtaining==
To make Saradomin's blessing potions without fully understanding all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide.

* ''Requires up to 80 [[Farming]], 81 [[Hunter]], 75 [[Herblore]], and up to 80 [[Construction]].''

The goal is to obtain [[Clean samaden|Samaden]] herb seeds and [[Saradomin vine]]s for the potion. '''''If you already have Samaden seeds, juju bush seeds, and the other equipment for attracting jadinkos and farming in the Habitat, skip to step 6.'''''
# Bring a hatchet, apple, orange, and banana saplings, and around 1,000 coins to Herblore habitat.
# From Papa Mambo located in the northern section of the area, purchase three of each colour (red, green, blue) flower seed and 3-4 [[Marasamaw plant]] traps. If your tool leprechaun does not have a dibber and a spade purchase these as well.
# Plant any flower seed in the flower patch located in the centre section of the area. This will cause [[common jadinko]]s to spawn in the northern area.
# Trap common jadinko with the Marasamaw plant traps until you have obtained at least two each of [[Lergberry]] and [[Kalferberry]] bush seeds, and some Samaden herb seeds. As these drops are very random you may have to trap more than 500 of them, be prepared.
# Once obtained, plant the Samaden seed in the herb patch (a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water, this is also the area that the Saradomin jadinkos will spawn).
#* The Samaden herbs will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes).
# As the requirements for attracting the god jadinkos change each week, the player must cycle through the combinations to find what works. After each change, wait 3 seconds before proceeding to the next change.
# Plant any coloured flower blossom seed in the flower patch and treat it with [[Juju hunter potion]].
# Build each of the construction habitats with a pause after each one. If the flower colour is correct you will receive a message that you have two of the correct items when the habitat is correct.
# If no message appears, proceed to another colour flower. Repeat the previous step.
# When the flower and habitat are correct, proceed to the tree patch. The trees are done before the bush patch because the seeds are cheaply obtainable from the GE, whereas the bush seeds are not tradeable and may be hard to come by.
Plant any of the three saplings and wait a few seconds for a message that three requirements are met. If you do not receive this message, clear the sapling and proceed to the next sapling, and again for the last one if needed.
Bear in mind at all times that ''no'' tree or ''no'' bush may be a requirement.
# Proceed to the bush patch and plant either seed, Lergberry or Kalferberry. If no message appears after a few seconds, remove and try the other one. This should be the last step and you should now be attracting Saradomin jadinkos.
# Keep the flower treated with the hunter potion, a message will appear when it is about to wear off. When the Saradomin jadinkos appear, cross the water by way of the vine and trap them with the Marasamaw plant traps. Each one captured will give the player a Saradomin vine.

* Like all other juju potions, this potion was made tradeable in an [[Update:Prifddinas - Lost City of the Elves - Part 2|update]] on [[10 November]] [[2014]].

'''Zamorak's favour''' is a potion made from ingredients obtained from [[Herblore Habitat]] and can also be pickpocketed as one-dose and noted from [[Meilyr worker]]s in [[Prifddinas]]. It is made with a [[clean samaden]] and a [[Zamorak vine]], requiring 75 [[Herblore]] and giving 179 experience. It provides a 10% increase in [[Hunter]] experience when hunting [[jadinko]]s within the Herblore Habitat or on [[Anachronia]]. A complete guide to obtaining ingredients and making this potion is [[Zamorak's favour/Obtaining|here]].

This boost stacks with [[Papa Mambo]]'s bonus for catching all 3 God jadinkos. The 10% increase is factored in after applying Mambo's bonus, resulting in a maximum exp boost of 15%.

[[Perfect juju dungeoneering potion]]s can be made by adding [[harmony moss]] to a 3-dose vial of Zamorak's favour. It gives a 4 hour effect that allows the user to deal 5% more damage in [[Daemonheim]], and gives an invisible 2 level boost when opening skill doors.

This [[juju potion]] can be stored by the [[tool leprechaun]] found in the Herblore Habitat, however only [[Juju farming potion]]s, [[Juju hunter potion]]s, [[Scentless potion]]s, [[Guthix's gift]], [[Saradomin's blessing]], and Zamorak's favour can be stored with the leprechaun. In order to do so the potion must consist of 3 doses, otherwise it cannot be stored. The maximum amount of potions of one type that can be stored is 30.

Each dose of potion lasts for 6 minutes. You will get a notice in your chat box when your potion's effect is about to wear off (about 30 seconds before) and also when it has worn off.

This potion also affects experience gained from Protean traps catching Jadinkos on Anachronia.

To make Zamorak's favour potions without fully understanding all of the complexities of [[Herblore Habitat]], follow this guide.

*''Requires up to 80 [[Farming]], 81 [[Hunter]], 75 [[Herblore]], and up to 80 [[Construction]].''

The goal is to obtain [[Clean samaden|Samaden]] herb seeds and [[Zamorak vine]]s for the potion. '''''If you already have Samaden seeds, juju bush seeds, and the other equipment for attracting jadinkos and farming in the Habitat, skip to step 6.'''''
#Bring a hatchet, an apple, orange, and banana saplings, and around 1000 GP to Herblore habitat.
#From Papa Mambo located in the northern section of the area, purchase three of each colour (red, green, blue) flower seed and 3-4 [[Marasamaw plant]] traps. If your tool leprechaun does not have a dibber and a spade purchase these as well.
#Plant any flower seed in the flower patch located in the centre section of the area. This will cause common [[jadinko]]s to spawn in the northern area.
#Trap common jadinko with the Marasamaw plant traps until you have obtained at least two each of [[Lergberry]] and [[Kalferberry]] bush seeds, and some Samaden herb seeds. As these drops are very random you may have to trap more than 500 of them, be prepared.
#Once obtained, plant the Samaden seed in the herb patch (a second herb patch is available to the east by crossing the large vine hanging over the water, this is also the area that the Saradomin jadinkos will spawn).
#*The Samaden herbs will grow in the normal amount of herb growth time (~70 minutes).
#As the requirements for attracting the god jadinkos change each week, the player must cycle through the combinations to find what works. After each change, wait 3 seconds before proceeding to the next change.
#Plant any coloured flower blossom seed in the flower patch and treat it with [[Juju hunter potion]].
#Build each of the construction habitats with a pause after each one. If the flower colour is correct you will receive a message that you have two of the correct items when the habitat is correct.
#If no message appears, proceed to another colour flower. Repeat the previous step.
#When the flower and habitat are correct, proceed to the tree patch. The trees are done before the bush patch because the seeds are cheaply obtainable from the GE, whereas the bush seeds are not tradeable and may be hard to come by. Plant any of the three saplings and wait a few seconds for a message that three requirements are met. If you do not receive this message, clear the sapling and proceed to the next sapling, and again for the last one if needed.
#*Bear in mind at all times that ''no'' tree or ''no'' bush may be a requirement.
#Proceed to the bush patch and plant either seed, Lergberry or Kalferberry. If no message appears after a few seconds, remove and try the other one. This should be the last step and you should now be attracting Zamorak jadinkos.
#Keep the flower treated with the hunter potion, a message will appear when it is about to wear off. When the Zamorak jadinkos appear, cross the water by way of the vine and trap them with the Marasamaw plant traps. Each one captured will give the player a Zamorak vine.

In order to obtain a shadow vine, you must have a [[red vine blossom]], and an [[Abandoned house|abandoned house habitat]]. They are caught via tracking, which requires a [[noose wand]]. The area for tracking these is located on the southernmost part.

'''Corrupt vines''' can be obtained in the [[Herblore Habitat]] by tracking [[diseased jadinko]]s on the southern side of the habitat. The player needs a [[noose wand]] in order to track the jadinko and catch it. In order to attract diseased jadinkos, the player must build a [[Boneyard (Herblore Habitat)|boneyard]] and grow a [[banana tree]]. The player can then pay the [[G.A.G.|gardener]] four [[apples|baskets of apples]] to protect the tree. The [[juju hunter potion]] is created using a corrupt vine and a [[clean erzille]] in a [[Juju vial of water]].

'''Runecrafting potions''' are potions that boost your [[Runecrafting]] level by 3. A [[Herblore]] level of 54 is required to make the potion - the ingredients are [[Clean wergali]] and season sheep wool ([[Summerdown wool]], [[Springsheared wool]], [[Winterwold wool]] or [[Fallfaced wool]]). It grants 122.5 experience once made. Seasonal sheep wool are obtained by harvesting season sheep in [[Player-owned farm]].

Players may use [[yak milk]] on a three-dose runecrafting potion to create a [[super runecrafting]] potion at 75 Herblore, granting 170 experience. A three-dose super runecrafting potion can afterwards be used to create an [[extreme runecrafting potion]] by adding spider venom at 91 Herblore.

A '''morchella mushroom''' is a mushroom harvested from a [[morchella mushroom spore]] grown in a [[mushroom patch]], requiring level 74 [[Farming]]. Up to nine morchella mushrooms can be harvested for each grown spore.

Morchella mushrooms are required for crafting [[prayer renewal]] potions at level 94 [[Herblore]].

Farmers will watch over a planted [[elder tree seed]] in exchange for twenty-five morchella mushrooms.

==Farming==
Morchella mushrooms can be harvested from morchella mushroom spores grown within a [[mushroom patch]]. A fully grown morchella mushroom spore will grow up to nine morchella mushrooms. When picked, they give 77.7 [[Farming]] experience each for a total of 699.3 experience for harvesting.

[[File:Prayer renewal effect.gif|160px|thumb|The visual effect of a player getting their prayer renewed after drinking a prayer renewal.]]
The '''prayer renewal''' potion is created at level 94 [[Herblore]]. It slowly restores [[Prayer]] points over six minutes.

It is created by mixing a [[clean fellstalk]] with a [[morchella mushroom]] in a [[vial of water]]. This awards 190 Herblore [[experience]]. If mixing the potion in [[Morytania]] (e.g. Burgh de Rott) with the [[Morytania achievements#Elite achievements|elite Morytania achievements]] completed and wearing [[Morytania legs 4]], players have a 20% chance of making a four-dose instead of a three-dose potion.  

Prayer renewals may not fully substitute [[prayer potion]]s due to their delayed effect, but they restore many prayer points over time, more than any instant-restore prayer potion. The amount is about 25%-65% more than a [[super prayer]] potion (the disparity is less at higher prayer levels). Hence, they are useful in any situation requiring prayer.

Prayer points are restored one at a time over 6 minutes. The rate of restore and total points restored per dose rises with Prayer level. Drinking another dose while the effect is active only refreshes the timer to 6 minutes, wasting the remaining time of the previous dose. Drinking other prayer restoration potions will not affect this potion's effects. Carrying a [[holy wrench]] in the inventory increases the total prayer points restored (30 more at level 99 Prayer), over the same duration.

The effect timer depletes while logged out. While logged out, players do not gain prayer points.

This potion can be made into a [[prayer renewal flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]].

==Prayer renewal strategy==
Consider the [[super prayer renewal potion]]. It is more effective and may even be more economical. At 99 Prayer, price to restore each prayer point is {{Nocoins|{{#expr:{{GEP|Prayer renewal (4)}}/4/545}}|c}} for Renewals and {{Nocoins|{{#expr:{{GEP|Super prayer renewal potion (6)}}/5472}}|c}} for Super renewals.

The prayer renewal potion (or flask) is useful in situations where the player will be using prayer points constantly or frequently, such as using protection or deflection prayers around aggressive foes. Prayer renewals are useful in situations where the player must restore a large amount of prayer points without banking, such as in the Fight Kiln.

The prayer renewal potion is, by itself, less useful in situations where the player needs to regain many prayer points quickly, as its effects dribble in over five minutes. For example, players using multiple powerful prayers at the same time (like a protection/deflection prayer along with [[Piety]]/[[Turmoil]]) will drain prayer much faster than the potion can renew it. However, using this potion along with other prayer-gaining potions (or flasks) can be useful, such as a [[prayer potion]], [[super restore]] potion, or [[super prayer]] potion. The prayer renewal potion gives a steady stream of prayer points, while the other potion is used to top off prayer points when needed. Super restore potions are typically used as the adjunct potion, as prayer potions are more expensive and super prayer potions even more so. [[Super restore]]s are useful in situations where the player needs to periodically restore stats in addition to prayer, such as when players also use [[Saradomin brew]]s.

A good use for them is with the [[amulet of zealots]], as they will compensate for the -5 Prayer bonus it has.

Some players drink prayer renewals in conjunction with [[overload]]s when fighting [[boss]] monsters. Both potions work for six minutes, and the prayer renewal's thirty-second warning will also indicate that the overload is about to run out. The [[holy overload]], due to it being a combination of the two potions, has this effect.

{{UH|
* {{UL|type=patch|update=This Week In RuneScape: Heartstealer Quest and Ninja Strike 19: Fairy Rings|date=8 February 2021}}
** Crafting a Prayer Renewal potion will no longer claim you've made a [[Summoning renewal]].

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (29 February 2016)|date=29 February 2016}}
** Resolved an issue where the prayer renew buff icon was vanishing from the buff bar after teleporting.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (28 November 2012)|date=28 November 2012}}
** Morytania 4 legs once again gives a chance of creating a 4-dose prayer renewal potion.

*{{UL|type=patch|update= Patch Notes (24 July 2012)|date=24 July 2012}}
** Using an emote from [[Solomon's General Store]], whilst the Prayer renewal potion effect is running, will no longer cause the player to temporarily go invisible.

*{{UL|type=patch|update= Patch Notes (28 February 2012)|date=28 February 2012}}
** The Prayer Renew potion effect is now consistently removed on death.

* {{UL|type=update|update=New High-Level Prayer Potion|date=6 September 2011}}
** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* The 4-dose version of this potion was sold for over 150,000 each during the first day of its release.
* The [[reverence]] aura increases the amount gained from one potion, but does not speed up the restoration rate.
* Previously, players would receive a warning message 30 seconds before their renewal potion runs out, but only if player's game messages are set to "all" and not "filter". This has been since fixed and now displays warning text in blue, even if game messages are set to "filter".
* Due to the timed nature of this potion, a great use for it is to remind players when to re-boost their combat stats back up with the super or extreme attack, strength, and defence potions.
* The effect of the potion can be taken into [[Daemonheim]]: drink a one dose potion, drop the empty vial, and enter the dungeon and when players use prayer inside Daemonheim the prayer renewal will continue to restore prayer.
* Wearing +28 prayer bonus equipment with 99 prayer and utilising the Protect Melee prayer while having the effects of a prayer renewal potion active, a player's prayer points will not decrease nor increase for 5 minutes. At level 75 Prayer players will need 42 prayer bonus equipment in order to not lose prayer points while having the effects of a prayer renewal potion active and the Protect Melee prayer on. If the Reverence aura is on, a player's prayer points can slightly increase. The same holds for [[Deflect Melee]].
* The 4-dose version has an icon very similar to the [[Hag's poison]] from [[The Feud]].
* The potion still has the usage sound after the update on [[31 January]] [[2012]].
* Prayer renewal potions are the only potions that do not have a shared buy limit with other doses unlike other potions.
* The effect previously lasted only 5 minutes and 10 seconds. This made usage with overloads more inconvenient, since the buff timers would drift apart. <!--until when? dec 2019 at the latest -->

A '''strength potion''' is an item that temporarily raises a player's [[Strength]] level by 1 + 8% (rounded down) when they drink it. [[Pay-to-play|Members]] can make a strength potion with 3 doses by mixing [[Clean tarromin|tarromin]] to a [[vial of water]] and then adding [[limpwurt root]]. This requires level 7 [[Herblore]], and gives 40 [[experience]].

[[Free-to-play|Non-members]] cannot make the potion via Herblore, but can still obtain it by trading with other players or talking to the [[Apothecary]]. Players can take a [[limpwurt root]] and [[red spiders' eggs]] to the Apothecary in [[Varrock]], who will make a 4-dose strength potion for 5 coins. No Herblore level is required for this. At current prices, making this potion from the Apothecary will result in a {{coins|{{#expr:{{GEPrice|Strength potion (4)|n}}-{{GEPrice|Limpwurt root|n}}-{{GEPrice|Red spiders' eggs|n}}-5}}}} profit compared to simply buying the potion at the GE and selling the ingredients there as well.

A strength potion can be made into a [[Strength flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[Potion flask]]. A strength potion (4) is also an ingredient in a [[Grand strength potion]], one of the [[combination potions]].

One-dose strength potions can sometimes be found inside [[Barrel (interactive scenery)|barrels]].

It should be noted that using a dose of a strength potion will not stack with the passive boost of the [[Armadyl godsword]].

'''Adrenaline potions''' require a Herblore level of 84 to make. When the potion is consumed, the player will regain 25% of their [[adrenaline]] bar or special attack energy. Boosts such as [[Greenman's ale]] can be used to make this potion, and the potion can be consumed at lower levels.

A [[super energy potion]] (3-dose) and a [[papaya]] are the ingredients required to create this potion. Making this potion will give 200 Herblore experience. The potion cannot be made with the [[assistance]] of others.

This potion can only be drunk once every 120 seconds (two minutes). Drinking it while not in combat places you in combat stance for 10 seconds.

Adrenaline potions can be made into [[super adrenaline potion]]s using a 3-dose adrenaline potion and an [[adrenaline crystal]]. This requires 87 Herblore and grants 200 experience.

This potion can be made into an [[adrenaline flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]].

==Uses==
* If used after a damage boosting ultimate ability, such as [[Berserk]], it can allow more threshold abilities or another direct-damage ultimate to be used under the effect, resulting in massive damage.
* These potions can be used to increase adrenaline for [[Regenerate]] or [[Rejuvenate]] (at 75% adrenaline with a shield) abilities, thus allowing you to heal at an opportune moment.
* These can be used just after activating [[Living Death]] in order to use [[Death Skulls]] sooner in a damage rotation. With other adrenaline retention effects like [[Ring of vigour]] and [[Supreme invigorate aura|Supreme invigorate]], this can allow 3 casts of Death Skulls within the Living Death instead of only two.

{{UH|

403943.name: Weapon poison+++
403943.content:
{{oupotion}} {{HasCalculator|Calculator:Combat/Poison}} {{Infobox Item |version1 = (1) |version2 = (2) |version3 = (3) |version4 = (4) |defver = 4 |name1 = Weapon poison+++ (1) |name2 = Weapon poison+++ (2) |name3 = Weapon poison+++ (3) |name4 = Weapon poison+++ (4) |image1 = [[File:Weapon poison+++ (1).png]] |image2 = [[File:Weapon poison+++ (2).png]] |image3 = [[File:Weapon poison+++ (3).png]] |image4 = [[File:Weapon poison+++ (4).png]] |name = Weapon poison+++ |release = [[25 November]] [[2019]] |update = Game Update: The Ranch Out of Time, Farming 120, Herblore 120 & Yak Track |members = Yes |quest = No |restriction = surface |tradeable = Yes |equipable = No |stackable = No |disassembly = Yes |noteable = Yes |actions = Apply, Empty |actions_bank = Apply |value1 = 144 |value2 = 288 |value3 = 432 |value4 = 576 |exchange = gemw |destroy = Drop |kept = reclaimable |weight1 = 0.02 |weight2 = 0.025 |weight3 = 0.03 |weight4 = 0.035 |examine = A vial of extremely potent weapon poison. |id1 = 49121 |id2 = 49119 |id3 = 49117 |id4 = 49115 }} {{synced switch |version1 = [[File:Weapon poison+++ (1) detail.png|left|100px]] |version2 = [[File:Weapon poison+++ (2) detail.png|left|100px]] |version3 = [[File:Weapon poison+++ (3) detail.png|left|100px]] |version4 = [[File:Weapon poison+++ (4) detail.png|left|100px]] }} '''Weapon poison+++''' is the strongest variant of [[Weapon poison (disambiguation)|weapon poison]]. Weapon poison+++ is created by mixing together a [[weapon poison++#(3)|three-dose weapon poison++]], [[poison slime]], and [[primal extract]]. The potion grants 700 [[Herblore]] experience and requires level 100 Herblore. The [[Varanusaur (player-owned farm)|varanusaur]] Envenomed [[Perks (player-owned farm)|perk]] gives a 10% chance to make 4 doses instead of 3 doses when mixing weapon poison or [[antipoison]] potions. Applying weapon poison+++ will give a 12.5% chance per hit to [[poison]] the opponent(s) in combat. The poison effect appears as a buff and lasts for 12 minutes, dealing between 22.75 and 45.5% of your [[ability damage]] per poison hit. This deals poison damage on the first application and renews the poison duration. Poison will hit every 10 seconds and wear off after 3 minutes. When paired with [[cinderbane gloves]], weapon poison+++ will have its base poison damage increased from 200 to 250, and the poison will process more often than using either of them separately.{{CiteGeneral|url=https://imgur.com/LseCyNx|title=Message in #ranch-out-of-time channel of official RuneScape Discord server|author=Mod Breezy|date=12 November 2019|accessdate=5 November 2020|publisher=Discord|archiveurl=https://archive.md/EUJlz|archivedate=26 February 2023|quote=yeah they affect base poison damage too so the "scalar" in code is like; tier 1 poison - 50; tier 2 - 100; tier 3 - 150; tier 4 - 200; tier 5 - 250; the current highest is weapon poison++ at tier 3 PLUS cinders = tier 4; with the update, wep pois+++will allow it to go to tier 5 with cinders}} This potion can be made into an [[weapon poison+++ flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks. ==Price per dose== {{Price per dose}} ==Creation== {{Infobox Recipe |storeValue = 129 |alchValue = 259 |members = Yes |ticks = 2 |ticks2 = 1 |ticksnote = When mixing a single potion |skill1 = Herblore |skill1lvl = 100 |skill1boostable = yes |skill1exp = 700 |mat1 = Weapon poison++ (3) |mat2 = Poison slime |mat3 = Primal extract |output1 = Weapon poison+++ (3) }} ===Production costs=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Herb ! Secondaries ! Vial ! Material cost ! Profit ! Profit/XP |- | {{NA}} | {{plink|Poison slime}}
{{plink|Primal extract}} | {{plink|Weapon poison++ (3)}} | {{Coins|({{GEP|Weapon poison++ (3)}} + {{GEP|Poison slime}} + {{GEP|Primal extract}})}} | {{Coins|{{GEP|Weapon poison+++ (3)}} - ({{GEP|Weapon poison++ (3)}} + {{GEP|Poison slime}} + {{GEP|Primal extract}})}} | {{Coins|({{GEP|Weapon poison+++ (3)}} - ({{GEP|Weapon poison++ (3)}} + {{GEP|Poison slime}} + {{GEP|Primal extract}})) / 700 round 2}} |} ==Comparison== {{Weapon poison compare}} ==Money making guide== {{Mmgsection|Making weapon poison+++}} ==Disassembly== {{Disassembly |version1=(1)|version2=(2)|version3=(3)|version4=(4) |name = Weapon poison+++ |name1 = Weapon poison+++ (1) |name2 = Weapon poison+++ (2) |name3 = Weapon poison+++ (3) |name4 = Weapon poison+++ (4) |level = 100 |category = Potions |category1=1 dose|category2=2 dose|category3=3 dose|category4=4 dose }} ==Update history== {{UH| * {{UL|type=patch|update=This Week In RuneScape: Rex Matriarchs & Combat Week!|date=19 April 2021}} ** Fixed an issue on weapon poison potions of all tiers that incorrectly stated the chance to apply poison was 15%. The tooltip has been adjusted to match the correct value of 12.5%. * {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (16 December 2019)|date=16 December 2019}} ** Using Cinderbanes with Weapon Poison+++ applied will now correctly scale the poison damage above Weapon Poison++. * {{UL|type=update|update=Game Update: The Ranch Out of Time, Farming 120, Herblore 120 & Yak Track|date=25 November 2019}} ** Added to game. }} ==See also== * [[Weapon poison]] * [[Weapon poison+]] * [[Weapon poison++]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{potions}} {{Primal extract potions}}

A '''magic potion''' is an item that temporarily raises a player's [[Magic]] level by 18 (1 + 8% of their Magic level, rounded down) when they drink it. A magic potion with three doses can be made at level 5 Herblore by adding a [[Bead#Herblore|bead]] to a [[tarromin potion (unf)]], giving 35 [[Herblore]] experience.

[[Wizard's mind bomb]] gives the higher or same boost to players below 25 Magic, while being cheaper and easier to obtain, although it does negatively affect [[Attack]], [[Strength]], and [[Defence]]. However, with at least 25 Magic, the magic potion becomes equal to or stronger than even [[wizard's mind bomb (m)|the mature version]], which is also more expensive.

A '''ranging potion''' is an item that temporarily raises a player's [[Ranged]] level by 1-8 (1 + 8% of their Ranged level, rounded down) when they drink it. It can be made by adding [[redberries]] to a [[guam potion (unf)]], both of which can be grown using [[Farming]], giving 30 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires a Herblore level of 3 to make.
A ranging potion (4) is an ingredient in a [[grand ranging potion]], one of the combination potions.

[[File:Wine_of_Saradomin_detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Wine of Saradomin''' is a type of wine brewed with [[grapes of Saradomin]], which can be grown using the [[Farming]] skill. Grapes of Saradomin are added to a [[jug of water]] to create [[unfermented wine of Saradomin]]; this requires 92 [[Cooking]] and immediately gives 1 experience. After 18 seconds have elapsed since the first unfermented wine was brewed, all unfermented wine of Saradomin will ferment into wine of Saradomin, giving 200 Cooking experience. It can then be used as a secondary ingredient to create [[super Saradomin brew]] by adding it to a three-dose vial of [[Saradomin brew]].

A '''super Saradomin brew''' is an upgraded version of the normal [[Saradomin brew]]. It is created by mixing a Saradomin brew (3) with a [[wine of Saradomin]]. It heals 1,300 life points per dose. It may also overheal up to 1,300 life points above normal maximum lifepoints as a temporary boost. This is unaffected by [[Constitution]] and is the same regardless of level. Mixing a super Saradomin brew requires a [[Herblore]] level of 93 and yields 180 xp in Herblore. Similarly to Saradomin brews, it increases [[Defence]] by 6% + 1, but decreases [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Magic]], [[Ranged]], and [[Necromancy]] levels by 4% + 1.

This potion is one of few ways to raise life points above the normal maximum. The boosting effect will not stack with [[rocktail]], but it will stack with the warmth of a [[bonfire]]. It also does not decrease [[adrenaline]] like traditional food.

A '''Super Zamorak brew''' is made by mixing a [[Zamorak brew (3)]] and [[wine of Zamorak]] with at least level 93 in [[Herblore]], awarding 180 experience.

The super Zamorak brew boosts [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Ranged]], [[Magic]], and [[Necromancy]] by 2 + 12% of the player's level, rounded down. It will lower life points by 20 + 8% of the player's max life points and [[Defence]] by 2 + 8% of the player's level, rounded down. Unlike the regular Zamorak brew, the super Zamorak brew does not restore [[prayer]] points.

Super Zamorak brew's offensive boosts are equal to super potions in those 5 skills. Notably, it has the same Necromancy boost as [[super necromancy]] potions for a fraction of the price, although it may be hard to buy due to low volume.

This potion can be useful to bring life points down so that the [[Dharok the Wretched's equipment|Dharok]] set will be more effective. However, it is more cost-effective to drink the regular [[Zamorak brew]] or using [[Self-injury|alternative methods]] to lower life points.

A '''Super Guthix rest''' potion is made by mixing a jug of [[wine of Guthix]] with a [[Guthix rest (3)]]. This requires level 93 [[Herblore]] and yields 59.5 experience. Upon being drunk, it cures poison, provides about 30 seconds of poison immunity, heals 650 life points and can temporarily boost your maximum life points by 650.

This potion can be made into a [[super Guthix rest flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

==Update history==
{{UH|
* {{UL|type=patch|update=QoL Mini Strike & Advent Calendar - This Week In RuneScape|date=28 November 2022}}
** Super Guthix rest potions no longer give adrenaline.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=TWIR: Raksha!|date=7 December 2020}}
** The [[Tireless blood essence]] can no longer be used to gain extra adrenaline while an Adrenaline Potion cooldown is active.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=TWIR: RuneScape Advent Calendar|date=30 November 2020}}
** The Super Guthix Rest and [[Super Guthix brew flask|Brew Flask]] now have a 30 second cooldown, down from 45.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=This Week In RuneScape - 03/08/20#patch-notes|date=3 August 2020}}
** Updated potion tooltips that reference adrenaline/special attack gain to specify percentage rather than a value, and to match the other adrenaline potions.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (16 December 2019)|date=16 December 2019}}
** Prevented two doses adrenaline restoration-type potions from being used between the cooldown ending and the new one activating.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (21 November 2016)|date=21 November 2016}}
** The healing tooltip on all variants of the Guthix rest potions has been corrected.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (30 August 2016)|date=30 August 2016}}
** [[Guthix rest]] potions now heal 500 lifepoints and Super Guthix rest potions heal 650 lifepoints.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (22 September 2014)|date=22 September 2014}}
** It is now possible to drink super Guthix restore potions while in [[Legacy Mode]] or with the [[adrenaline potion]] penalty.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (31 March 2014)|date=31 March 2014}}
** The [[scroll of cleansing]] now properly recognises secondary ingredients when mixing super Guthix rest potions.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (21 January 2014)|date=21 January 2014}}
** The description of the super Guthix rest potion displayed inside the [[Make X]] interface has been simplified.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Harvest Heaven: High-Level Farming|date=20 May 2013}}
** Added to game.
}}

The '''grand strength potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 75 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[super strength (4)]] and a [[strength potion (4)]] in a [[crystal flask]], giving 123.8 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 100,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of grand strength boosts [[Strength]] by 14% of your Strength level, plus 2, rounded down. This makes it better than [[super strength]], but worse than [[extreme strength]].
