The '''grand ranging potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 76 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[super ranging potion (4)]] and a [[ranging potion (4)]] in a [[crystal flask]], giving 144.4 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 100,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of grand ranging boosts [[Ranged]] by 14% of your Ranged level, plus 2, rounded down. This makes it better than [[super ranging]], but worse than [[extreme ranging]].

Making this potion from the 2 potion ingredients is a requirement for completing the[[Tirannwn achievements#Elite achievements|elite Tirannwn achievement]][[The Expensive Range]].

The recipe can be bought for 500,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of supreme strength potion boosts [[Strength]] by 16% of your Strength level, plus 4, rounded down; this provides an additional 2 levels over [[extreme strength]] at level 99 for a final level of 118. The boosts decrease by 1 point per minute.

The recipe can be bought for 500,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of supreme magic potion boosts [[Magic]] by 16% of your Magic level, plus 4, rounded down; this provides an additional 2 levels over [[extreme magic]] at level 99 for a final level of 118. The boost decreases by 1 point per minute.

The '''brightfire potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 94 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[super antifire (4)]] with a [[prayer renewal (4)]] into a [[crystal flask]], giving 300 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 600,000 coins from [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of brightfire has the effects of both super antifire and prayer renewal, slowly restoring [[prayer points]] and protecting from [[dragonfire]] for six minutes.

This potion does not protect players from [[wyverns]]' or [[skeletal wyverns]]' breath.

The '''holy overload potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 97 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining an [[overload (4)]] with a [[prayer renewal (4)]] in a [[crystal flask]], giving 350 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 700,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of holy overload combines the effects of both an overload and prayer renewal. It boosts [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Defence]], [[Ranged]], [[Magic]], and [[Necromancy]] by 15% of the stat level + 3 while also restoring [[prayer points]] at a constant rate for 6 minutes. Each flask lasts for 36 minutes in total. Much like a normal overload, the combat skill boosts will reapply every 15 seconds.

The holy overload is a highly economical combination potion to make. Each flask grants 6 doses with 4 doses of its inputs, and there are few situations where one would want overload but not prayer renewal. Using holy overloads also cuts the inventory space needed in half.

Holy overload potions are required in the creation of the [[blessed flask]].

[[File:Crystal flask detail.png|left|75px]]
The '''crystal flask''' is a special type of [[Herblore]] equipment, made from [[crystal glass]], that is used to make [[combination potion]]s. Crystal flasks can only be created after completing [[Plague's End]] and [[As a First Resort]], asthe [[Crystal-flecked sandstone (ore)|crystal-flecked sandstone]] mine and [[robust glass machine]] are only accessible after completion of the quests.

Crystals flasks are made by using a[[glassblowing pipe]] with crystal glass (or simply by left-clicking the crystal glass if a glassblowing pipe is already on the player's [[tool belt]]), requiring 89 [[Crafting]] and yielding 150Crafting experience. Players may boost their level if below 89, but cannot be assisted. While the Voice of Seren is active in the Ithell district, creating a crystal flask when standing in the Ithell district yields 180 Crafting experience. If the [[Artificer's measure]] is equipped, the player has a 5% chance to create a duplicate flask.

Assuming a player mines the daily maximum ofcrystal-flecked sandstone, they will gain a minimum of 7,500 crafting experience each day (9000 with voice active) crafting them into flasks, along with {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Crystal flask|50}}|c}} if the flasks are sold. If the [[resourceful aura]] is used and the sandstone mine in the Edimmu dungeon is mined as well, an average of about 82 flasks can be made per day, giving 12,300—14,760 Crafting experience.

Crafting 100 crystal flasks unlocks the title {{TitleAnchor|t=of the Ithell|c=#EBF7F1|loc=s|bg=yes}}.

[[File:Crystal tree blossom detail.png|left|80px]]
A '''crystal tree blossom''' is an [[Items|item]] used as an ingredient to create a [[perfect plus potion]].

It can be harvested from the [[crystal tree (Farming)|crystal tree]] grown from a [[crystal acorn]] planted in the [[crystal tree patch]] in the [[Tower of Voices]] in [[Prifddinas]], which requires level 94 [[Farming]] to plant. One blossom can be harvested from the tree per day, yielding 15,000 Farming experience. Two blossoms will be received if the [[elite Tirannwn achievements]] have been completed and the [[Tirannwn quiver 4]] is worn, but this will not double the amount of experience earned when harvesting.

[[File:Harmony moss detail.png|left|120px]]
'''Harmony moss''' is a moss that can be harvested from a [[harmony moss seed]] planted on a [[harmony pillar]], requiring level 75 [[Farming]].

Harmony moss is required for crafting [[perfect plus]] potions and various other perfect juju potions. 

==Farming==
Harmony moss can be harvested from [[harmony moss seed]]s grown on a [[harmony pillar]]. Harmony moss, when picked, gives 1,133.3 [[Farming]] experience per moss harvested.

Harmony moss has a unique growing mechanic, and only advances growth stages when the player gains 50,000 [[experience]] in the [[skill]] attuned to the [[harmony pillar]] at the time the [[harmony moss seed]] is planted. To fully grow the moss, 200,000 experience, not counting [[bonus experience]], must be gained in the skill to which the pillar is attuned. 

A [[perfect juju farming potion]] may increase the yield when harvesting, as may equipping a [[Tirannwn quiver 3]] or [[Tirannwn quiver 4|4]]. A perfect juju farming potion also gives a 5% chance when active to harvest harmony moss from any other farming patch.

Unlike crops, herbs, etc., when harvesting harmony moss from a pillar, all moss is harvested at once.

==Other uses==
* Harvesting 50 harmony moss is the requirement for the "[[of the Meilyr]]" title. 
* Harvesting harmony moss while the [[Voice of Seren]] is active in the [[Meilyr Clan]] is required for [[Sing-Along-a-Seren Verse 6]], one of the [[Hard Tirannwn achievements]].

==Update history==
{{UH|
* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (16 September 2019)|date=16 September 2019}}
** The perfect juju farming potion now gives harmony moss when using patch bombs or the farming skillcape perk.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (20 August 2018)|date=20 August 2018}}
** Players are no longer given an incorrect message when harvesting harmony moss pillars.
* {{UL|type=patch|update=Boss Drop Collections - Motherlode Maw Improvements|date=4 September 2017}}
** Harmony moss is removed as a potential reward from Motherlode Maw.
* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (8 February 2016)|date=8 February 2016}}
** The harmony moss farmer has been reminded how to correctly count to 50.
* {{UL|type=ninja|update=Patch Notes (5 January 2015)|date=5 January 2015}}
** Players will now get a message when their harmony moss pillar is fully grown.
** Players can now reroll a harmony pillar at the cost of 10 vis wax.
** Players now gain significantly more Farming XP from harvesting harmony moss pillars.
** The Remote Farm spell now works on harmony moss pillars.
* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (17 November 2014)|date=17 November 2014}}
** The 'of the Meilyr' title's requirement has been lowered from 200 to 50 harmony moss harvested. If you've already harvested more than 50 harmony moss, you'll unlock the title on their next harvest.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Prifddinas - Lost City of the Elves - Part 2|date=10 November 2014}}
** Added to game.
}}

The '''grand attack potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 78 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[super attack (4)]] and an [[attack potion (4)]] in a [[crystal flask]], giving 93.8 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 100,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of grand attack boosts [[Attack]] by 14% of your Attack level, plus 2, rounded down. This makes it better than [[super attack]], but worse than [[extreme attack]].

[[File:Supreme defence potion detail.png|75px|left]]
The '''supreme defence potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 93 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[super defence (4)]] and an [[extreme defence (4)]] in a [[crystal flask]], giving 292.5 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 500,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of supreme defence potion boosts [[Defence]] by 16% of your Defence level, plus 4, rounded down; this provides an additional 2 levels over [[extreme defence]] at level 99 for a final level of 118. The boosts decrease by 1 point per minute.

[[File:Replenishment potion detail.png|75px|left]]
The '''replenishment potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 87 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining an [[adrenaline potion (4)]] and a [[super restore (4)]] into a [[crystal flask]], giving 256.9 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 200,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]].

A dose of replenishment has the effects of both an adrenaline potion and a super restore, giving 25% [[adrenaline]] along with restoring 25% + 8 of the level of all skills, including [[Summoning point]]s, and restores 25% + 80 [[Prayer]] points.

The replenishment potion shares a cool-down timer of 2 minutes with the [[adrenaline potion]], although when clicking the right-click option of Drink Restore, one can drink the restore's effect while on cooldown.

==Update history==
{{UH|
* {{UL|type=patch|update=TWIR: Raksha!|date=7 December 2020}}
** The [[Tireless blood essence]] can no longer be used to gain extra adrenaline while an Adrenaline Potion cooldown is active.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=This Week In RuneScape - 03/08/20#patch-notes|date=3 August 2020}}
** Updated potion tooltips that reference adrenaline/special attack gain to specify percentage rather than a value, and to match the other adrenaline potions.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (16 December 2019)|date=16 December 2019}}
** Prevented two doses adrenaline restoration-type potions from being used between the cooldown ending and the new one activating.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (20 April 2015)|date=20 April 2015}}
** Drinking a replenishment potion is once again restricted to the adrenaline potion cooldown. This can be bypassed for just the restore potion effect by right-clicking and selecting "Drink restore".

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (13 April 2015)|date=13 April 2015}}
** Replenishment potions may now be consumed for their Super restore effect whilst adrenaline/special attack is at its maximum or when the Adrenaline potion prevention debuff is in effect.

* {{UL|type=update|update=Prifddinas - Lost City of the Elves - Part 2|date=10 November 2014}}
** Added to game.
}}

The '''wyrmfire potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 89 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining an [[antifire (4)]] and a [[super antifire (4)]] into a [[crystal flask]], giving 275.7 experience.

The recipe does not need to be found in [[Daemonheim|Daemonheim]] and can be bought for 200,000 coins from [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]].

The '''super prayer renewal potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 96 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[prayer potion (4)]] and a [[prayer renewal (4)]] into a [[crystal flask]], giving 208.2 [[experience]].

The recipe can be bought for 750,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr Recipe Shop]], while you do not need to find this recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A dose of super prayer renewal has the effects of both a prayer potion and prayer renewal, restoring 25% + 70 of total [[Prayer]] points up front as well as 47% + 130.5 Prayer points over the course of 6 minutes. This makes it very useful for restoring lots of Prayer points while saving inventory spaces.

[[File:Supreme overload potion detail.png|left|75px]]
The '''supreme overload potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 98 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining an [[overload (4)]] with [[super attack (4)]], [[super defence (4)]], [[super strength (4)]], [[super ranging potion (4)]], [[super magic potion (4)]], and [[super necromancy (4)]] in a [[crystal flask]], giving 600 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 900,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]].

A dose of supreme overload potion is a slightly better version of normal overload; it boosts the six combat skills by 16% + 4 rather than 15% + 3. Assuming a player has level 99 in the relevant skills, the supreme overload potion boosts combat skills by +19, making it +2 levels better than a normal overload. Each dose lasts for 6 minutes, for a total of 36 minutes per flask. Much like a normal overload, the combat skill boosts will reapply every 15 seconds.

A supreme overload potion (6) is one of the ingredients used to create a [[supreme overload salve]] or an [[elder overload potion]].

{{Combat Potion Boost Table|16|4|is120=yes|class=mw-collapsible mw-collapsed}}

==Analysis==
Given that the supreme overload potion is six doses, it always pays to make these potions if the total cost is less than twice that of a three-dose overload ({{NoCoins|{{potioncost|overload}}*2|c}}). Given the extra effects, it may also pay to make them if they are more expensive than that, the exact ratio depending on personal circumstances.

==Creation==
Without counting any boosts that let them be made more efficiently, the ingredients for all of the components required to make 3 supreme overload potions (6) from scratch are 3 [[crystal flask]], 48 [[vial of water]] (if [[vial]]s are not recycled), 8 [[clean irit]], 8 [[eye of newt]], 4 [[clean avantoe]], 8 [[clean kwuarm]], 8 [[limpwurt root]], 12 [[clean dwarf weed]], 8 [[clean cadantine]], 8 [[white berries]], 12 [[clean lantadyme]], 8 [[wine of Zamorak]], 20 [[grenwall spikes]], 8 [[potato cactus]], 4 [[ground mud runes]], 8 [[clean spirit weed]], 40 [[congealed blood]], 4 [[ground miasma rune]], and 4 [[clean torstol]].

With 120 Herblore, supreme overloads can be made in a batch, creating four potions with the ingredients of three potions. This is only available when the [[Herblore master cape]] perk is active (worn, present in [[max cape]], or in the [[Anachronia base camp]] player lodge skill cape stand).

The ingredients of a supreme overload can be combined into a [[supreme overload (6) (unf)|stackable unfinished potion]] by [[Granny Rowan]] once the tier 3 [[Botanist's Workbench]] has been constructed in [[Fort Forinthry]]. Unfinished overloads can then be finished at the workbench for the usual experience. The usual potion duplication bonuses for combination potions apply, but ingredient-saving bonuses do not; the master cape also unlocks a batch recipe for unfinished potions.

The '''supreme overload salve''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 99 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[supreme overload potion (6)]], [[prayer renewal (4)]], [[prayer potion (4)]], [[super antifire (4)]], [[antifire (4)]] and [[super antipoison (4)]], in a [[crystal flask]], giving 700 experience.

A dose of supreme overload salve has many effects and lasts 6 minutes. It boosts [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Magic]], [[Ranged]], [[Defence]], and [[Necromancy]] by 16% of each level plus 4 levels, respectively, restores [[prayer points]] instantly and over time, and protects from [[dragonfire]], wyvern breath, and poison. Much like a normal [[overload]], the combat skill boosts will reapply every 15 seconds. The antipoison duration is not constantly refreshed, and is reduced by absorbing poison hits as usual.

A supreme overload salve (6) is one of the ingredients used to create a [[elder overload salve]] with the alternate recipe unlocked.

==Creation==
The ingredients of a supreme overload salve can be combined into a [[supreme overload salve (6) (unf)|stackable unfinished potion]] by [[Granny Rowan]] once the tier 3 [[Botanist's Workbench]] has been constructed in [[Fort Forinthry]]. Unfinished supreme overload salves can then be finished at the workbench for the usual experience. The usual potion duplication bonuses apply, but ingredient-saving bonuses do not.

[[File:Overload salve detail.png|75px|left]]
The '''overload salve''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be created by the player at level 97 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is created by combining a [[overload (4)]], [[prayer renewal (4)]], [[prayer potion (4)]], [[super antifire (4)]], [[antifire (4)]] and [[super antipoison (4)]] in a [[crystal flask]], granting 500 experience.

A dose of overload salve has multiple effects. It boosts [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Magic]], [[Ranged]], [[Defence]], and [[Necromancy]] by 15% of the level plus 3, restores [[prayer points]] identically to [[super prayer renewal]], and protects from [[dragonfire]], [[wyvern]] breath and [[poison]]. Much like a normal [[overload]], the combat skill boosts will reapply every 15 seconds. The antipoison duration is not constantly refreshed, and is reduced by absorbing poison hits as usual.

It should be noted that overload salves '''cannot''' be used in the creation of [[supreme overload salve]]s (which can further be upgraded into [[elder overload salve]]s). For this reason, it is highly recommended to wait until supreme overloads can be created before creating salves.

==Unlocking==
{{Main|Recipe Shop}}
The recipe for overload salve can be found inside [[Daemonheim]] while training [[Dungeoneering]], received from the [[Motherlode Maw]], or purchased from the Dungeoneering [[rewards trader]] after asking [[Lady Meilyr]] for details. After finding the [[unreadable page]], purchasing the recipe for {{formatnum:800000}} coins at the [[Recipe Shop]] will permanently unlock the ability to mix the potion. The shop is operated by Lady Meilyr or any [[harmony pillar farmer]] in the [[Meilyr Clan]] district of [[Prifddinas]].

==Creation==
The ingredients of an overload salve can be combined into a [[overload salve (6) (unf)|stackable unfinished potion]] by [[Granny Rowan]] once the tier 3 [[Botanist's Workbench]] has been constructed in [[Fort Forinthry]]. Unfinished overload salves can then be finished at the workbench for the usual experience. The usual potion duplication bonuses apply, but ingredient-saving bonuses do not.

The '''extreme warmaster's potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 93 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining an [[extreme magic (4)]], [[extreme ranging (4)]], [[extreme attack (4)]], [[extreme strength (4)]] and [[extreme defence (4)]] in a [[crystal flask]], giving 500 experience.

The [[Unreadable page|recipe]] for this potion can be found inside [[Daemonheim]] while [[Dungeoneering]]. After finding the recipe, bring it to [[Lady Meilyr]] and pay 400,000 coins to [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]] to permanently unlock the ability to make extreme warmaster's potion.

A dose of extreme warmaster boosts the five combat skills by 15% of their level, plus 3. This is very similar to [[overload]], except like regular extreme potions, the boosts from the extreme warmaster's potion do not refresh every 15 seconds.

The '''super melee potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 81 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[super attack (4)]], [[super defence (4)]] and [[super strength (4)]] into a [[crystal flask]], giving 281.3 experience.

A dose of super melee potion has all the effects of its ingredients, boosting [[Attack]], [[Strength]] and [[Defence]] by 12% of the level, plus 2.

Making a super melee potion, giving it to Lady Meilyr and exchanging for the [[melee XP lamp]] is a requirement for the achievement [[Potion For a Lady]] required for both the [[completionist cape]] and [[master quest cape]].

After finding the [[unreadable page]], purchasing the recipe for {{formatnum:150000}} coins at the [[Recipe Shop]] will permanently unlock the ability to mix the potion. The shop is operated by Lady Meilyr or any [[harmony pillar farmer]] in the [[Meilyr Clan]] district of [[Prifddinas]].

A '''perfect juju agility potion''' is a potion made using the [[Herblore]] skill. It is made by combining a [[scentless potion (3)]] with [[harmony moss]], requiring 85 Herblore and giving 101.3 experience. This makes a three dose potion, and it can be [[decanting|decanted]] into other doses by talking to [[Bob Barter (herbs)]]. It can also be turned into a six-dose [[Perfect juju agility flask]] by talking to [[Teplin Macagan]] with a [[potion flask]].

A dose of the potion lasts for one hour. While the potion is in effect, for each lap of the [[Hefin Agility Course]], there is an increased chance that either the [[Hefin_Agility_Course#Shortcuts|window shortcut]] will be usable, or there will be a [[Hefin_Agility_Course#Shortcuts|light creature shortcut]] on the roof. Note that the two effects might be activated on the same run.

A '''perfect juju farming potion''' is a potion made using the [[Herblore]] skill. It is made by combining a [[juju farming potion (3)]] with [[harmony moss]], requiring 77 [[Herblore]] and giving 109.5 experience. This makes a three dose potion, and it can be [[decanting|decanted]] into other doses by talking to [[Bob Barter (herbs)]]. It can also be turned into a six-dose [[Perfect juju farming flask]] by talking to [[Teplin Macagan]] with a [[potion flask]].

A dose of the potion lasts for one hour. While the potion is in effect, you have a 5% chance of getting [[harmony moss]] from '''unknown specific types''' of [[farming patch]]es, and a 25% chance of getting two harmony moss at once from a [[harmony pillar]]. It is possible to receive harmony moss even if you do not have access to [[Prifddinas]] and cannot make [[perfect juju potion]]s yourself.

[[Mushroom patch]]es frequently give several harmony moss when harvested with the potion in effect.

The perfect juju farming potion '''does not''' provide the herb gathering bonus that the regular juju farming potion has, though it can be used alongside the latter.  

A perfect juju farming potion is required to obtain the [[memoriam crystal 16]].

A '''perfect juju woodcutting potion''' is a potion made using the [[Herblore]] skill. It is made by combining a [[juju woodcutting potion]] with [[harmony moss]], requiring 75 Herblore and giving 120 experience. This makes a three dose potion, and it can be [[decanting|decanted]] into other doses by talking to [[Bob Barter (herbs)|Bob Barter]]. It can also be turned into a six-dose [[perfect juju woodcutting flask]] by talking to [[Teplin Macagan]] with a [[potion flask]].

One dose of the potion lasts for one hour. While the potion is in effect, you have a 5% chance of getting two logs from a tree instead of one, giving twice as much experience. This also works on [[ivy]], [[overgrown idol]]s, [[crystal tree]]s, [[branching crystal]], [[Bamboo (tree)|bamboo]], [[timber fungus]], [[bloodwood tree]]s, [[golden bamboo]], and trees under the effect of [[Crystallise]], doubling the experience. It does not work on [[divine location]]s that yield [[Woodcutting]] experience.

A '''perfect juju herblore potion''' is a potion made using the [[Herblore]] skill. It is made by combining a [[Guthix's gift (3)]] with [[harmony moss]], requiring 90 Herblore and giving 127.5 experience. This makes a three dose potion, and it can be [[decanting|decanted]] into other doses by talking to [[Bob Barter (herbs)]]. It can also be turned into a six-dose [[Perfect juju herblore flask]] by talking to [[Teplin Macagan]] with a [[potion flask]].

A dose of the potion lasts for one hour. While the potion is in effect, you gain 5% more experience for making [[combination potion]]s, and a 10% higher chance of finding a combination potion recipe in [[Daemonheim]].

A '''perfect juju prayer potion''' is a potion made using the [[Herblore]] skill. It is made by combining a [[Saradomin's blessing (3)]] with [[harmony moss]], requiring 87 [[Herblore]] and giving 127.5 experience. This makes a three dose potion, and it can be [[decanting|decanted]] into other doses by talking to [[Bob Barter (herbs)]]. It can also be turned into a six-dose [[perfect juju prayer flask]] by talking to [[Teplin Macagan]] with a [[potion flask]].

A dose of the potion lasts for one hour. While the potion is in effect, you get 5% more experience for using [[cleansing crystal]]s on the Seren Stone in the Hefin Cathedral in [[Prifddinas]], as well as 5% more experience for sacrificing bones and ashes on a [[Player-owned house]] [[chapel]] [[altar]], the [[Chapel (Fort Forinthry)|Fort Forinthry chapel]], or the [[Chaos Temple (Wilderness)#Chaos Altar|Chaos altar]] at the [[Chaos Temple (Wilderness)|Chaos Temple]] in the [[Wilderness]]. This experience is added to the base experience, so it stacks multiplicatively with other boosts. This does not apply to the [[Powder of burials]].

[[File:Searing ashes detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Searing ashes''' are the 100% drop from [[lava strykewyrm]]s and [[WildyWyrm|their boss variant]]. They grant 200 [[Prayer]] experience when scattered, 700 Prayer experience when used on a [[gilded altar]] with both incense burners lit, and 800 Prayer experience when used at the [[Ectofuntus]]. They can also be used to fill [[infernal urn]]s.

Searing ashes give the most Prayer experience out of all commonly obtained bones and ashes, providing 10 more experience than [[reinforced dragon bones]] and slightly more than twice that of [[tortured ashes]].

Searing ashes are the secondary ingredient needed to create [[aggression potion]]s, requiring level 82 [[Herblore]].

}}

==Trivia==
* Prior to release, these ashes were at times referred to as "Corrupt ashes" and "Smouldering ashes".
* Upon release, the ashes gave 140 Prayer experience when scattered, to be on par with other ashes and bones. Due to player complaints, this was changed to 200 Prayer experience. However, they are still not recommended for Prayer training due to their high cost driven by [[aggression potion]]s.

A '''perfect juju fishing potion''' is a potion made using the [[Herblore]] skill. It is made by adding 10 [[harmony dust]] to a [[juju fishing potion|juju fishing potion (3)]], which requires level 92 Herblore and grants 127.5 Herblore experience. This makes a three dose potion, which can be [[decanting|decanted]] into other doses by talking to [[Bob Barter (herbs)|Bob Barter]], [[Rhobert Dail (herbs)|Rhobert Dail]], [[Rhodri Dail]], or [[Zahur]]. It can also be turned into a six-dose [[perfect juju fishing flask]] by talking to [[Teplin Macagan]] with a [[potion flask]] or by adding two three-dose potions together with a potion flask.

One dose of the potion increases the player's [[fishing]] success chance by 5% for one hour. It also provides the effect of normal juju fishing potions: a one in three chance of catching [[raw baron shark]] instead of a normal [[shark]] when shark fishing.

'''Stamina potions''' can be made at level 77 [[Herblore]]. They will temporarily raise the player's [[Agility]] level by 6, diminishing by 1 level every minute, and provide a 6 minute effect that restores run [[energy]] to 100% every three seconds, similar to the effects of the [[Spa|salt-water spring]] and [[Ogre flask (salt water)]].

Stamina potions are created by mixing a [[Super energy|three-dose super energy potion]] into an [[Arbuck potion (unf)|unfinished arbuck potion]]. This gives 175 [[Herblore]] [[experience]]. Unlike with most potions, the [[scroll of cleansing]] effect saves the unfinished potion instead of the other ingredient (super energy).

This potion is useful while training Agility, as it reduces the player's chance to fail an obstacle. It can also be used to pass a shortcut the player does not have the level for.

* The Old School RuneScape version of stamina potions were released 5 years prior being added to RuneScape 3.

'''Divination potions''' are potions that boost your [[Divination]] level by 3. A [[Herblore]] level of 43 is required to make the potion - the ingredients are [[clean spirit weed]] and [[Rabbit foot]]. It grants 97.5 experience once made. Rabbit feet can be obtained by raising rabbits on a [[player-owned farm]] or by hunting rabbits in [[Piscatoris Hunter area]]. 

It can also be upgraded to a [[Super divination potion]] at level 70 by adding [[zygomite fruit]].{{Clear|left}}

[[File:Congealed blood 1000 detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Congealed blood''' is an item dropped by many monsters in [[Morytania]], such as [[ghoul]]s and [[feral vampyre]]s. It was added as a drop ahead of the release of [[River of Blood]] to tie in with the [[blood essence]]-related reward from the quest.

Congealed blood may be used on a [[blood essence]] item to recharge it: 1 congealed blood provides 10 charges. It is also the secondary ingredient for [[super necromancy]] potions, requiring five pieces per potion.

Congealed blood may be used on a [[Drakan's medallion]] to increase the amount of charges stored to a maximum of 25,000 charges at a rate of 1 congealed blood per charge.

** The buy limit of congealed blood is now 5,000 every 4 hours.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=This Week In RuneScape - 10/08/20#patch-notes|date=10 August 2020}}

** Added to game.
}}

==Trivia==
* There is a bug where monsters in the God Wars Dungeon, and the Gargoyles in Kuradal's Dungeon dropped congealed blood despite not being in Morytania. This has not been fixed.
*The quickchat option for logging congealed blood drops caps after having obtained 65,500 congealed blood.

'''Clean bloodweed''' is a herb obtained by cleaning [[grimy bloodweed]] at level 57 [[Herblore]], which gives 11.5 Herblore experience.

The clean herb may be added to [[vial of water]] to create an [[Bloodweed potion (unf)|unfinished bloodweed potion]], which may then be turned into an [[aggression potion]], a [[camouflage potion]], or a [[luck potion]].

Unlike other regular herbs, the "burn" option on a deployed [[Deployable herb burner|herb burner]] does not work on it; the clean bloodweed must be used on the herb burner to burn it as normal.

[[File:Luck potion detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Luck potion''' is a single dose potion that can be made at level 57 [[Herblore]]. When consumed, it grants the player tier 2 [[luck]], equivalent to wearing a [[Ring of Wealth]], for 1 hour of in-game time, increasing the chances for receiving drops and rewards which fall into the tier 2 or lower luck category.

Creating a luck potion from scratch, starting with gathering the bloodweed herbs, is a [[Medium Wilderness achievement]]: [[Liquid Luck]].

Adding 6 [[onyx bolt tips]] to the completed potion creates an [[enhanced luck potion]], which increases the benefit from tier 2 to tier 3 luck, similar to the [[Ring of Fortune]].

When the potion's effect activates, the message {{RSFont|You feel the effects of your Luck Potion!|color=#ff7000}} appears.

==Luck effects==
While under the effects of the potion, the following monsters and activities are impacted:

{{Luck item effects|2}}

==Creation==
It can be made by using [[clean bloodweed]] and [[crushed dragonstone]] on a [[vial of water]]. Since it is a one-dose potion, it cannot be added to [[potion flask]]s.

An '''aggression potion''' is made with level 82 [[Herblore]] by using [[clean bloodweed]] and [[searing ashes]] on a [[vial of water]]. This grants the player 185 Herblore experience, and the process cannot be assisted.

When an aggression potion is consumed, it will cause monsters in an 17 by 17 tile area centred on the player to become aggressive towards them at the rate of one monster per three seconds{{CiteReddit|author=Mod Daze|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/runescape/comments/142kool/comment/jn8insn|title=Aggro Pot Nerf/Bug|quote=[...] the potion will aggro 1 mob every 3 seconds; it will not (and never has) aggro'd a whole area at once from what we can tell.|date=7 June 2023|archiveurl=https://archive.fo/Cg685|archivedate=27 June 2023|notes=|name=}}, regardless if [[tolerance]] has or has not been achieved yet. It also attracts [[implings]] to the player. Each dose lasts for 6 minutes. The effects of the potion can be removed early by drinking a [[cup of tea]] or drinking tea from a [[tea flask]] or [[heated tea flask]]. The timer on the potion will pause if the player is forced into the lobby, or when the server has recognised that the player has a forced logout, since the player cannot manually enter the lobby or log out while in combat. When the potion expires, the player receives the chat message: {{RSFont|The effects of your Aggression Potion have expired.|colour=#7f0000}}

Players using this potion during [[Slayer assignment]]s are advised to use caution if using [[Morvran]], as there are nearby [[Iorwerth guard]]s and [[Iorwerth scout|scouts]] who will attack the player if they are still under the effects of the potion.

The aggression potion is inconsistent when used with items that normally cause aggressive monsters to become [[tolerant]]. For instance, using an aggression potion with a [[shard of Zaros]] will not cause [[nihil]] to become aggressive. However, doing the same in the [[God Wars Dungeon]] will cause most of the dungeon's monsters to become aggressive.

This potion can be made into an [[aggression flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

==Immune monsters==
* Ineffective against all variants of [[strykewyrm]]s since the player has to stomp on their mound first.
* Ineffective against [[rune dragon]]s.
* [[Warped tortoise]] - doesn't work because you must still cleanse the tortoise before attacking.
* [[Camel warrior]] - doesn't work in the [[sunken pyramid]].

'''Super adrenaline potions''' are improved versions of [[adrenaline potion]]s. Drinking one restores 30% [[adrenaline]] (30% special attack in [[Legacy Mode]]), a 5% improvement over a normal adrenaline potion. Like the adrenaline potion, this potion can only be drunk once every 120 seconds (a two minute cooldown).

Super adrenaline potions are made by adding an [[adrenaline crystal]] to a 3-dose [[Adrenaline potion]], requiring level 87 [[Herblore]] and granting 200 Herblore experience. It can be made into a [[super adrenaline flask]] by using at least six doses of it with a [[potion flask]]. Players do not need a specific level to turn potions into flasks.

The [[enhanced replenishment potion]] also restores 30% adrenaline. The cost per dose is {{NoCoins|({{GETotal|Papaya fruit|Super energy (3)}} + {{GEPrice|Adrenaline crystal}}) / 3}} for a super adrenaline potion, and {{NoCoins|({{GETotal|Papaya fruit|Super energy (3)}}*4/3 + {{GETotal|Super restore (4)|Crystal flask}} + {{GEPrice|Adrenaline crystal}}) / 6}} for an enhanced replenishment potion, although the difference in cost is actually less, because the enhanced replenishment potion is a combination potion and does not benefit from the bonus effects of the [[portable well]], [[botanist's amulet]], or [[factory outfit]]. Enhanced replenishments also take more time to make due to the extra step, but also have the effects of a [[super restore]] and are automatically 6 doses per inventory slot.

If planning on making [[adrenaline renewal potion]]s, using super adrenaline potions is recommended as the recipe only needs 4 doses instead of 6, and there is an extra chance for the bonus effects to activate.

The '''enhanced replenishment potion'''  is a [[combination potion]] that is made by adding an [[adrenaline crystal]] to a [[replenishment potion (6)]], requiring level 90 [[Herblore]] and granting 256.9 Herblore experience.

Drinking an enhanced replenishment potion adds 30% [[adrenaline]] (30% special attack in [[Legacy Mode]] combat) and the effect of a [[super restore]] (restores 25% + 8 of the level of all skills, including [[Summoning point]]s, and restores 25% + 80 [[Prayer]] points). This is an additional 5% adrenaline over a normal replenishment potion. As a potion which grants adrenaline, this potion shares the adrenaline cooldown with all other potions which grant an adrenaline boost, meaning that once drunk, the player will not be able to drink another adrenaline-boosting potion for two minutes.

[[File:Phasmatite detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Phasmatite''' is a resource that can be obtained through mining [[phasmatite rocks]], requiring level 70 [[Mining]], in various places around ''RuneScape''.

Phasmatite is required to craft [[necronium bar]]s along with [[necrite ore]]. As players increase their Mining level and use higher tier [[pickaxes|pickaxe]]s, they are able to mine phasmatite at quicker rates.

Phasmatite, like other mining resources, can be stored in an [[ore box]]. 100 phasmatite can be stored in a [[necronium ore box]] or higher. This capacity is increased by 20 at level 72 Mining and a further 20 with the completion of the [[Everything Is Oresome]] achievement.

An Invention potion can be upgraded to a [[Super invention]] by adding [[spider fangs]], requiring 87 Herblore.

'''Super invention''' potions are made by adding [[spider fangs]] to [[Invention potion|invention potion (3)]], giving 220 [[Herblore]] experience. It requires level 87 [[Herblore]]. Using a super invention potion temporarily raises the player's [[Invention]] level by 5.

The super invention potion is also an ingredient for making [[extreme invention]] potions, along with a [[mycelial webbing]], requiring 95 Herblore.

Consuming a dose of super invention will unlock the [[Blow Out the Cobwebs]] achievement.

'''Extreme divination potions''' are upgraded [[super divination potion]]s. It is made by adding a [[yak tuft]] to a [[super divination|super divination potion]], requiring level 89 [[Herblore]] and granting 230 [[experience]]. As with all extreme potions, the [[Assist System]] cannot be used to create the potion at a lower level.

When a player drinks the potion, they will get a [[Divination]] boost based on their level, up to a +17 boost at level 83. After 6 minutes have passed, the boost will reset to your base level.

No tier of [[Divination potion]] can be used to bypass the required levels to enter [[Max Guild]] garden's divination skill portals; this includes using the [[Grace of the elves]].

{{Extreme Skilling Potion Boost Table}}

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (11 March 2019)|date=11 March 2019}}
** Stats boosted with an [[extreme skilling potion]] will now be correctly set to your base level when the duration runs out.
*** Prior to this, the boost would slowly degrade at a rate of 1 level per minute.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (1 October 2018)|date=1 October 2018}}
** Players can now gather and weave [[Ancestral energy]] from [[uncharted islands]] with boosted [[Divination]].
** Players can activate the [[Tortle portal]]s on the [[islands that once were turtles]] with boosted Divination.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (24 September 2018)|date=24 September 2018}}

}}

'''Extreme runecrafting potions''' are upgraded [[super runecrafting potion]]s. It is made by adding [[spider venom]] to a super runecrafting potion, requiring level 91 [[Herblore]] and granting 250 experience per potion.

When a player drinks the potion, they will get a [[Runecrafting]] boost based on their level, up to a +17 boost at level 82. After the 6 minutes have passed, the boost will reset to the base level.

{{Extreme Skilling Potion Boost Table}}

This potion allows the player to reach some important level thresholds to craft multiple runes early, and reach levels above 99 to get rune multipliers that are otherwise unreachable.
{| class="wikitable align-center-1 align-center-2"
! Runecrafting level
! Boosted level
! Purpose
|-
| 74 (after 1.2M XP)
| 82
| 2x [[astral rune]]s
|-
| 79 (after 1.8M XP)
| 91
| 2x [[nature rune]]s
|-
| 87
| 104
| 5x [[earth rune]]s
|-

| 4x [[fire rune]]s
|-

|-
| 95
| 112
| 9x [[mind rune]]s
|-
| 97
| 114
| 7x [[water rune]]s
|-
| 99
| 116
| Increases the average runes created per essence for [[death rune|death]] and [[blood rune]]s (excluding other boosts):
* Death: from 1.309 (at 99) to 1.464
* Blood: from 1.171 (at 99) to 1.304
This effect scales linearly with level; only the maximum is shown here.
|}

'''Extreme invention potions''' are upgraded [[Super invention|super invention potions]]. It is made by adding [[mycelial webbing]] to a super invention potion, requiring level 95 [[Herblore]].

When a player drinks the potion, they will get an [[Invention]] boost based on their level, up to a +17 boost at level 52. After the 6 minutes have passed, the boost will reset to the base level. The Invention level boost can be used to [[Discovery|discover]] blueprints and increase the chance of obtaining rare [[perks]]. Someone without Invention unlocked by the tutorial will still be boosted 3 levels if used.

The [[Assist System]] '''cannot''' be used to make this potion.

'''Extreme hunter potions''' are upgraded [[super hunter]] potions. It is made by adding [[bull horns]] to a super hunter potion, requiring level 80 [[Herblore]] ([[Assist System|cannot be assisted]]).

When a player drinks the potion, they will get a [[Hunter]] boost based on their total Hunter XP, up to a +17 boost at 2,550,000 Hunter XP (reached during level 82). After 6 minutes have passed, the boost will reset to your base level.

Being hit by attacks from [[Croesus]] removes the buff.

A '''runite stone spirit''' is an item that allows the player to receive an additional [[runite ore]] when mining [[runite rocks]]. One runite stone spirit will be used up for each additional ore gained. Two are used to create a device during the [[Desperate Times]] quest.

** Instead of Runite Stone Spirits, the [[Queen Black Dragon]] will now drop either [[Orichalcite Stone Spirit]]s or [[Drakolith Stone Spirit]]s.
** Instead of [[Adamant stone spirit|Adamant]] and [[Coal Stone Spirit]]s, the [[Queen Black Dragon]] will now drop [[Luminite stone spirit|Luminite]] and Runite Stone Spirits.

* {{UL|type=patch|update=Patch Notes (14 January 2019)|date=14 January 2019}}

The '''perfect plus potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 99 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. Putting [[Overload (4)]], [[harmony moss]] and a [[crystal tree blossom]] in a [[crystal flask]] gives a 6-dose perfect plus and 1,000 Herblore experience.

==Effects==
A dose of perfect plus gives the effects of all of the [[perfect juju potion]]s. One dose lasts 4 hours. Drinking a dose of perfect plus will remove any perfect juju buffs active, and while the perfect plus effect is active, perfect juju potions cannot be drunk, instead giving the following chat message: {{RSFont|You have the perfect plus potion active, which grants this effect.}}. Despite giving the effects of the standard [[juju mining potion]] and [[juju fishing potion]], it will not remove their buffs or prevent you from drinking them.

* Increased chance of the window shortcut opening and a [[light creature]] appearing on the [[Hefin Agility Course]]
* Increased chance of finding [[Dungeoneering journal]]s (stacks with the perk of the [[Dungeoneering master cape]])
* 2 levels fewer for Dungeoneering skill doors requirements
* 5% increase to Fishing success chance
* 5% chance for double progress when smithing
* 5% additional Herblore XP when making [[combination potion]]s
* 5% increase to Prayer XP gained from a [[gilded altar]], the [[Chaos Temple (Wilderness)]], and when cleansing the [[Corrupted Seren Stone]]
* 5% chance of receiving [[Harmony moss]] when harvesting or checking a farming patch
* 5% chance of receiving double logs when [[Woodcutting]] (double cuts from chopping [[ivy]] and [[crystal trees]])
* 5% additional damage dealt whilst inside [[Daemonheim]]
* 10% additional chance of finding a [[Meilyr recipe]] while [[Dungeoneering]]
* 10% chance to gain a [[stone spirit]] of the type of ore mined (applies every ore-receiving swing, not every swing). Whenever a stone spirit is consumed to generate an additional ore, the player's stamina bar immediately refills when mining
* 25% chance of double [[harmony moss]] from a [[harmony pillar]]
* 33.3% chance of catching a [[raw baron shark]] when fishing raw sharks

==Unlocking==
{{Main|Recipe Shop}}
The recipe for perfect plus potions can be found inside [[Daemonheim]] while training [[Dungeoneering]], received from the [[Motherlode Maw]], or purchased from the Dungeoneering [[rewards trader]] after asking [[Lady Meilyr]] for details. After finding the [[unreadable page]], purchasing the recipe for {{formatnum:1000000}} coins at the [[Recipe Shop]] will permanently unlock the ability to mix the potion. The shop is operated by Lady Meilyr or any [[harmony pillar farmer]] in the [[Meilyr Clan]] district of [[Prifddinas]].

A '''perfect juju smithing potion''' is a potion made at level 82 [[Herblore]]. It is made by combining a [[juju hunter potion (3)]]<!--There is no juju smithing potion, so the juju hunter potion is used instead--> with [[harmony moss]] and grants 92.3 experience. This makes a three dose potion. Perfect juju potions can be decanted.

A dose of the potion lasts for one hour. While the potion is in effect, the player has a 5% chance for double progress while smithing. This does '''not''' consume double heat.

The effect does '''not''' affect the rate of smithing [[protean bar]]s.

The '''aggroverload''' is a combination potion that can be created by the player at level 96 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is created by combining an [[Overload#(4)|overload (4)]], an [[Aggression potion#(4)|aggression potion (4)]], and a [[clean arbuck]] in a [[crystal flask]], granting 325 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 1,000,000 from [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]] or obtained from the [[Motherlode Maw]].

A dose of aggroverload has multiple effects. It boosts [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Magic]], [[Ranged]], [[Defence]], and [[Necromancy]] by 15% of the level plus 3, and causes creatures within 8 squares to become aggressive for 6 minutes. Like a normal [[overload]], the combat skill boosts will reapply every 15 seconds. Drinking the potion whilst under the effect of a [[supreme overload potion|supreme]] or [[elder overload potion]] will remove its effect.

[[File:Clean arbuck detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Clean arbuck''' is a herb obtained by cleaning [[grimy arbuck]] at level 77 [[Herblore]], which gives 13.5 Herblore experience. Arbuck is used to create [[aggroverload potion]]s, [[extended super antifire]]s, [[stamina potion]]s, [[harvest potion]]s, and [[adrenaline renewal potion]]s.  They were previously used to make [[super necromancy potion]]s for the first two weeks of the necromancy skill, before an update changed the potion recipe to [[clean spirit weed]] and 5 [[congealed blood]].

One is also used on a [[Skeka flask (water)]] to create [[Skeka flask (unfinished)]], a part of the process in creating the [[Soma]] [[relic]].

The '''extended super antifire''' is a potion which provides protection against [[dragonfire]]. It provides the same protection as a [[super antifire]] but lasts for 12 minutes instead of 6 minutes. It is made from a [[super antifire (3)]] and a [[clean arbuck]].

The [[Desert amulet 4]]'s worn effect offering 20% chance for an additional dose when mixing [[Super antifire]] '''does not''' apply to the extended variant.

[[File:Tombshroom detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''tombshroom''' is a mushroom harvested from a [[tombshroom spore]] grown in a [[mushroom patch]], requiring level 109 [[Farming]].

Farmers will watch over a planted [[guarana seed]] in exchange for eleven tombshrooms. A single tombshroom is also used to create a [[summoning renewal]] potion. Besides this, tombshrooms primarily serve as food for [[Zygomite (player-owned farm)|zygomites]] on the [[player-owned farm]].

{{clear|left}}
==Farming==
Tombshrooms can be harvested from tombshroom spores grown within a [[mushroom patch]]. When picked, [[Farming]] experience is awarded per mushroom picked.

Players that have placed a [[farm totem]] next to an animal pen that contains an elder animal at [[Manor Farm]] will receive a [[Player-owned farm#Perks|farm perk]] that affects the harvest of tombshrooms, as outlined below.

[[File:Vulnerability bomb detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''vulnerability bomb''' is a [[bomb (Herblore)|bomb potion]] that can be thrown. It creates a 3x3 area which lasts 1.8 seconds and applies the [[Vulnerability]] effect to [[monster]]s standing in it, which increases all damage taken by 10% for 60 seconds. The bomb has no effect on other players. It can be made at level 103 [[Herblore]] in a [[bomb vial]] using [[primal extract]], [[soul rune]]s, [[chaos rune]]s, [[bottled dinosaur roar]]s, and a [[clean dwarf weed]]. Using a bomb consumes it.

At level 105 Herblore the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the bomb. At level 107 it is further improved, reducing the number of dinosaur roars required from 2 to 1 and the runes from 5 to 3 of each.

To deploy a vulnerability bomb, use the bomb and then click a tile on the ground around the mob you are trying to debuff. The vulnerability effect can fail to apply ('splash'), but as the affected area's effects linger it will attempt to apply it 3 times (once every 0.6 seconds for total of 1.8 seconds). The probability of the effect applying is based on the players current accuracy against the target. The effect is otherwise the same as the spell; it increases damage taken by 10% for 60 seconds. The vulnerability bomb will reapply the vulnerability debuff on a target if thrown again before the duration expires.

Applying vulnerability via these bombs causes aggression from affected monsters. The cast range of all bombs is 10 tiles.

To create the bombs efficiently, [[soul rune]]s and [[chaos rune]]s can be placed in a [[Large rune pouch|large]] or [[grasping rune pouch]], which can be equipped to save two backpack spaces.

[[File:Poison bomb detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''poison bomb''' is a [[bomb (Herblore)|bomb potion]] that can be thrown to create a 3x3 area for 6 seconds which applies [[poison]] to [[monster]]s standing in it. The bomb has no effect on other players. It can be made at level 99 [[Herblore]] in a [[bomb vial]] using [[primal extract]], [[clean irit]], [[poison slime]], and a [[weapon poison++]]. Using a bomb consumes it.

At level 101 Herblore the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the bomb. At level 103 it is further improved, reducing the number of poison slime required from 2 to 1 and the dosage of the required potion from 4 to 3.

These bombs do cause aggression from the monsters affected by the poison. However, once poison is applied, further poison damage does not cause any further aggression. The cast range of all bombs is 10 tiles.

The poison's damage is based on current weapon damage. To maximise poison damage, equip the best weapon possible. With nothing equipped it will do around 10 damage each time, whereas if a spell is selected it can deal in excess of 300 damage per poison.

[[File:Sticky bomb detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''sticky bomb''' is a [[bomb (Herblore)|bomb potion]] that can be thrown to create a 3x3 area for 6 seconds which [[bind]]s monsters standing in it. The bind lasts 6 seconds. The bomb has no effect on other players. It can be made at level 101 [[Herblore]] in a [[bomb vial]] using [[primal extract]], [[beak snot]], [[dinosaur claws]], and a [[clean cadantine]]. Using a bomb consumes it.

At level 103 Herblore the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the bomb. At level 105 it is further improved, reducing the number of beak snot and dinosaur claws required from 2 to 1 of each.

Binding monsters with these bombs causes them to become aggressive to you, unless the monster is immune to it, in which case the monster is neither bound nor becomes aggressive.  The cast range of all bombs is 10 tiles. Once the bind expires, the monster will be able to move again, though bind immunity only works until it takes the next step. This means that if a new sticky bomb is applied immediately after the previous bind expires, the monster will be bound once it takes a step.

[[File:Primal extract detail.png|left|100px]]
'''Primal extract''' is the main ingredient in a range of higher level (powerburst) potions and bombs. Primal extract can be made by combining a  [[primal fruit pulp]] with one, two or three empty vials. The player's Herblore level determines the number of primal extract vials they can make per primal fruit pulp. 

* 90 Herblore: 1 primal extract per primal fruit pulp.
* 102 Herblore: 2 primal extract per primal fruit pulp.
* 112 Herblore: 3 primal extract per primal fruit pulp.

[[Temporary skill boost|Temporary boosts]] '''do not''' increase the yield per fruit pulp.

The '''charming potion''' is a potion that increases the base number of charms dropped by a monster by 1 for 6 minutes. It is made at 102 [[Herblore]] by combining 4 of each of the base charms with [[primal extract]] and [[spark chitin]].

The potion applies before the effects of [[Winter Weekends]]/[[Summer Escape]] but after the [[Charm drop enhancer]] from [[Familiarisation]].

Special charms such as [[abyssal charm]]s and [[talon beast charm]]s are affected by the charming potion. However, it '''does not''' affect charms obtained from non-combat sources, such as hunting [[charming moth]]s or pickpocketing [[Amlodd worker]]s.

An '''extreme cooking potion''' is a potion that boosts [[Cooking]] by 1-17 levels for 6 minutes. It is similar to [[Overload]] in that the boost is reapplied every 15 seconds. It is made by mixing a [[Super cooking potion|Super cooking potion (3)]], [[primal extract]], and [[beak snot]], requiring level 104 [[Herblore]] and granting 800 Herblore experience.

When a player drinks the potion, they will get a [[Cooking]] boost based on their level, up to a +17 boost at level 82. After the 6 minutes have passed, the boost will reset to the base level. Using this potion allows players to cook [[Primal feast]], which requires level 115 Cooking and heals 10,000 [[lifepoints]] in one inventory slot. They cannot be reached naturally since Cooking level currently caps at 99.

The [[Assist System]] cannot be used to make this potion.

The '''spiritual prayer potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 110 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a [[prayer potion]], a [[summoning potion]], and [[primal extract]] in a [[crystal flask]], giving 850 experience.

The recipe can be bought for 1,000,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]]. Alternatively, the knowledge can be obtained from the [[Motherlode Maw]].

A dose of spiritual prayer potion has the effects of both a prayer potion and summoning potion, restoring 25% + 70 of total [[Prayer]] and [[Summoning points]] and 15 [[Special moves|Special move points]].

The '''elder overload potion''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 106 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It is made by combining a six-dose [[supreme overload potion]] with [[clean fellstalk]] and [[primal extract]], giving 850 experience. A [[crystal flask]] is not required. This process cannot be assisted by another player.

The recipe can be bought for 1,200,000 [[coins]] from the Meilyr [[Recipe Shop]].

The elder overload potion is an upgraded version of the supreme overload potion. It boosts [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Defence]], [[Ranged]], [[Magic]], and [[Necromancy]] by 17% + 5. Assuming a player has level 99 in the relevant skills, the elder overload potion boosts combat skills by +21, making it +2 levels better than a supreme overload and +4 levels better than a normal [[overload]] potion. Each dose lasts for 6 minutes, for a total of 36 minutes per flask. Much like a normal overload, the combat skill boosts will reapply every 15 seconds.

An elder overload (6) is one of the ingredients used to create an [[elder overload salve]].

{{Combat Potion Boost Table|17|5|is120=yes|class=mw-collapsible mw-collapsed}}

==Creation==
With 120 Herblore, elder overloads can be made in a batch, creating five potions with the ingredients of four potions. This is only available when the perk of the [[Herblore master cape]] is active.

The ingredients of an elder overload can be combined into a stackable [[Elder overload potion (6) (unf)|unfinished potion]] by [[Granny Rowan]] once the tier 3 [[Botanist's Workbench]] has been constructed in [[Fort Forinthry]]. Unfinished overloads can then be finished at the workbench for the usual experience. The usual potion duplication bonuses apply, but ingredient-saving bonuses do not; the master cape also unlocks a batch recipe for unfinished potions.

}}
The '''elder overload salve''' is a [[combination potion]] that can be made at level 107 [[Herblore]] after unlocking the recipe. It can be created in two ways: either by adding the ingredients for an [[elder overload potion]] to a [[supreme overload salve (6)]], or by adding the ingredients for a supreme overload salve to a completed elder overload potion (6). A [[crystal flask]] is not required for either method. Assuming a start from all buyable supplies, an elder overload salve will offer a base total of 4,610 Herblore experience. Every step of the process is affected by bonus experience and experience boosts. This process cannot be assisted by another player.

The recipe can be bought for 1,500,000 [[coins]] from the [[Recipe Shop|Meilyr recipe shop]].

A dose of elder overload salve boosts [[Attack]], [[Strength]], [[Defence]], [[Ranged]], [[Magic]], and [[Necromancy]] by 17% + 5 for 6 minutes, restores [[prayer points]] instantly and over time, and protects from [[dragonfire]], wyvern breath, and poison. Much like a normal [[overload]], the combat skill boosts will reapply every 15 seconds. The antipoison duration is not constantly refreshed, and is reduced by absorbing poison hits as usual.

If the player has unlocked the [[scroll of cleansing]] perk from [[Dungeoneering]] but does not have the [[Herblore master cape]] unlocked for its batch overload perk, it is recommended to create this potion using a supreme overload salve instead of an elder overload potion. The reason for this is that due to the mechanics of the Scroll of cleansing, it is possible to save a [[supreme overload potion]] when creating a supreme overload salve but not when creating an elder overload potion. By mixing supreme salves first, the player will be able to stretch their supreme overload potions further as a result, saving money and resulting in more experience gained in the long run. However, creating supreme overload salves requires first finding the [[unreadable page|recipe]] in [[Daemonheim]]. Conversely, if the player has achieved 120 Herblore and unlocked its perk, it is recommended to create elder overloads in batches first before turning them into elder overload salves, as this method is guaranteed to create extra elder overloads.

{{Combat Potion Boost Table|17|5|is120=yes|class=mw-collapsible mw-collapsed}}

==Creation==
The ingredients of an elder overload salve can be combined into a [[elder overload salve (6) (unf)|stackable unfinished potion]] by [[Granny Rowan]] once the tier 3 [[Botanist's Workbench]] has been constructed in [[Fort Forinthry]]. Unfinished elder overload salves can then be finished at the workbench for the usual experience. The usual potion duplication bonuses apply, but ingredient-saving bonuses do not. The unfinished potion can only be made using elder overload potions and salve potions - it cannot be made from supreme overload salves and elder ingredients.

[[File:Powerburst of acceleration detail.png|left|75px]]
The '''powerburst of acceleration''' is a [[powerburst]] potion that instantly resets the cooldown of [[Surge]], [[Dive]] and [[Bladed Dive]] and reduces the cooldown of both to 1.2 seconds (2 [[game tick]]s) for 6 seconds (10 game ticks). Bladed dive will not deal any damage for the duration. It can be made at level 111 [[Herblore]] from a [[powerburst vial]], [[primal extract]], a [[stamina potion]], an [[energy potion]], and [[spark chitin]]. Drinking this triggers the global powerburst cooldown, which prevents drinking another powerburst potion for two minutes. Upon release, drinking a powerburst potion used to share the same cooldown as an adrenaline potion but they are now separate.

At level 113 Herblore, the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the potion. At level 115, it is further improved, reducing the number of spark chitins required from two to one and the dosage of the required potions from four to three.

The powerbust of acceleration '''cannot''' be used in the [[Wilderness]].

[[File:Powerburst_of_sorcery_detail.png|left|75px]]
The '''powerburst of sorcery''' is a [[powerburst]] potion that, for the next 10 seconds after use, doubles the [[Runecrafting#Crafting multiple runes|runes per essence multiplier]]. This effect dissipates immediately after the player crafts any runes, even if 10 seconds have not yet passed. Drinking this triggers the global powerburst cooldown, which prevents drinking another powerburst for two minutes. This potion works on [[soul rune]]s as well, but not [[combination rune]]s. Powerburst of sorcery has no effect on the additional runes granted by the [[elemental anima stone]]s and [[catalytic anima stone]]s, but does have an effect on [[Arcane apoterrasaur (player-owned farm)|arcane apoterrasaur]]s arcane elements farm perk.

It is made at level 109 [[Herblore]] in a [[powerburst vial]] with [[primal extract]], a [[super runecrafting]] potion, [[blood rune]]s, and [[beak snot]]. At level 111 Herblore, the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the potion. At level 113, it is further improved, reducing the number of beak snot required from two to one, blood runes from five to three, and the dosage of the required super runecrafting potion from four to three.

Using a special move still consumes the summoning scroll. It can be made at level 114 [[Herblore]] in a [[powerburst vial]] with [[primal extract]], a [[clean snapdragon]], a [[summoning potion]], and [[bottled dinosaur roar]]s. The '''adrenaline renewal potion''' (formerly the '''powerburst of overkill''') is a potion that increases [[adrenaline]] by 4% per tick for ten ticks (six seconds), granting a total of 40% adrenaline. It is made at level 115 [[Herblore]] with [[primal extract]], a [[super adrenaline potion]], [[bottled dinosaur roar]]s, and a [[clean arbuck]]. Drinking this triggers the adrenaline potion cooldown, which prevents drinking another adrenaline potion for two minutes.

At level 117 Herblore, the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the potion. At level 119, it is further improved, reducing the number of dinosaur roars required from two to one and reducing the dosage of the super adrenaline potion required from four to three. Assistance can be used to reach the improved recipes, but boosts cannot be used.

Adrenaline renewal potions can also be made from [[enhanced replenishment potion]]s. 6-dose enhanced replenishment potions are required (which is not altered by improved recipes), and the effect of the super restore is lost.

Like typical adrenaline potions, the player is prevented from drinking a dose of this potion if they are at full adrenaline.

Adrenaline renewal potions can be made into [[adrenaline renewal flask|6-dose flasks]] by using them on a [[potion flask]].

[[File:Powerburst of masterstroke detail.png|left|75px]]
The '''powerburst of masterstroke''' is a [[powerburst]] potion that multiplies [[Smithing]] progress by ten for the next four hammer swings within 30 seconds. It is made at level 108 [[Herblore]] in a [[powerburst vial]] with [[primal extract]], [[runite stone spirit]]s, [[necrite stone spirit]]s, and [[bottled dinosaur roar]]s. Drinking this triggers the global powerburst cooldown, which prevents drinking another powerburst potion for two minutes. You get xp/progress so this can speed up smithing considerably.

At level 110 Herblore, the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the potion. At level 112, it is further improved, reducing the number of dinosaur roars required from two to one and stone spirits from three to two.

Note: Powerburst of masterstroke does not affect folding bars nor [[protean bar]]s.

The powerburst of masterstroke stacks with the [[juju smithing potion]] (5% chance of double progress), but does not double the progress for the entire strike. Instead, each strike while the powerburst is activated counts as 10 individual strikes which each have a 5% chance of being doubled.

If an item is finished with a powerburst-assisted strike, any remaining progress from that strike is lost. Therefore, to maximize progress when smithing multiple items, a new item can be started in between strikes (right click and "Open smithing interface") while the previous item is still incomplete. This can be done multiple times, as long as all the strikes are completed within the powerburst's 30-second timer. Alternatively, start multiple items ahead of time, then change which one is being worked on, such as by changing which one is first in the inventory.

Drinking the potion via the action bar, whether by clicking the action bar or using a keybind, will not interrupt an ongoing smithing project and will even allow progress to be made during the activation animation without slowing the player down. Drinking the potion by clicking the item in the inventory, however, will interrupt the player with the animation and require the player to click the anvil again to continue the project.

[[File:Powerburst_of_vitality_detail.png|left|75px]]
The '''powerburst of vitality''' is a [[powerburst]] potion that doubles current and maximum [[life points]] for 6 seconds. It is made at level 105 [[Herblore]] in a [[powerburst vial]] with [[primal extract]], [[poison slime]], a [[Saradomin brew]], and a [[rocktail]]. Drinking this triggers the global powerburst cooldown, which prevents drinking another powerburst potion for two minutes.

At level 107 Herblore, the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the potion. At level 109, it is further improved, reducing the number of poison slime required from two to one, and reducing the dosage of the Saradomin brew from four to three. Boosted levels do not count to improved recipes.

At the end of the powerburst's effect, current and maximum life points are halved, essentially making it a pseudo-[[Debilitate]] regarding damage taken. It should be used when the player's health is high to minimize damage and avoid eating during the duration of the powerburst, as eating food during the 6 second period will essentially halve it once the powerburst wears off.

'''Ground wyvern bones''' are an ingredient used to create [[super prayer potion]]s, at level 94 [[Herblore]]. Ground wyvern bones are made by grinding normal [[wyvern bones]] via a right-click option or through the use of the [[lunar spell]] [[Telekinetic Grind]].

[[Beasts of burden]] familiars can carry ground wyvern bones.

'''Third Age iron''' is an [[Materials (Archaeology)|Archaeological material]] that can be obtained through excavating [[material cache (Third Age iron)|material caches]] or various [[excavation sites]], requiring level 5 [[Archaeology]], at various [[dig site]]s around ''RuneScape''.

Third Age iron is required to restore various [[artefact]]s. As players increase their Archaeology level and use higher tier [[mattock]]s, they are able to excavate Third Age iron at quicker rates.

Third Age iron, like other Archaeology materials, can be stored in the [[material storage container]].

A '''summoning renewal''' is a [[potion]] that replenishes [[summoning points]] and [[special move]] points over a six-minute period after consuming a dose. At level 99, they restore 545 summoning points and 60 special move points in total. It is made at level 88 [[Herblore]], after learning the [[summoning renewal recipe|recipe]], from a [[spirit weed potion (unf)]] and a [[tombshroom]].

The [[Summoning renewal recipe|recipe]] is tradeable and costs {{Coins|{{GEP|Summoning renewal recipe}}}}. Level 99 Archaeology is required to excavate from hotspots where recipe fragments can be obtained.

The '''spirit attraction potion''' is a [[potion]] that automatically collects various spirits that are typically spawned while skilling for 15 minutes when consumed. It is made at level 116 [[Herblore]] (boostable), after reading the [[Spirit attraction recipe|recipe]] (which costs {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Spirit attraction recipe}}|c}}), using a [[primal extract]], an [[enhanced luck potion]], and a [[timeworn tincture]].

The potion will automatically collect various spirits when they spawn. When this occurs, the message: {{RSFont|Your spirit attraction potion allows you to catch the spirit as it spawns.|colour=#9D0000}} will be sent after the spirits spawn message, or replace the last portion of the spirit's spawn message with {{RSFont|Your spirit attraction potion allows you to catch it as it spawns.}} in the same colour as the spirit's spawn message.

Level 119 Archaeology is required to excavate from hotspots where recipe fragments can be obtained.

==Spirits collected==
The potion will automatically collect the following spirits as they spawn (it will not collect spirits that are already spawned):

* [[Seren spirit]]s
* [[Divine blessing]]s
* [[Chronicle fragment]]s
* [[elder chronicle (item)|Elder chronicles]]
* [[Fire spirit]]s
* [[Divine fire spirit]]s
* [[Forge phoenix]]es
* [[Divine forge phoenix]]es
* [[Manifested knowledge]]
* [[Divine carpet dust]]
* [[Guthixian butterflies]]
* [[Catalyst of alteration]]

The '''holy aggroverload''' potion is a [[combination potion]] that combines the effects of [[overload]]s, [[prayer renewal]], and [[aggression potion]]s into one flask. They can be made at level 98 [[Herblore]], after learning the [[Holy aggroverload recipe|recipe]], by combining one of each potion with [[spider venom]] in a [[crystal flask]]. They can also be made by adding a prayer renewal and spider venom to an [[aggroverload]], or an aggression potion and spider venom to a [[holy overload]]. 

It must be unlocked by reading the [[holy aggroverload recipe]], which is tradeable and costs {{NoCoins|{{GEP|Holy aggroverload recipe}}|c}}. Level 102 [[Archaeology]] is required to excavate from hotspots where recipe fragments can be obtained.

[[File:Powerburst of opportunity detail.png|left|75px]]
The '''powerburst of opportunity''' is a [[powerburst]] potion that, for the next 15 seconds after use, doubles the effect of [[rockertunity|rockertunities]] and [[time sprite]]s. Drinking this triggers the global powerburst cooldown, which prevents drinking another powerburst for two minutes.

This doubles the damage done to the rock when mining a rockertunity, resulting in a x16 multiplier when mining [[light animica]], [[dark animica]], [[necrite ore]], or [[phasmatite]] at 99 Mining with a [[Brooch of the Gods]] and the [[magic golem outfit]], and a x14 multiplier on other core ore. For [[time sprite]]s, the doubling applies to the precision bonus at 100% sprite focus, resulting in x12 precision at level 101+ with a [[Brooch of the Gods]].

It is made at level 103 [[Herblore]], after learning the [[Powerburst of opportunity recipe|recipe]] ({{NoCoins|{{GEP|Powerburst of opportunity recipe}}|c}}), in a [[powerburst vial]] with [[primal extract]], [[dinosaur claws]], [[phasmatite]], and [[Third Age iron]]. At level 105 Herblore, the recipe is improved, which reduces the time taken to make the potion. At level 107, it is further improved, reducing the number of dinosaur claws required from two to one.

Level 108 Archaeology is required to excavate from hotspots where recipe fragments can be obtained.

An '''extreme necromancy''' is a combat [[Potions|potion]]. When a player drinks the potion, they will get a [[Necromancy]] boost of 3 + 15% of their level, rounded down, for a maximum boost of 21 at level 120 Necromancy. It requires 93 [[Herblore]] to mix. An extreme necromancy with three doses can be made by adding [[ground miasma rune]] to a [[super necromancy (3)]], giving Herblore [[experience]].
{{clear|left}}

Wearing the [[Underworld Grimoire 3]] gives a 10% chance to mix a four-dose extreme necromancy rather than the normal three-dose potion while in [[City of Um]]. Having unlocked [[Underworld Grimoire 4]] removes the limitations of having to wear the grimoire or having to be in City of Um.

|output1 = Super necromancy (3)
}}

Wearing the [[Underworld Grimoire 2]] or [[Underworld Grimoire 3]] gives a 10% chance to mix a four-dose super necromancy rather than the normal three-dose potion while in [[City of Um]]. Having unlocked [[Underworld Grimoire 4]] removes the limitations of having to wear the grimoire or having to be in City of Um.

'''Necromancy potions''' are [[potions]] made by adding [[cadava berries]] to an [[Marrentill potion (unf)|unfinished marrentill potion]], giving 50 [[Herblore]] experience and requiring 11 Herblore. Drinking it temporarily raises your [[Necromancy]] level by 110 (1 + 8% of your Necromancy level, rounded down).

Any [[Underworld Grimoire]] gives a 10% chance to mix a four-dose necromancy potion rather than the normal three-dose potion while in the [[City of Um]], and having unlocked [[Underworld Grimoire 4]] removes the limitations of having to wear the grimoire or having to be in City of Um.

'''Overloads (3) (unf)''' are partially-made [[overload]] potions, made by [[Granny Rowan]] with a tier 3 [[Botanist's Workbench]] constructed in [[Fort Forinthry]]. These unfinished overloads are made from all the same ingredients as normal (and the same level 96 [[Herblore]] requirement), but the ingredients must be noted, and the resulting (unf) potions are stackable.

The unfinished potions can be finished at the Botanist's Workbench, granting the normal 1,000 Herblore [[experience]].
* Normal experience boosts apply (e.g. from [[botanist's outfit]])
* The [[modified botanist's mask]] provides the usual 5% duplication chance
* When a [[portable well]] is nearby, non-ironman players will receive the usual bonuses: +10% experience and 5% duplication chance (10% while wearing a [[brooch of the gods]])
* The [[botanist's amulet]] and [[factory outfit]]'s three-piece bonus have no effect
* The [[Herblore master cape]] can be worn to unlock the batch recipe, as usual
** As usual, the duplication bonuses are less effective for batches
* The [[scroll of cleansing]] and other ingredient-saving bonuses have no effect

==Creation==
All ingredients must be [[note]]d.

* Normal experience boosts apply (e.g. from [[botanist's outfit]])
* The [[modified botanist's mask]] provides the usual 5% duplication chance
* When a [[portable well]] is nearby, non-ironman players will receive the usual bonuses: +10% experience
* The [[scroll of cleansing]] and other ingredient-saving bonuses have no effect

Only the standard recipe (adding salve ingredients to an elder overload) can be used to make unfinished salves. The alternative recipe (upgrading a [[supreme overload salve]] with elder ingredients) can't be used.
